Title: Senior Performance and Data Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 37420

Company

Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the x ∑m…ôŒ∏k ∑…ôyÃì…ôm (Musqueam), S·∏µwxÃ±w√∫7mesh (Squamish), and s…ôlilw…ôta…¨ (Tsleil-Waututh) Peoples, Vancouver has a commitment to becoming a City of Reconciliation. Vancouver consistently ranks as one of the world‚Äôs most liveable cities and is working towards being the greenest city in the world. Named among Canada's Top 100 Employers, BC's Top Employers, and Canada's Greenest Employers, the City of Vancouver seeks colleagues who can help shape and embody our core commitments to sustainability, decolonization, equity and outstanding quality of life for all residents.

Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.

Main Purpose and Function

The Finance and Performance Measurement Financial Analyst II will be a senior member of a team of Finance and Performance Measurement Analysts in the City‚Äôs Centre of Expertise for Service Planning and Performance Measurement.

Interfacing with key business leaders from client departments as well as the City‚Äôs Corporate Leadership team, your work will enable the City to leverage performance metrics to support strategic, operational and financial decisions as well as support service transformation by driving accountability, improving transparency and increasing value for money.

This role will partner closely with other Corporate Support teams to foster a culture of data driven decision making across the city by working with client departments to increase data literacy, enable data exploration, and disseminate business intelligence tools and processes amongst end users.

Specific Duties & Responsibilities

Leading and participating in the City‚Äôs Service Planning process and Performance Measurement reporting including linking the Service Plans to performance metrics, budgets, Departmental workplans, and the Corporate Plan
Providing leadership and guidance to your peers within the team. Motivating and inspiring everybody to be their best.
Developing, monitoring and analyzing performance metrics, financial data and benchmarks to establish the cost efficiency and effectiveness of services
Assist client departments in identifying opportunities to increase process accountability, transparency and value for money
Providing data analysis and financial decision support which could include financial modelling, business analysis, and business case development
Creating a standard City wide methodology for benchmarking performance and efficiency
Reviewing the impact of major City decisions on service plans and performance
Developing and tracking short term focus metrics to support continuous process improvement and improved service outcomes
Proposing high value datasets for enablement through the City‚Äôs Enterprise Data Enablement process, building and deploying automated dashboards and reporting processes using business intelligence tools.
Working with client departments to foster data literacy and user adoption of business intelligence tools and processes though end user support and training.
Working with client departments to uncover and remediate data quality issues.

Qualifications

Education and Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Economics, Statistics, Business, Commerce, Business Analytics or a related discipline
Masters of Business Analytics (MBAN), or Professional accounting designation (CPA), or Masters of Business Administration (MBA)
Minimum 6-8 years of post-designation experience in performance measurement, data analysis budgeting, and financial analysis
Experience in supporting and developing strategies to support major corporate decisions and identifying performance measures to inform strategic decisions
Experience in building or reviewing highly complex financial and operational data models
Business intelligence experience, familiarity with data management, BI tools, data mining, designing reports and dashboards to facilitate evidence based effective decision making
Extensive experience in strategically answering complex business problems through data analysis, scenario modeling and creative thinking
Initiating business process improvements, supporting strategic decisions and change initiatives for a large organization
Significant experience in supporting and facilitating complex multi-stakeholder initiatives and engagements
Experience with the creation and presentation of public information (formal/informal reports, other publications) as well as engagement involving a diverse range of stakeholders
Proven ability to simultaneously manage multiple organizational priorities, projects, and deadlines

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

Advanced knowledge of performance metrics, finance, and business concepts
Strong business acumen and the ability to link financial and operational metrics
Proven ability to ‚Äúconnect the dots‚Äù and make strategic recommendations within the broad corporate context taking into consideration interdependencies among policies and initiatives
Demonstrated ability to make sound judgments in a wide variety of complex situations with no established precedents
Ability to create data models, measurements and dashboards using Business Intelligence tools such as Excel, PowerPivot, PowerQuery, Qlik Sense, Power BI or Tableau
Ability to perform complex financial modeling and scenario analysis
Ability to extract and analyse large datasets from an Enterprise Data warehouse using T-SQL or other query languages an advantage
Working knowledge of Python and/or R is an advantage
Excellent communication and presentations skills with the ability to deliver complex concepts to both technical and non- technical audiences
Superior verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated ability to work independently and as a member of a team
Ability to represent and serve the City at all levels as well as interact with customers and clients outside the organization
Excellent organizational and project management skills with ability to manage multiple tasks with competing priorities
Superior research and analytical skills
Problem-solving and issue resolution skills in a complex business environment
Ability to maintain professionalism, objectivity, confidentiality, tact and diplomacy

Where operationally appropriate and subject to change, the City of Vancouver has a Flexible Work Program. This program allows staff to work remotely 1 ‚Äì 4 days a week from locations that are a daily commutable distance from their work at a City worksite. At this time this position is eligible to be part of the Flexible Work Program.

The City of Vancouver has a COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination Policy. All external applicants applying to the City of Vancouver are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of hire and subject to this policy as a condition of ongoing employment. Candidates may only be exempted from this requirement if they request and are approved for an accommodation based on a reason related to a Human Rights Code ground (such as disability). Such a request must be made during, not after, the recruitment process.

Business Unit/Department: Finance, Risk & Supply Chain Management (1150)

Affiliation: Exempt

Employment Type: Regular Full Time

Position Start Date: February, 2023

Salary Information: Pay Grade RNG-091: $102,256 to $127,830 per annum

Application Close: February 10, 2023

At the City of Vancouver, we are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce that represents the community we so proudly serve. Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations will be provided upon request during the selection process. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion.

Before you click Apply now

Once you start your application you can save your work and leave the applications page, however please remember to submit your profile to the specific job requisition before the posting closing date.

In addition to uploading your cover letter and resume, part of the application process may include answering application questions related to the preferred requirements of the role which may take approx.. 5-10mins. Cover letters should express interest and highlight additional information relevant to the position and resumes should include a tailored summary of skills and experience related to the position.

Title: Senior Analyst, Data Management (Permanent, Full Time)
Description:
Overview

BCLC‚Äôs two offices are located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the x ∑m…ôŒ∏k ∑…ôyÃì…ôm (Musqueam Indian Band), S·∏µwxÃ±w√∫7mesh (Squamish), and s…ôlilw…ôta…¨ (Tsleil-Waututh) Peoples in Vancouver and the Tk‚Äôeml√∫ps te Secw√©pemc territory, situated within the Secw√©pemc Nation in Kamloops. We honour and respect the people, the territory, and the land we are part of.

Joining the Social Purpose & Player Experience division at BCLC means you‚Äôll be working with a dedicated group of talented professionals in Communications, Community & Stakeholder Engagement, Public Affairs, Player Health, Customer Support Operations, Business Intelligence, Marketing, CRM and Loyalty and Player Experience. As a Crown Corporation that earns more than a billion dollars in annual profit, BCLC‚Äôs commitment to giving funds back to the province is an integral part of our business, but still only one piece of a bigger picture. BCLC is committed to creating a welcoming workplace where everyone feels safe, included, and valued. For us, that means building a team that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We all are winners when differences are respected, valued and celebrated.

At BCLC, we exist to generate win-wins for the greater good. We believe everything we do must benefit the well-being of all involved. Through our Social Purpose, we aspire to make sure, in all of our endeavours, transactions and relationships ‚Äì in the most important sense of life, livelihood, meaning, and well-being ‚Äì nobody loses, and every person we touch comes out ahead.

Social Purpose is the driving force of our business, our opportunity to create a better world through innovation, engagement, and connection. BCLC aims to provide something unique that not only fills a need, but provides value to the province. Join the team responsible for telling our story, building stakeholder relationships, connecting with communities, and achieving our strategic vision for player-centered sustainable growth.

Job Summary

The Senior Analyst, Data Management supports the data management practice in the Enterprise Insights (EI) team, leading the definition of data standards, managing the corporate data assets, and maintaining the Data Dictionary/Metadata repository. This role is critical in being the liaison between business users and highly technical team members, defining guidelines and metrics for all master data assets and supporting the development of an Enterprise Data Governance Framework. The Senior Analyst, Data Management supports the enterprise in the understanding of BCLC data sources to improve data maturity and literacy.

Key Accountabilities

Supports the data management practice in the EI team leading the definition of data standards, managing the corporate data asset, creating and maintaining the Data Dictionary/Metadata repository. Acts as a liaison between EI team, Data Governance team, and other relevant stakeholders in the organization with respect to the data management practice.
Acts as subject matter expert and key point of contact for the business to ensure data requirements are assessed and understood to meet business needs; identifies business rules and data definitions; monitors and measures data quality across lines of business to provide visibility of current status and improvement opportunities; defines data profiling requirements with key stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Develops strategies and plans for supporting the achievement of business and data objectives while working closely with stakeholders.
Supports the successful development and delivery of projects related to Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Data Integration, and Data Warehousing. Acts as a subject matter expert during requirements gathering and a liaison between business users and technical team members. Performs impact analysis, development support for the Enterprise Data Warehousing team, user acceptance testing and production readiness
Collaborates and builds relationships with business clients and key stakeholder groups to determine guidelines for information sharing across the enterprise and external partners and to establish the governance principles reflective of the business‚Äô needs; advises key stakeholders to assist with their need for governance, data stewardship and data ownership.
Assists in defining guidelines and metrics for all master data parameters, and collaborates with technical and non-technical teams to build and maintain a strong data governance framework, guidelines and best practices.
Leads data assessments to identify gaps and maturity opportunities.
Leads data management best practices including leading the development and maintenance of best data management practices within the EI team; fostering an organizational culture that recognizes and promotes best data management practices; supporting and mentoring other client management and solution delivery team members; and providing feedback to management related to the best tools and methodologies to support the data management practice.
Advises team members on data availability from source systems to the Enterprise Data Warehouse.
Works with relational databases, applications, and executes SQL statements in support of data integration projects and data quality investigations.
Supports the successful development and delivery of projects related to Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics Data Integration, and Data Warehousing.
Works with the Data Architects to provide input into the Enterprise Data Model in support of Master Data Management and data governance.

Minimum Required Qualifications

Education and Experience

Degree in Business Admin, Computer Science, or Information Technology;
Certification in Business Analysis is desired;
4-6 year‚Äôs related experience in a data engineering, analytics engineering, data governance, or data analytics role
Experience in application development and/or data analysis and governance is required;
Strong experience in business intelligence tools and/or data governance;
Related industry experience would be an asset;
An equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered.

Technical Requirements

Experience with Metadata, Data Quality, Data Catalog and Data Governance platforms (e.g. Collibra, Alation, Informatica, Atlan, SAP IS/MDG, IBM MDM)
In-depth understanding of data within one or more of the following business domains: Finance, Supply Chain Management, Marketing or Operations;
SQL/SAS proficiency and database analysis skills;
Word, Excel, Power Point, Visio, and Outlook expertise;
Excellent analytical ability and a strong understanding of data concepts such as data modelling and data profiling
Advanced communication skills, both written and oral with the ability to work in a cross-functional environment with all levels of management and to explain complex information in an effective manner;
Ability to act on own initiative, to exercise sound judgment and to prioritize tasks;
Ability to work with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail;
Excellent interpersonal , time management multi-tasking and organizational skills;
Excellent conflict resolution and effective mediation and facilitation skills;
Demonstrated ability to proactively identify potential problems and vulnerabilities and apply a structured approach to problem solving;
Ability to manage deadlines, multiple tasks and adapt well to changing priorities;
Self-starter with the ability to learn and adapt quickly.

Additional Information

Effective November 22, 2021, BCLC requires all employees to be fully vaccinated (as defined by Health Canada). Full vaccination will be required before commencing employment with BCLC unless a legal exemption is obtained.
To build a rich diverse workforce representing the communities which we serve, we welcome applications from people of all colours and cultures, persons with diverse abilities, and members of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community.
BCLC values work life balance and offers remote work options for its employees.
Relocation assistance is available for successful job candidates.
If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance at any step of your application, please send an email with your request to recruitment@bclc.com.
For over more than a decade, we have been recognized as one of BC‚Äôs Top Employers ‚Äì and we are constantly seeking ways to improve our employee and player experience. To learn more about BCLC, please visit:https://corporate.bclc.com/careers/overview.html

Please Note

This opportunity will remain open until a qualified candidate pool has been established.

Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada and be 19 years of age to work at BCLC.

  • Acts as subject matter expert and key point of contact for the business to ensure data requirements are assessed and understood to meet business needs; identifies business rules and data definitions; monitors and measures data quality across lines of business to provide visibility of current status and improvement opportunities; defines data profiling requirements with key stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
  • Develops strategies and plans for supporting the achievement of business and data objectives while working closely with stakeholders.
  • Supports the successful development and delivery of projects related to Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Data Integration, and Data Warehousing. Acts as a subject matter expert during requirements gathering and a liaison between business users and technical team members. Performs impact analysis, development support for the Enterprise Data Warehousing team, user acceptance testing and production readiness
  • Collaborates and builds relationships with business clients and key stakeholder groups to determine guidelines for information sharing across the enterprise and external partners and to establish the governance principles reflective of the business‚Äô needs; advises key stakeholders to assist with their need for governance, data stewardship and data ownership.
  • Assists in defining guidelines and metrics for all master data parameters, and collaborates with technical and non-technical teams to build and maintain a strong data governance framework, guidelines and best practices.
  • Leads data assessments to identify gaps and maturity opportunities.
  • Leads data management best practices including leading the development and maintenance of best data management practices within the EI team; fostering an organizational culture that recognizes and promotes best data management practices; supporting and mentoring other client management and solution delivery team members; and providing feedback to management related to the best tools and methodologies to support the data management practice.
  • Advises team members on data availability from source systems to the Enterprise Data Warehouse.
  • Works with relational databases, applications, and executes SQL statements in support of data integration projects and data quality investigations.
  • Supports the successful development and delivery of projects related to Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics Data Integration, and Data Warehousing.
  • Works with the Data Architects to provide input into the Enterprise Data Model in support of Master Data Management and data governance.
Minimum Required Qualifications

Education and Experience
  • Degree in Business Admin, Computer Science, or Information Technology;
  • Certification in Business Analysis is desired;
  • 4-6 year‚Äôs related experience in a data engineering, analytics engineering, data governance, or data analytics role
  • Experience in application development and/or data analysis and governance is required;
  • Strong experience in business intelligence tools and/or data governance;
  • Related industry experience would be an asset;
  • An equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered.
Technical Requirements
  • Experience with Metadata, Data Quality, Data Catalog and Data Governance platforms (e.g. Collibra, Alation, Informatica, Atlan, SAP IS/MDG, IBM MDM)
  • In-depth understanding of data within one or more of the following business domains: Finance, Supply Chain Management, Marketing or Operations;
  • SQL/SAS proficiency and database analysis skills;
  • Word, Excel, Power Point, Visio, and Outlook expertise;
  • Excellent analytical ability and a strong understanding of data concepts such as data modelling and data profiling
  • Advanced communication skills, both written and oral with the ability to work in a cross-functional environment with all levels of management and to explain complex information in an effective manner;
  • Ability to act on own initiative, to exercise sound judgment and to prioritize tasks;
  • Ability to work with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail;
  • Excellent interpersonal , time management multi-tasking and organizational skills;
  • Excellent conflict resolution and effective mediation and facilitation skills;
  • Demonstrated ability to proactively identify potential problems and vulnerabilities and apply a structured approach to problem solving;
  • Ability to manage deadlines, multiple tasks and adapt well to changing priorities;
  • Self-starter with the ability to learn and adapt quickly.
Additional Information
  • Effective November 22, 2021, BCLC requires all employees to be fully vaccinated (as defined by Health Canada). Full vaccination will be required before commencing employment with BCLC unless a legal exemption is obtained.
  • To build a rich diverse workforce representing the communities which we serve, we welcome applications from people of all colours and cultures, persons with diverse abilities, and members of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community.
  • BCLC values work life balance and offers remote work options for its employees.
  • Relocation assistance is available for successful job candidates.
  • If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance at any step of your application, please send an email with your request to recruitment@bclc.com.
  • For over more than a decade, we have been recognized as one of BC‚Äôs Top Employers ‚Äì and we are constantly seeking ways to improve our employee and player experience. To learn more about BCLC, please visit:https://corporate.bclc.com/careers/overview.html
Please Note

This opportunity will remain open until a qualified candidate pool has been established.

Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada and be 19 years of age to work at BCLC.

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
Description

This is a completely new opportunity with a Vancouver-based company that is looking for an experienced Data Center Technician to join their growing team. You will be based out of their Vancouver office location, and they have a hybrid work model, so you will work in the office 3 days a week. This is a more senior role on the team, and you'll report to the IT Director.

In this role, you will be working on all aspects of their IT infrastructure; you'll be working on systems and networking, so a diverse skillset is required. They work in a mostly M365 environment, with both on prem and cloud servers in place. Some of the work that you'd be doing would include maintaining their servers, fire cables, networking equipment and policies.

In This Role, You Will

[-] Manage complex networks and configure networking equipment

[-] You will administer and manage NAS and SANs upgrades

[-] You will administer MFA systems and upgrade VMWare and virtual environments

[-] You will configure DNS servers and alerting systems

This is a full-time position that includes a competitive base salary, extended benefits, and paid vacation.

The interview process ‚Ä¶

A bit about myself - my name is Tanvi Krishna, and I am a recruitment consultant based in Vancouver, BC. I am constantly working on IT and creative roles, and I am always looking to meet new people.

If you're interested in pursuing this role, please apply to this posting. If you are selected for the next stage, I will give you a ring. This is a chance for us to discuss the job requirements in greater detail, as well as your career goals and preferences for your next position. We can also discuss other opportunities which may fit what you're looking for.

Please feel free to reach out and find me on LinkedIn by searching my name: Tanvi Krishna

Requirements

[-] 5-7 years' worth of IT experience in a Data Center Technician/Engineer role

[-] Advanced understanding of networking devices and firewalls (Fortinet)

[-] Strong understanding of fiber optics networking

[-] Understanding of virtualization especially VMWare

[ VISA / RELOCATION SUPPORT ]

[-] Preference will be given to candidates who are currently in Vancouver with proper working permission to work in Canada

[-] No relocation or VISA sponsorship support will be offered for this role

Robert Half is the world‚Äôs first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity ‚Äì even on the go.

Questions? Call your local office at 1.888.490.4429. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

Title: Data Engineer (Equest)
Description:
Data Engineer




Surrey (King George Hub), BC, 13630 George Jct #115, Surrey, British Columbia, Canada Req #1222




Thursday, August 25, 2022




We're searching for a Data Engineer. Are you searching for new possibilities?




Westland Insurance Group Ltd. has an exciting opportunity for a Data Engineer located in our brand new hybrid head office in Surrey, BC. As an early hire on a new team, your impact will be significant. You will collaborate with leaders across the organization to influence and execute on an ambitious analytics roadmap that extends across insurance operations, marketing, finance, and other departments.




Discover What's Possible, With Westland.




The Westland story is all about growth, and that means plenty of possibility for everyone on our team. Every day, Westland proves that building a great business means taking care of communities, clients, and each other with equal commitment. As we continue to open new doors, we're inviting amazing people like you to join us.




As a Data Engineer, you have the unique opportunity to lead an ambitious data analytics roadmap that will extend across operations, marketing, finance, human resources, and other departments.




Interested in learning more?




Why You'll Love Westland




An open, flexible and welcoming workplace
Plenty of opportunities to grow and learn
Autonomy to own your own success
Total rewards program that takes care of your financial, physical, and mental health
Amplifying Communities, a program to support causes that matter most to our employees




Why We'll Love You




You're curious about the business and love learning about best practices and tools, identifying opportunities to implement improvements
Expertise in building cloud-based data pipelines, ideally with Azure and/or Databricks
Deep experience with SQL, Python/R, git, dbt, Spark/Databricks
Minimum seven years' experience working with data lakes, marts, and/or warehouses
Bonus! Familiarity with Azure Synapse, experience with business intelligence tools such as PowerBI and Tableau, and experience in P&C insurance




Once Here, You'll







Be a contributing member of our inclusive culture, alongside an extraordinarily talented community of people with a wide variety of backgrounds.
Work closely with the data science and business intelligence teams to develop data models and pipelines for research, reporting, and machine learning
Work collaboratively with infrastructure and networking teams to access and manage disparate data sources
Continuously seek out and identify areas to improve data engineering practices, data quality, and processes




Want to get to know each other better? Send your resume our way.




You belong here




We strive to be much more than a great place to work. Here, you join a collective of incredibly vibrant, purpose driven, and open-minded people. Every day, Westland proves that building a great business means taking care of communities, clients, and each other with equal commitment. You will be supported and respected for who you are and for the voice you add to the conversation.




At Westland, you will feel the power of community. Westland Insurance Ltd. is an inclusive organization that values diversity in its workforce. We listen, champion equity and diversity, and create safe welcoming spaces where everyone has a voice and is free to be themselves. Westland Insurance Ltd. encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.




If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at careers@westlandinsurance.ca




Apply Now

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
**This is a fully on-site role. Hybrid/remote work is not available at this time**




RIVO Holdings is an established financial services company in downtown San Diego where respect, integrity, value, and opportunity are at the forefront of everything we do. We are excited to add an experienced Data Analyst to our team who is ready to take the next step in their career and work cross-functionally with all areas of our business to drive decisions and impact strategy through actionable data insights.




If you have a true passion for data but like to speak business, enjoy collaborating with technical and non-technical stake holders, and have a knack for building dynamic/scalable dashboards and reports ‚Äì this role is for you!




What You'll Do

Establish and adhere to best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, and validation to ensure the team is providing exceptional quality work and is continuously gaining everyone's trust.
Collaborate closely with all areas of the business to influence metric/KPI identification and data flows through to reporting and tool-building (Sales, Marketing, Product Management, Underwriting, Operations, Finance, and Accounting).
Conduct a variety of deep-dive data analyses to gather behavioral data insights in order to make decisions on new products, optimization tests, and enhancements.
Manage and optimize the reporting data model to allow efficient business decision making.
Run ad-hoc reports and develop dashboards on consumer data for internal stakeholders.
Ensure KPI consistency across data sources and functions.




What we‚Äôre looking for

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Quantitative Finance, Business Analytics, or related field required
3+ years of experience in Data Analytics utilizing strong business acumen to work cross collaboratively with various business units and teams required
Proficiency with SQL and data visualization tools such as Tableau and PowerBI to build dynamic/scalable dashboards and reports required
1+ years of experience with either Python or R programming languages required
Prior experience with Agile project management tools such as Jira strongly desired
Strong analytical background with a proven track record demonstrating an aptitude to compile data in comprehensive reports, analyze trends, and make fact-based recommendations
Experience with data extraction, manipulation and blending across different data sources
Team-oriented, self-motivated, success-driven, roll-up-your-sleeves attitude
Fast learner with a passion for BI technologies who is able to share the latest and greatest developments in the market
Confident and capable presenter of data and information to stakeholders and senior leadership teams
Proven troubleshooting and problem-solving skills and ability to communicate effectively with non-technical parties
Strong written and verbal communication skills and experience working on and communicating with fast-paced, dynamic teams




We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you will be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. A reasonable estimate of the salary range for this job is $71,000.00 to $85,000.00. Individual salaries within those ranges takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to education; experience and training; licensure and certifications; knowledge and skill sets; and other business and organizational needs.

Description:
Data Analyst I

Contract: 6-Months with chance to extend

Location: Remote ( PST hours )

Pay Rate: $39.84hr




Overview:

Looking for a Data Analyst with experience in financial planning and analysis sales operations.




Responsibilities:

This position will be responsible for: bull Supporting the day-to-day administration of the IBM ICM Varicent compensation system for sales incentive-eligible employees globally. bull Supporting the commission payout process including manual compensation adjustments calculations and approval process. bull Researching data issues running system audits and providing weekly reporting

2+ years of Financial Planning experience

Fluency in standard Microsoft software
Bachelors degree in Business Management/Administration Finance

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We Offer




A supportive and vibrant multinational environment, we accept individual differences and believe in teamwork
Enriching challenges that provide opportunity for constant learning and advancement
To work with talented individuals to develop new ideas and solve some of the most complex business challenges
Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley
Contract via 3rd party agency




You Will




Support campaigns data creation for the data products and work on sizing of these campaigns
Liaise with Technology partners to understand the data source and suggest enhancements as needed
Partner with the broader Analytics, Data and Innovation team to merge the inputs from the machine learning models
Utilize proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking to address challenges




You Have




1-3 years data analytics experience with hands on experience in SQL
Highly motivated / self-starter with a sense of ownership, willingness to learn, high degree of curiosity and desire to succeed
Detail oriented and ability to handle, prioritize multiple tasks concurrently
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to determine business partner needs
Ability to work as a team as well as independently
Bachelor‚Äôs or higher degree in Technical field with Business/Economics background or vice versa




You Might Also Have




Experience working with technology teams closely to drive execution
Background in the Financial Services Industry, with an emphasis on wealth management
Experience with Python, Alpine or DataIku
Data visualization experience (e.g. Tableau, QlikView)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: South Yorkshire - relocation assistance and package on offer

Working Model: Office based

Salary: ¬£33,000 - ¬£40,000 PA + benefits




An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Marketing Data Analyst to join a global sportswear brand. Our client produces market-leading performance products in conjunction with our team of elite athletes, coaches and sports scientists.




OVERVIEW.




Are you a talented Marketing Data Analyst with a passion for translating data into actionable insights that drive business strategy? Do you enjoy collaborating with brand teams to blend the art of the creative with the science of data to optimise results? In this newly created role you‚Äôll have the opportunity to build the data infrastructure and strategy from the ground up. You‚Äôll play an integral role in the next phase of a rapidly expanding and highly respected nimble business and you‚Äôll be a crucial player in a dynamic, creative and entrepreneurial team.




WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL BE DOING.




Working closely with the Brand Director you will lay the foundations that will lead to the long term success of the data and overall business strategy and will:




‚Ä¢ Conduct an exhaustive audit of the brand‚Äôs data asset across all available sources and report back findings and recommendations.

‚Ä¢ Report on the suitability of current systems and softwares and identify opportunities for data consolidation.

‚Ä¢ Recommend a tailored CRM, software and infrastructure solutions that will enable the business to achieve its objectives in the short, medium and long term.

‚Ä¢ Architect and implement CRM, software and infrastructure solutions and design and embed new business processes to support the data strategy.

‚Ä¢ Ensure GDPR compliance.




Once the foundations have been laid you will:




‚Ä¢ Use your expertise to turn data into actionable insights that will inform and focus the strategy and identify key wins that will drive business success.

‚Ä¢ Turn your insights into action by informing each piece of the marketing strategy; from the type of content being produced to its duration, when it is deployed and how often and how it is measured.

‚Ä¢ Clean and validate the brand's data asset and develop acquisition, retention and reactivation strategies.

‚Ä¢ Help define the brand‚Äôs key performance indicators and design reports to track the business‚Äôs performance.

‚Ä¢ Design and report on campaign performance, across all touch points (social, eDM, web traffic etc)

‚Ä¢ Conduct A/B creative testing across all channels (ecommerce site, eDM, social etc) to inform the optimisation of all communications.

‚Ä¢ Use real-time insights to measure, refine and optimise the performance of all channels

‚Ä¢ Take the lead on the brand‚Äôs eDM strategy by briefing, building, deploying and reporting on email marketing campaigns.

‚Ä¢ Design data segmentation models to allow tailored customer communication.

‚Ä¢ Design and implement an effective, engaging and lucrative trigger and events strategy.

‚Ä¢ Work with stakeholders in other departments (customer service, ecommerce, retail etc) to develop a single customer view.

‚Ä¢ Constantly iterate, measure, report and refine.




WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL NEED.




‚Ä¢ Knowledge or experience of SQL, R, VBA, Python, Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.

‚Ä¢ To excel at Excel

‚Ä¢ Proven experience in designing and delivering data strategies and actionable insights that have driven commercial success.

‚Ä¢ The initiative to work to a broad brief and identify commercial opportunities in the data, translate the data into insights and translate the insights into action in the form of a winning strategy.




Hands-on experience with MarTech tools such as Google Analytics, Magento, Shopify, MailChimp etc.

‚Ä¢ Proven ability to operate within the GDPR framework, seeking opportunities to further increase trust with the customer.

‚Ä¢ The ability to communicate complex data and insights to a varied audience.

‚Ä¢ Experience of use large or complex datasets and maintaining and developing data modelling processes

‚Ä¢ Proven experience delivering marketing data & analytics solutions to B2C eCommerce brands

‚Ä¢ Experience delivering CRO & attribution modelling solutions

‚Ä¢ Experience implementing visualisation solutions e.g. Tableau, Qlik or similar

‚Ä¢ Experience & knowledge operating across CRM, Data Strategy & Campaign Management

‚Ä¢ Excellent project management and communication skills including the ability to influence stakeholders

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Change Consultant | Junior - Principal hires needed| ¬£30,000 - ¬£85,000 | Base locations in Bristol, Manchester, Birmingham, London




Job Purpose

You as a Change Manager will work in the Business Consulting and Transformation practice, where you'll drive and embed change for some of the most complex transformation programmes within the Government and Defence sector.




Where you'll work

üèõ One of the most respected Management Consulting firms in the world, which is leading some of the most high profile Business & Technology Change projects within the Defence, Security, Aerospace, and Technology markets

üèõ Ranked as one of LinkedIn's top 25 companies where people want to stay once they join

üèõ A business that doesn't care much for hierarchy so you'll have a voice that can always be heard




What's in it for you?

üí£ Training tailored to you to help you get the best out of your abilities and ambitions

üí£ Opportunity to make a positive impact on the world and do something with a real purpose

üí£ Varied progression route tailored to you, whether that's to manage a team, focus on the doing or take on a Director level role, helping steer the practice.

üí£ Extensive benefits package including 10% pension, annual bonus, private healthcare (depending on level) + many more




The experience you'll need

‚öí Experience enabling large-scale change through working collaboratively with senior stakeholders in technology-led transformation programmes, across strategy, business design, and change management

‚öí Experience working in a project delivery environment or PMO with a good understanding of structured and agile methodologies (e.g., APMP, PRINCE2, SAFe, MSP, DSDM, Scrum).

‚öí Delivering transformational change, with awareness and knowledge of business change models, tools and techniques

‚öí AMPG Change Management Practioner qualification would be a big plus




Please be aware that you will need to be eligible to obtain Security Clearance and you must be comfortable traveling to client sites.




Next Steps: üìß

Click apply now and attach your CV and we'll be in touch to answer your questions and discuss this opportunity in detail with you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ( Excel / R / Python )

Financial / Investment

Sydney

$80-90k base plus bonus and super







Data Analyst ( Excel / R / Python ) is required to join a leading Investments firm in the heart of Sydney.

If you‚Äôre an ambitious Data Analyst with meticulous attention to detail and a passion for all things finance, this could be for you!




What‚Äôs in it for you?

Immerse yourself in the Investment World and work alongside some of the best and biggest names in this space
Work on reports for both regulators and investors ‚Äì high-impact, crucial work
Exciting opportunities to progress in your career







About the Data Analyst ( Excel / R / Python ) role :

You will perform data analytics on financial products and services to communicate metrics and insights to both internal and external stakeholders.

This role will involve using Excel, VBA, R and Salesforce to analyse and present data both on a periodic schedule and on ad ad-hoc basis in response to stakeholder inquiries.

You will develop and test new tools and data workflows to further enhance the capabilities of the business.




Essential skills for the Data Analyst ( Excel / R / Python ) include :

1-3 years of experience in Data related roles and some programming experience in either R (preferred) or Python.
Degree / PhD educated in a Mathematical related field
Excellent attention to detail and time management
Analytical and data management skills
Excellent verbal and written skills
Willingness to work outside normal hours when required







If you‚Äôd like to apply for the above Data Analyst ( Excel / R / Python ) role, please click apply now.

Keywords: Excel / R / Python / Salesforce / SQL / Investment / Finance / Performance Reporting

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Client : Department of Industry, Science, Energy and Resources

Requirements: The department is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to work as part of a project team for the delivery of the Data Management and Analytics Platform project. The successful candidate will work closely with various stakeholders, business subject matter experts, technical architects, cloud engineers and developers as part of the project, to deliver the agreed project outcomes. The project will comprise of implementing an enhanced data management and analytics platform to facilitate data warehousing capabilities, reporting, data analysis, storing transactional data and archiving of required data. The Data Analyst will: ‚Ä¢ Be able to analyse and review datasets and prepare a current state analysis

‚Ä¢ Be proficient with using Excel to store and analyse data, including formulas and data manipulation

‚Ä¢ Develop and contribute to ongoing project reporting requirements

‚Ä¢ Perform qualitative and quantitative analysis as part of the design process

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain relevant project and design documentation

‚Ä¢ Oversee and validate data and reports for consistency

‚Ä¢ Work with DISR‚Äôs data platform team to consume and implement recommended practices to ensure compliance of data and information management standards

‚Ä¢ Be able to apply judgement and critical thinking skills to problem solve

‚Ä¢ Have demonstrated government sector experience, including working in small teams

Experience in working within an Agile team is highly desirable, and experience working in an enterprise data warehouse is desirable. Relevant qualifications and demonstrated experience in information technology, data analysis, data management, or related fields would be highly regarded, including the ability to communicate data concepts to generalist audiences.




Initial contract duration 12 months

Extension term 6 months

Location of work ACT

Working arrangements Preferred work location for this role is DISR's Canberra City location. Partial work from home arrangements may be considered on a case-by-case basis in consultation with the supervising manager, subject to business needs.

Security clearance Must have Baseline

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Corporate Overview

Powering Performance Marketplaces in Digital Media

QuinStreet is a pioneer in powering decentralized online marketplaces that match searchers and ‚Äúresearch and compare‚Äù consumers with brands. We run these virtual- and private-label marketplaces in one of the nation‚Äôs largest media networks.

Our industry leading segmentation and AI-driven matching technologies help consumers find better solutions and brands faster. They allow brands to target and reach in-market customer prospects with pinpoint segment-by-segment accuracy, and to pay only for performance results.

Our campaign-results-driven matching decision engines and optimization algorithms are built from over 20 years and billions of dollars of online media experience.

We believe in:


The direct measurability of digital media.
Performance marketing. (We pioneered it.)
The advantages of technology.


We bring all this together to deliver truly great results for consumers and brands in the world‚Äôs biggest channel.

Job Category

In this role you will become an expert on optimal performance and strategy of digital marketing campaigns. You will work with fellow analysts to analyze, conjecture, and manage investigations, product fixes, and optimizations to increase our yield and support our relationships with Media Partners.

You will be required to develop a deep understanding of the related data sources and leverage them to inform business decisions. You will be required to develop a deep understanding of our analytical tools and the automation of business processes and decision-making. You will need to leverage diverse problem solving strategies and balance multiple simultaneous efforts in a dynamic and high velocity environment.

You will be expected to delve into business problems and analyze opportunities for growth. You will be a locus for understanding advantages, weaknesses, and deploying creative approaches to analytical problems; you will be expected to communicate these insights in an effective and timely manner, responding to the analytical needs of the business, and delivering actionable plans for improving our business.

Responsibilities


Develop a deep understanding of the related data sources and leverage them to inform business decisions
Develop a deep understanding of our analytical tools and the automation of business processes and decision-making
Leverage diverse problem solving strategies and balance multiple simultaneous efforts in a dynamic and high velocity environment
Dive into business problems and analyze opportunities for growth
You will be a locus for understanding advantages, weaknesses, and deploying creative approaches to analytical problems
Communicate these insights in an effective and timely manner, responding to the analytical needs of the business, and delivering actionable plans for improving our business.


Qualifications:


2+ years of experience in an analytical role is required
Inquisitive mindset that is willing to challenge status quo and various stakeholders
Ability to digest disparate datasets and visualize key trends or takeaways from raw datasets
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to synthesize key takeaways and present data-proven results
Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills including abnormality detection, predictive analysis, market segmentation, and competitive analysis.
Experience in using SQL with enterprise datasets is required
Experience in R or Python is required
Experience with Tableau or other related Business Intelligence Tool is required
Experience with automation in an enterprise setting is a major place


The expected salary range for this position is $80,000 USD to $120,000 USD annually. This salary range is an estimate, and the actual salary may vary based on the Company‚Äôs compensation practices. The salary may be adjusted based on applicant's geographic location. The position is also eligible to receive performance bonus or commission and equity in the form of restricted stock units. This position is eligible to participate in the Company‚Äôs standard employee benefits programs, which currently include health care benefits; (2) retirement benefits; (3) the amount of paid days off (paid sick leave, parental leave, paid time off, or vacation benefits); (4) any other tax-reportable benefits.

QuinStreet is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, pregnancy status, sex, age, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristics protected by law.

Please see QuinStreet‚Äôs Employee Privacy Notice here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our large gas and electric utility client is seeking a Strategic Pricing Analyst to join their team. This induvidual will be responsible for supporting the Manager with Pricing Execution, as well as the assisting the Regional Pricing Managers with various customer pricing trends and margin analyses. Duties include price variance analysis, terminal cost and customer tracking, new business profitability studies, customer contract reviews, and special projects as needed.




Must Haves:

Bachelors or Associates degree in Business or related field
3-5 years of experience in accounting, finance or marketing position that manages pricing
Experience with Excel and SAP




This position is Hybrid, 2 days work-from-home and 3 days in King of Prussia, Pennsylvania.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Experience: 4+ years

Location: Bangalore, Noida, Mumbai

Candidate should have experience in Finance/Banking/ Hedge Fund Admin.




Job Description:

A competent professional with 4+ years of experience in Finance/Banking/ Hedge Fund Admin experience

‚Ä¢ BCom/ BCA/ MCA Graduate (MBA will be preferred)

‚Ä¢ Expertise in the following tools will be preferred -

o MS Excel - VBA macros, VLOOKUP‚Äôs, pivot, power pivot, formulas, graphs etc.

o MS PowerPoint ‚Äì preparing client presentation

o MS Visio / process mapping tool

‚Ä¢ Reporting/ Reconciliations experience will be preferred

‚Ä¢ Testing experience will be preferred




Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Analyze and test Investor accounting system functionality across legacy system and go-to system

‚Ä¢ Understand basic accounting concepts.

‚Ä¢ Intermediate knowledge of MS Excel - VLOOKUP‚Äôs, pivot, power pivot, formulas, graphs etc.

‚Ä¢ Logical ability to quickly grasp requirements from the client and apply in the form of formula setup




Company Profile:

Magna Infotech is now Quess IT Staffing,

Quess Corp Limited (Quess) is India‚Äôs leading business services provider, leveraging our extensive domain knowledge and future-ready digital platforms to drive client productivity through outsourced solutions.

We provide a host of technology enabled staffing and managed outsourcing services across processes such as sales & marketing, customer care, after sales service, back office operations, manufacturing operations, facilities and security management, HR & F&A operations, IT & mobility services, etc.

Our passion for delivering exceptional services, augmented by proprietary digital platforms, has strongly established our credentials as India‚Äôs largest employer in the private sector and the biggest integrated business services provider in the country. We are proud to achieve this success as a 14-year old start-up.

A core value driving our business is constantly making the workforce more productive. Our business strategy is aligned to this, including training and skill development for better employability, helping job seekers easily find employment opportunities, digitizing workflows, and providing social security benefits to a wider employable population.

Established in 2007 and headquartered in Bengaluru, Quess today has unmatched geographic presence and scale with more than 64 locations across India, South East Asia, North America and the Middle East, backed by technology-intensity and domain specialization to create unmatched service experiences.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Calgary (MST) 8-4pm

Employment: 12 months + high possibility extensions or permanent

40 hours/week

Interviews: 1 rounds (2nd if needed)




Desired Skills and Experience *

Skills required for Role:

‚Ä¢ Excellent Understanding of Supply Chain functions and processes, inclusive of source-to-pay process

‚Ä¢ Understanding of Taxonomies and UNSPSC, as well as Supplier Tiering

‚Ä¢ Ability to normalize and analyze data from multiple data sources

‚Ä¢ Excellent analytics and data visualization experience, ability to look for trends in data, tell data stories and make recommendations

‚Ä¢ Experience in building data-driven decision support systems will be considered an asset

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of mining, chemicals and/or manufacturing industries

‚Ä¢ Ability to work with multiple priorities with various stakeholders

‚Ä¢ Self-starter, motivated, and driven individual

‚Ä¢ Ability to work in a team environment as well as individually

‚Ä¢ Technology focused mind set, with an eye on upcoming technologies, RPA, OCR, Machine Learning would be considered an asset

Technical Skills

‚Ä¢ Proficient in Power BI and/or other dashboarding tools

‚Ä¢ Proficient in ERP systems ¬¨‚Äì SAP, Oracle, S4

‚Ä¢ Understanding of cloud-based CLM tools, specifically Ariba, Fieldglass

‚Ä¢ Proficient in one or more of the following: SQL, R & Python

‚Ä¢ Advanced MS Suite knowledge (MS Forms, Power Automate, Excel, etc).

‚Ä¢ Understanding of AWS, GCP or MS Azure will be considered an asset

‚Ä¢ Fundamental understanding of classification algorithms in machine learning will be considered an asset

Day-to-Day *

About the Project:

Nutrien is building a world-class procurement function across our entire organization and operating sites. Nutrien‚Äôs Procurement Organization is a center-led/governed procurement operating model that enables a shift from a tactical procurement organization to one that is much more strategic in nature. The Procurement Organization structure is organized to (i) exact benefits from leveraging enterprise-wide spend and efficiencies associated with central and shared governance, processes, resources and infrastructure; and, (ii) continue to have the ability to execute on a geographically-dispersed basis to support the unique requirements of each of our Sites.

The Procurement Organization will include a ‚ÄúCenter of Excellence‚Äù team to provide global procurement support services that provides the insight used to develop a strategy to ensure that Nutrien‚Äôs Procurement Organization is fully utilizing its technology investments while supporting the global procurement function and adherence to Nutrien‚Äôs policies, processes and controls.

Key Tasks of the Role:

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the Data Services teams to build unified data models including requirement gathering from the stakeholders, data mapping between ERP systems, designing test scenarios and error-free deployment

‚Ä¢ Work with Supply Chain groups to gather required report requirements to build insight-driven dashboards, conduct data analysis and present recommendations

‚Ä¢ Work with the Systems and Integrations teams on various initiatives around taxonomies, supplier tiers, fleet, inventory dashboarding

‚Ä¢ Support other BU Initiatives, like Fleet, Buy Channels etc, with data reporting and analytics as required

‚Ä¢ Work with numerous stakeholders on data mapping and reporting initiatives

HTML:
Location: Calgary (MST) 8-4pm

Employment: 12 months + high possibility extensions or permanent

40 hours/week

Interviews: 1 rounds (2nd if needed)


Desired Skills and Experience *

Skills required for Role:

‚Ä¢ Excellent Understanding of Supply Chain functions and processes, inclusive of source-to-pay process

‚Ä¢ Understanding of Taxonomies and UNSPSC, as well as Supplier Tiering

‚Ä¢ Ability to normalize and analyze data from multiple data sources

‚Ä¢ Excellent analytics and data visualization experience, ability to look for trends in data, tell data stories and make recommendations

‚Ä¢ Experience in building data-driven decision support systems will be considered an asset

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of mining, chemicals and/or manufacturing industries

‚Ä¢ Ability to work with multiple priorities with various stakeholders

‚Ä¢ Self-starter, motivated, and driven individual

‚Ä¢ Ability to work in a team environment as well as individually

‚Ä¢ Technology focused mind set, with an eye on upcoming technologies, RPA, OCR, Machine Learning would be considered an asset

Technical Skills

‚Ä¢ Proficient in Power BI and/or other dashboarding tools

‚Ä¢ Proficient in ERP systems ¬¨‚Äì SAP, Oracle, S4

‚Ä¢ Understanding of cloud-based CLM tools, specifically Ariba, Fieldglass

‚Ä¢ Proficient in one or more of the following: SQL, R & Python

‚Ä¢ Advanced MS Suite knowledge (MS Forms, Power Automate, Excel, etc).

‚Ä¢ Understanding of AWS, GCP or MS Azure will be considered an asset

About the Project:

Nutrien is building a world-class procurement function across our entire organization and operating sites. Nutrien‚Äôs Procurement Organization is a center-led/governed procurement operating model that enables a shift from a tactical procurement organization to one that is much more strategic in nature. Key Tasks of the Role:

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the Data Services teams to build unified data models including requirement gathering from the stakeholders, data mapping between ERP systems, designing test scenarios and error-free deployment

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Data Analyst at Interblock Gaming will analyze data on inventory to best utilize company resources. You will use advance data tools to monitor company's operations from supply chain to product delivery. You will work closely with sales and manufacturing operations. You will become a part of a global fast growing company and help us shape the future of gaming.




Responsibilities

data analytics in MS Excel
controlling of material flow in warehouses and manufacturing
preparation of reports to support business decisions
optimization of processes and procedures in manufacturing, purchasing and warehousing operations
part of projects for control procedures in ERP systems




Qualifications

Strong analytical skills: The ability to analyze large sets of data and identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Technical expertise: Knowledge of data analysis tools and technologies such as Excel and statistical analysis software.
Understanding of business operations and how data analytics can be used to improve them.
Strong communication skills: The ability to present data and insights in a clear and understandable way to non-technical stakeholders.
Fluency in English: Ability to communicate and work effectively in English is important.
Strong knowledge of inventory and supply chain management
Experience with financial data analysis and financial modeling
Strong project management skills
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently.




Casino operators worldwide know Interblock¬Æ as a leading developer and supplier of luxury electronic table gaming products. Our multi-player gaming devices continually set industry standards and provide the ultimate in luxury interactive entertainment experiences for our customers‚Äô players.

The Interblock brand is globally recognized for diamond-quality gaming solutions and technical support in more than 166 jurisdictions. Our exclusive collection of fully and semi-automated electronic gaming tables and video gaming solutions provide casinos, racinos, arcades and gambling halls with superior product performance and provide their guests with a one-of-a-kind and unforgettable gaming experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ‚Äì London/ Remote




(Tech stack: SQL, Python, Power BI, Excel)




Insurance focused Data Analyst (Python, SQL, Power BI, Excel) sought for a well known London Financial specialising in Risk. Established for over 100 years now, 350 locations, over 10,000 employees worldwide.




We are recruiting for this role as part of a large ongoing project to bring onshore an offshore IT team.




As a Data Analyst in the binding authority division your role will be highly autonomous with responsibilities that are wide and varied including things like working closely with clients to analyse & actively drive performance to building ; data models and dashboards, data analysis for new projects, data validation & cleansing, manage written premiums, paid premiums and claim stats as well as owning the production of earned to incurred triangulation figures for all clients and insurers.




Given the acquisitions of other organisations into the group you will be also in time be introduced to other parts of the group as part of a larger data community so this is pivotal role offering a fantastic opportunity for career development.




The successful candidates with be proficient in Python and SQL with experience of insurance risk & claims (non marine) , portfolio management and possess an analytical mind set, with the ability to solve problems and work on their own and as part of a team in varying situations. Any Power BI experience would be a bonus.




Unfortunately, my client is unable to provide sponsorship and the candidate needs to be a resident of the UK.




Location: London, UK / Remote Working




We would prefer for candidates to work on a Hybrid basis in London(extremely flexible), however, as we are more concerned with getting the right individuals for these roles we would be happy to consider remote workers also.




My client is happy to pay for expenses related to coming into the office.




Fantastic career development opportunity.




Upto 65K + Bens + flexible working

Title: Senior Analyst, Analytics & Insights
Description:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we‚Äôre building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you‚Äôre ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There‚Äôs no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop‚Äîwhile staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

Instacart‚Äôs Analytics & Insights Team sits within Business Development, at the intersection of Instacart‚Äôs unparalleled grocery industry data and our most important grocery retail partners. Our grocery partnerships are at the core of our business, and this role is focused on leveraging data and analytics to influence business decision making, understand customer behavior, and drive growth of key company goals.

This Senior Analyst will strive to understand the dynamics of the marketplace through descriptive analysis, supporting the team in tackling ambiguous problems using data, and providing the both internal and external teams with the tools to answer ‚Äúhow did the business perform?‚Äù and ‚Äúwhy did it perform that way?‚Äù You will be a subject matter expert on Instacart‚Äôs data and tools in order to efficiently answer key business questions and build sustainable solutions to enable stakeholders to progressively answer more and more of these questions on their own.

About The Job

Support Instacart‚Äôs largest retail partners in helping them make data-driven decisions
Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to understand their business and develop analysis, dashboards, and reporting to address their needs
Support internal teams with data that will help them best serve their accounts and strengthen the partnership across several key areas:
Identify opportunities for optimization and growth through the analysis of performance relative to peer benchmarks
Develop data-driven business cases to help expand Instacart‚Äôs retail partnerships
Monitor operational performance to ensure consistently excellent service for Instacart‚Äôs end customers
Help prepare for weekly, monthly and quarterly business reviews
Become a subject matter expert in Instacart‚Äôs data and tools:
Immerse yourself in Instacart‚Äôs vast database and extract relevant datasets using SQL
Develop low-touch, self-serve reporting for both internal and external teams
Understand the data needs of both internal and external teams and, where appropriate, get those requirements on the roadmap for the scalable solutions being developed by other people on our team

About You

3+ years work experience in a quantitative role. This is a great opportunity for those with experience in Consulting, Banking, Analytics, or similar roles. Experience with retail and e-commerce is a plus
Advanced SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools experience required
Flexible and adaptable; collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand their goals and tailor your approach accordingly
Resourceful; ability to find answers to tough questions (especially data-related) by tracking down the right data and stakeholders
Thinking sustainably and building for scale; develop long-term solutions to recurring problems
Strong analytical skills; ability to logically break down complex problems and identify potential pitfalls
Ability to effectively manage multiple key stakeholder relationships, both internal and external, and provide guidance on more efficient approaches as needed

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

Title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we‚Äôre building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you‚Äôre ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There‚Äôs no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop‚Äîwhile staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

Overview

Instacart‚Äôs Analytics & Insights Team sits within Business Development, at the intersection of Instacart‚Äôs rich grocery industry data and our grocery retail partners. Our grocery partnerships are at the core of Instacart‚Äôs business model, and our retail partners' success is of paramount importance to us. This role is focused on building industry leading market intelligence reporting and analytics to help Instacart and its retail partners make better strategic and tactical business decisions. This is a highly impactful role that will engage in building solutions with visibility to the Instacart Executive team as well as to leading largest North American retailers.

As this Senior Analyst you will be responsible for a wide range of tasks such as defining data requirements, running descriptive analysis, designing and building dashboards, and preparing in-depth ‚Äúso-what‚Äù analysis and business recommendations. You will be able to build high-level and scalable solutions as well as have the ability to dive deeper into the data to uncover actionable insights.

About The Job

Serve as a Subject Matter Expert on the grocery e-commerce industry, developing market intelligence reports by leveraging internal and 3rd party data
Be responsible for the development, maintenance, and documentation of market intelligence metrics, including the understanding and structuring of 3rd party data, creation of new data models and analytics layers, and construction of complex yet concise dashboards
Work closely with cross-functional teams to contribute to the development of periodic market intelligence reports by providing relevant and compelling insights on market and competitive trends
Work closely with the Business Development team to understand their requirements and create compelling visual dashboards, reports, and presentations
Lead data investigations to better understand retailer performance in relation to market trends
Adhere to best practices in reporting and analysis, including data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation

About You

3+ years of experience in an analytics and business intelligence role
Strong analytical skills and ability to leverage data to identify trends and influence business decisions
Advanced proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools, particularly Tableau
Ability to quickly respond to problems independently, consider all stakeholder needs, and provide clear, concise answers to complex data
Excellent communication skills and ability to manage multiple stakeholder groups
Experience with dbt or other data transformation tools is a plus
Bachelor's degree or equivalent is required

Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.
