Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A central member of the EMEA Growth Operations team, the role provides business partners and senior Growth Operation colleagues with support on analysis of sales and client data, ensuring quality of data in our CRM and providing data-backed insights in support of client servicing initiatives. The team enables colleagues to bring the best of Aon to our clients!




This is a hybrid role with the flexibility to work virtually and from an Aon office.




Aon is in the business of better decisions




At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world. As an organisation, we are united through trust as one inclusive, diverse team, and we are passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.




What The Day Will Look Like




Sales and pipeline reporting & analytics
Proactively connecting with colleagues across the region to discuss data challenges and seek data quality updates from other teams such as country sales ops and marketing colleagues
Assisting with production of analytics and data-backed insights from different data-sources and ensuring that relevant updates are imported back into the CRM
Building and maintaining dashboards and analyses using data visualisation tools
Developing deep knowledge of data management requirements of different commercial initiatives and contributing to EMEA data strategy




How This Opportunity Is Different




This team empowers leaders to make more informed, insight driven decisions to fuel growth, and delivers advanced analytics that allow us to innovate in how we meet client needs. This role will be central in helping Aon achieve its growth objectives.




Skills And Experience That Will Lead To Success




Analytical mindset and strong data management skills with experience in processing, manipulating, analysing and presenting data are essential
Ability to be consultative with strong communication skills both verbal and written. Comfortable leading groups of people in discussion
Ability to work in a team environment and demonstrate ability to form strong relationships with stakeholders of all levels of seniority whether in person, over the phone or via email
Ability to work independently with excellent workload management and able to prioritise effectively, allowing you to develop and improve our processes
A commercial interest: Able to understand the importance of serving clients, delivering profitable growth and capable of thinking globally and acting across business lines.




In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two ‚ÄúGlobal Wellbeing Days‚Äù each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognise that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working!




Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.




We provide individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment in accordance with applicable law. Please contact us to request an accommodation on ReasonableAdjustments@Aon.com




Aon values an innovative, diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.




NB. Dependent on regional requirements, please include specific benefits where applicable and relevant accommodation criteria and enhanced equal opportunities statement.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Hybrid




About the role:

As a Data Analyst at SamKnows you will work on the internet measurement studies that we run for ISPs and Governments across the world. The reports and outputs from these research projects help to improve the internet for everyone. We use R (including the Tidyverse, Shiny, R Markdown, and custom in-house packages), BigQuery, MySQL databases, Excel for data handling and GitHub for code versioning, so knowledge on any of these would be highly desirable.




SamKnows mission is to provide impartial and accurate data on how the internet really performs so that everyone, everywhere, has access to better, more reliable internet services. We do this by measuring internet performance, analysing the data and providing insights to our customers around the world. Our ideal colleague is someone who is inquisitive, a problem solver, has experience with R, and is comfortable responding to change as we develop continuously.




We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to work within a supportive and growing team to:

Interpret data, quality check datasets, perform statistical analysis, and produce data visualisations for internal and external stakeholders.
Prepare statistical reports, working with analysts and other colleagues.
Ensure that the work being produced follows established standards.
Identify and define opportunities for process improvement and automation.
Work with the Director to prioritise business and information needs.
Be organised, have attention to details, and be curious to ask a lot of questions.




You should have:

Experience using R in a professional setup.
Experience as a data analyst, working with large datasets and preparing detailed reports.
Curiosity to learn more about the internet.
The understanding about statistics to the level of linear regression, confidence intervals, distributions, and sampling.
A keen interest to work in a small but established team, with clients across the globe.




Recruitment process:

Screening Call (20 mins)
Technical Assessment (At-Home Assessment)
Technical Interview (1h)
Cultural Contribution Interview (1h)




What we offer:

Team: Friendly team from all over the globe and a supportive company culture
Environment: Amazing brand new HQ in Bermondsey, includes genderless bathrooms, collaborative and social spaces
Pension: Pension contribution of 5% of your annual salary per year
Sick Pay: Full sick pay for 15 days in any calendar year
Hybrid working: Flexibility to work at home and at the office, allowance of ¬£312 per year for you to spend on your home workstation
Growth: Individualised career plan. And, own your personal development with a ¬£1,500 training budget and 5 training days
Family friendly policies: Enhanced parental leave for birthing and partner parents
Financial support: interest free loans including cycle to work scheme, season ticket loan and discretionary employee loans up to ¬£5,000
Holiday: 25 days holiday each year (pro rata) plus bank holidays. And an extra day off to enjoy your birthday!
Health care: Medical insurance includes cover for dental, optical, private healthcare and mental health care for you, your partner and dependents
Recognition: Company bonus




SamKnows

Founded in 2008, SamKnows is recognised as a leader in internet performance measurement, providing a research and monitoring service for internet, in-home and application performance. Over the last 14 years we have built a global measurement platform, considered vital to governments, ISPs and consumers, especially now. You can find lots of useful information about us at www.samknows.com and we‚Äôd also encourage you to listen to our podcasts and view our Spotlight magazine.

SamKnows welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional needs that require accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Experience using Python, SPSS and Excel

Title: Client Data Analyst
Description:
Client Data Analyst | Hybrid working | London - ¬£27,000- ¬£30,000

Y TREE is a rapidly growing FinTech that is re-defining how individuals and families connect and engage with their money. We aim to make personal finance transparent, efficient and meaningful so that our understanding of wealth is re-defined to how we live, not what we own.

Team Overview

Maintaining accurate and up to date data is central to our business, and underpins everything we do for our clients. The Client Data Team is integral to our ability to maintain this data which is used to produce the analysis and in turn, the financial advice at the core of Y TREE.

The Role

To enable us to provide the analysis on their finances, clients entrust us with their confidential and sensitive financial statements accounting for their balance, income, cash flow, and equities. A core responsibility in this role will be to take those statements and ensure the correct data is transferred to our back office system.
You will carry out work for both prospect clients and those who are existing clients for the firm; your work will be central to the trust they build with Y TREE.
As part of the role, you will have the opportunity to work closely with both the Client Onboarding Team and Financial Life Strategy Team to obtain a holistic understanding of the journey of the data you have handled.
This role is a junior level role, but offers you the opportunity to build an understanding of how a financial services firm operates, an understanding of the data we handle and exposure to a variety of departments that are integral to a firm like ours. We really believe in supporting our team grow and develop and see this role as a pathway to progression in a regulated, or non- regulated role.


Requirements

The Technical Part

We don't need you to have any related work history for this role, but we are looking for graduates who have obtained a degree in anything that requires you to work with large sets of data. For example, previous candidates in this role have held degrees in Economics, Maths, Physics and Chemistry.
We will need you to not just tolerate the mathematical element of your degree, but enjoy it. This role requires you to work with large number sets and we would prefer it if this is something you like doing!


The Person

We are much more interested in who you are. This role gives you access to incredibly sensitive client data, so we would like you to be mature and trustworthy in your approach.
The deeper you embed yourself in this role, the more value you can add to our team. For that reason we would like you to be somebody with an inquisitive mind and a thirst for learning- this role can be what you make of it and previous candidates are now obtaining professional qualifications and moving into our Client Adviser career pathway.
As an agile business, we often deliver projects in cross functional teams so we would like you to be warm and engaging, with the ability to build strong, well-rounded relationships.
We are not a big financial institution (yet!) so you will need to be solutions-led and have the impetus and ability to proactively seek answers if you get stuck.
We would like you to have a methodical and detail orientated approach to work- you will be working with data after all!
We work at pace; outcomes are time sensitive so we would like you to be somebody who performs well under pressure.
Our community is where our power lies, so you must be an effective collaborator and confident speaking up and working as part of a small team that is building a business.
We are driving innovation in our area of personal finance and our product is a reflection of our team. We would like for you to be somebody who is intelligent, an independent thinker and somebody who is eager to share ideas.
We operate a very flat heirachy in the business, so we would like you to leave your ego at the door. Those with a people-centred approach are best suited to us and our team.


Benefits

What's in it for you?

The ability to hone your skills and cultivate your craft in a genuinely outcome led, flexible, happy work environment. We have a hybrid working policy and the ability to flex your hours as you need. We are all adults, and we understand work needs to balance your personal life too.
25 days of annual leave per year. This is 25 days each year we expect you to turn your phone off and switch off; we would never ask you to book leave for a doctor's appointment or to see your children's school plays.
Regular team socials to help you switch off from work and get to know your colleagues in an environment away from your desk. We ensure socials are well balanced and offer a variety of activities to suit different needs so you always feel welcome.
A welcoming, dog-friendly London office with appropriate spaces to cater for those with varying needs in the form of various breakout spaces and silent booths.
Support for your mental and physical health in the form of online fitness classes and access to a gym group in London.
A 3% pension contribution to help you save for the future
Family friendly policies


To learn more about Y TREE, our podcast and our events please follow our company LinkedIn page: https://www.linkedin.com/company/y-tree/

Our mission at Y TREE is to build diversity in our teams; diversity of thought, culture, backgrounds and perspectives. Please come as you are and let us know if there are any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you in your application process. Additionally, if you don't feel you meet 100% of the requirements please apply anyway if you feel you can demonstrate your suitability to the role. Please note, sponsorship is not available for this role

Maintaining accurate and up to date data is central to our business, and underpins everything we do for our clients. The Client Data Team is integral to our ability to maintain this data which is used to produce the analysis and in turn, the financial advice at the core of Y TREE.

The Role
  • To enable us to provide the analysis on their finances, clients entrust us with their confidential and sensitive financial statements accounting for their balance, income, cash flow, and equities. A core responsibility in this role will be to take those statements and ensure the correct data is transferred to our back office system.
  • You will carry out work for both prospect clients and those who are existing clients for the firm; your work will be central to the trust they build with Y TREE.
  • As part of the role, you will have the opportunity to work closely with both the Client Onboarding Team and Financial Life Strategy Team to obtain a holistic understanding of the journey of the data you have handled.
  • This role is a junior level role, but offers you the opportunity to build an understanding of how a financial services firm operates, an understanding of the data we handle and exposure to a variety of departments that are integral to a firm like ours. We really believe in supporting our team grow and develop and see this role as a pathway to progression in a regulated, or non- regulated role.

Requirements

The Technical Part
  • We don't need you to have any related work history for this role, but we are looking for graduates who have obtained a degree in anything that requires you to work with large sets of data. For example, previous candidates in this role have held degrees in Economics, Maths, Physics and Chemistry.
  • We will need you to not just tolerate the mathematical element of your degree, but enjoy it. This role requires you to work with large number sets and we would prefer it if this is something you like doing!

The Person
  • We are much more interested in who you are. This role gives you access to incredibly sensitive client data, so we would like you to be mature and trustworthy in your approach.
  • The deeper you embed yourself in this role, the more value you can add to our team. For that reason we would like you to be somebody with an inquisitive mind and a thirst for learning- this role can be what you make of it and previous candidates are now obtaining professional qualifications and moving into our Client Adviser career pathway.
  • As an agile business, we often deliver projects in cross functional teams so we would like you to be warm and engaging, with the ability to build strong, well-rounded relationships.
  • We are not a big financial institution (yet!) so you will need to be solutions-led and have the impetus and ability to proactively seek answers if you get stuck.
  • We would like you to have a methodical and detail orientated approach to work- you will be working with data after all!
  • We work at pace; outcomes are time sensitive so we would like you to be somebody who performs well under pressure.
  • Our community is where our power lies, so you must be an effective collaborator and confident speaking up and working as part of a small team that is building a business.
  • We are driving innovation in our area of personal finance and our product is a reflection of our team. We would like for you to be somebody who is intelligent, an independent thinker and somebody who is eager to share ideas.
  • We operate a very flat heirachy in the business, so we would like you to leave your ego at the door. Those with a people-centred approach are best suited to us and our team.

Benefits

What's in it for you?
  • The ability to hone your skills and cultivate your craft in a genuinely outcome led, flexible, happy work environment. We have a hybrid working policy and the ability to flex your hours as you need. We are all adults, and we understand work needs to balance your personal life too.
  • 25 days of annual leave per year. This is 25 days each year we expect you to turn your phone off and switch off; we would never ask you to book leave for a doctor's appointment or to see your children's school plays.
  • Regular team socials to help you switch off from work and get to know your colleagues in an environment away from your desk. We ensure socials are well balanced and offer a variety of activities to suit different needs so you always feel welcome.
  • A welcoming, dog-friendly London office with appropriate spaces to cater for those with varying needs in the form of various breakout spaces and silent booths.
  • Support for your mental and physical health in the form of online fitness classes and access to a gym group in London.
  • A 3% pension contribution to help you save for the future
  • Family friendly policies

To learn more about Y TREE, our podcast and our events please follow our company LinkedIn page: https://www.linkedin.com/company/y-tree/

Our mission at Y TREE is to build diversity in our teams; diversity of thought, culture, backgrounds and perspectives. Please come as you are and let us know if there are any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you in your application process. Additionally, if you don't feel you meet 100% of the requirements please apply anyway if you feel you can demonstrate your suitability to the role. Please note, sponsorship is not available for this role

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Description

Position Title: Data Analyst

Location: London

Assignment duration: asap for 6 months

Onsite schedule: Tuesday-Thursday onsite, Mondays & Fridays remotely

Salary: ¬£52k

Bonus plan: Company Plan (yearly)







Our global Tech client is looking for someone to join the company and contribute to solutions for straightforward problems and execute the solutions to analytical tasks with guidance from more senior analysts or management.







Responsibilities under the direction of Manager




Build inclusive culture
Create space in meetings, projects, events for everyone to collaborate and feel supported. Role model, acknowledge, and empower inclusive behavior and provide constructive feedback on disrespectful, non-inclusive behavior. Act as a diversity change agent, working to change processes, culture, or other barriers to inclusion.


Influence decisions through market research and data analysis
Help conduct data-oriented analysis, architect metrics, synthesize information, solve problems, and influence business decision-making through insights and market trends.


Optimize business performance
Help conduct strategic analysis, identifying, evaluating, and recommending ways to optimize business performance and deliver best-in-class execution within relevant PA, function, or sub-function with some guidance.
People inclusion
Exercise sound judgment & take swift action to uphold our Core Values & Code of Conduct. Champion and creating psychological safety on the team for multiple perspectives to thrive, being sensitive to cultural norms, expectations, and ways of communicating. Actively mitigates one's own biases and flexes style to accommodate others while helping others to learn about new identities and cultures to expand their viewpoints and relationships.


Provide ad-hoc research and data analysis requests
Help provide general support and analysis to senior leaders for ad-hoc data requests.




Skill/Experience/Education

Mandatory

Consultative skills - Ability to understand stakeholder needs through dialogue before conducting analysis and making recommendations.
Dashboarding - Ability to create dashboards to link, report, and analyze metrics based on available data.
Data judgment - Ability to convert and/or uncover open-ended real world problems within the business context into trackable metrics or a structured analytical/statistical framework, as well as the ability to generate business-related insights from data analysis in a way that is meaningful to the stakeholders.
Experimental design Knowledge of the principles and best practices of designing experiments to address issues or evaluate impact. This includes knowledge of design parameters, sampling strategies, data collection, and analytical techniques. Industry knowledge
Marketing analysis - Ability to choose and apply the appropriate analytical methods to generate actionable and meaningful user, market, and product insights.
SQL - Code writing
Project management - Knowledge of project planning methodology, deployment planning process, and sequence. This includes the ability to understand, or to manage smaller parts or phases of a bigger project, or an understanding of how to translate capacity demand into a low-level production system project plan.
Statistical analysis - Knowledge of advanced statistical methods used to analyze data. This includes the ability to identify and conduct appropriate advanced statistical analysis to evaluate sample adequacy, draw inferences, and solve a variety of data-related problems. Storytelling and presentation - Ability to influence and inspire an audience by crafting stories using data that elicits empathy or creates buy-in. This includes the ability to prepare effective presentations in content and function, and to speak competently to the level of the audience.
Technical acumen - Ability to quickly learn the general concepts and principles in a statistical and mathematical domain, solve or analyze issues or provide useful insights, and demonstrate interest and curiosity in acquiring knowledge across similar domains.
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.

Job Description

About the role

Verisk Maplecroft‚Äôs datasets are the core of the company‚Äôs offering and your numeracy skills, attention to detail, commercial awareness and project management skills will ensure that the datasets are delivered on time to clients with the highest level of accuracy. You will be creative and draw on your domain knowledge to develop new datasets and write analytical content for data clients. As someone with strong quantitative skills, you will support colleagues in the wider Research and Consulting teams with client work and support the Sales team in helping clients to understand and use the company‚Äôs data. You will be based in Bath, Edinburgh or London and report to the Head of Country Risk Data.

About The Day-to-day Responsibilities Of The Role

Support updates to the company‚Äôs thematic datasets.
Improving these datasets by listening to client feedback, finding new data sources, and implementing new scoring methodologies.
Managing a project plan to ensure timely delivery of updates.
Supporting colleagues and clients with questions on these datasets in collaboration with the wider Analytics team.
Writing occasional data-rich insights to show the value of the data.
Using your quantitative skills to help colleagues in Consulting deliver projects on time, on budget, that meet the clients‚Äô needs.

Qualifications

Degree level (or equivalent) qualification in a subject with a quantitative element (required)
Advanced Excel skills (required)
1+ years of work experience in a quantitative role (required)
Excellent organisational skills and ability to work in a team (required)
Domain knowledge (post graduate degree or equivalent experience) in one of the following human rights, politics, environmental or climate science, economics, or commodities (preferred)

Additional Information

In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work¬Æ Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We‚Äôre also one of the 38 companies on the UK‚Äôs Best Workplaces‚Ñ¢ list and one of 18 companies on Spain‚Äôs Best Workplaces‚Ñ¢ list.

For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we‚Äôve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world‚Äôs most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable.

Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We‚Äôre 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows.

Everyone at Verisk‚Äîfrom our chief executive officer to our newest employee‚Äîis guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate.

Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other
Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes
Innovate by redefining what‚Äôs possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries

Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions ‚Äî provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions ‚Äî supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions ‚Äî offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions ‚Äî provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Specialty Business Solutions ‚Äî provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions ‚Äî delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Verisk Maplecroft ‚Äî provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.

http://www.verisk.com/careers.html

Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses‚Äô government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Amnesty International UK (AIUK) has a simple aim: an end to human rights abuses. Independent, international and influential, we campaign for justice, fairness, freedom and truth wherever they are denied. Do you want to use your skills, knowledge and experience to help change the world? You could be our new Data Analyst.




About the role



The Data Analyst is responsible for providing the insight, reporting and learnings to evaluate the effectiveness and inform the direction of Amnesty International UK's marketing and campaigning activities. The role is also responsible for managing the extraction of mailing and other contact data for AIUK's supporter communications.



The Data Analyst is also required to produce reports and dashboards, ensuring that data analysis findings are communicated to key stakeholders across the organisation in an engaging and impactful manner.



We're looking for someone who is passionate about drawing insights from data and is keen to use their analytical skills to maximise the impact of our campaigns to end human rights abuses.



More details can be found by downloading the job description from our careers portal.




The role may be for you if:



You have undertaken analysis and reporting to inform decision making in a fundraising or marketing context
You can develop and maintain reporting and dashboard solutions.
You collaborate and positively contribute to an inclusive culture.
You have a good knowledge of relational databases and a range of data analysis tools and techniques such as SQL, R and Python.
You can inclusively communicate statistical and technical findings in an easy-to-understand manner.


Our Commitment to you



Inclusion, Diversity, Equity, and Anti-Racism (IDEA) are at the core of our values. We want to be an organisation that tackles structural inequality and prejudice as well as be an actively anti-racist organisation. This means taking a meaningful and equitable approach to supporting and developing you and others during your time with us.



New colleagues receive 27 days leave annually (29 after five years), as well as bank holidays (pro rated for part time). 2-5% employee pension contributions are matched at 6-9% and we offer 6 months full pay for family leave. We offer flexible working such as compressed work patterns and job shares. See more details of our benefits here.




Apply for this role



The vacancy may be closed earlier than advertised if a high standard of applications is received. If you wish to be considered for the role, avoid delay in submitting an application.



We welcome applications from everyone and particularly encourage applications from people from an ethnic minority background, and people with a disability to help us achieve a balanced representation in our workforce, especially at senior grades.



To reduce bias in our shortlisting process, AIUK operates an anonymised application process. If for any reason you prefer to apply in a different format, or require adjustments in the process, please get in touch. We are a disability confident organisation. More details of inclusion in the AIUK recruitment process can be found here.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking exceptional, values-driven graduates to join our team as Data Analysts. If you are a compassionate, dedicated, and detail-oriented individual with excellent organizational skills, a curious and self-motivated nature, and a passion for producing high-quality solutions, we want to hear from you - regardless of your level of experience.




As a Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work with data and help organizations make better decisions.




We are looking for candidates who possess the following qualifications:




A 2:1 degree in a field related to analytical focus and data handling, such as STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) (preferred, but not required)
Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively
A love for problem-solving and the ability to make sense of complex information
Proficiency in tools such as Excel, Tableau, or Python (preferred, but not required)




Benefits




Health insurance
Pension Plan
Flexible work schedules
Professional development opportunities
Employee wellness programs (e.g. gym memberships, on-site fitness classes)
Generous holiday and time off policies
Employee discounts and perks (e.g. discounted products or services, tickets to local events)




Application Instructions




New London HR is a leading recruitment firm, and our clients will be viewing the applications for this role. Don't miss this chance to take the next step in your career. To apply, follow the steps outlined by New London HR. Upon completion of the virtual job specification, you will be able to negotiate salary, location, and company preferences.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Reference #




266430BR




Job Type




Full Time




Your role




Are you eager to help drive a culture of continuous learning and improvement? Do you have a curious nature, and do you enjoy technology and engineering? Are you organized?




Working for the CDIO Transformation Office, we are looking for a Data Analyst to help us:





maintain and upgrade our data dashboards and reports, gathering data from diverse sources including through APIs
identify opportunities to improve, simplify and automate our processes and analytics
collect and organize information for monitoring and reviews within the Certified Engineers program
leverage technologies to support our engineering excellence initiatives
engage with colleagues at all levels to meet business requirements
provide general administrative support to the team





Your team




You will be working for the CDIO Transformation Office, focusing on the Distinguished Engineers framework, Certified Engineers program, and additional engineering excellence initiatives. You will have the opportunity to collaborate and network with engineers from across CDIO functions and regions. As an analyst, you will play a key role in supporting culture change in CDIO.




Your expertise





a university degree in an analytical field, such as engineering, computer science/ information technology or finance
hands-on experience with data analysis and data visualization
a background and understanding of common reporting tools and disciplines (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI)
strong analytical, problem-solving, and synthesizing skills
Programming skills (e.g. Python)
awareness of user experience and design principles
a proactive, detail-oriented, and methodical approach to your work
motivation and the ability to work independently and apply own initiative
strong communication skills
fluency in English





About Us




UBS is the world‚Äôs largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.




With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?




How We Hire




This role requires an assessment on application. Learn more about how we hire: www.ubs.com/global/en/careers/experienced-professionals.html




Join us




At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.




From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we‚Äôre more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?

UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Title: Data Analyst - BBC World Service
Description:
Job Introduction




The BBC World Service has partnered with the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation in an ambitious project to deliver compelling stories across digital and broadcast platforms on the theme of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) with a specific focus on ten African countries: Nigeria, Kenya, Zambia, Uganda, Ghana, Burkina Faso, Ethiopia, Niger, Senegal and Tanzania. We are looking to recruit a data analyst, who will be responsible for producing impact and audience reports, and supporting the smooth and effective running of the partnership project. They will work alongside the production teams in London, Lagos, and Nairobi, and keep abreast of all content produced and published on BBC platforms. They will oversee the social and digital output as well, and help ensure optimum impact and reach for this project. This is a fantastic opportunity for a talented data analyst/impact producer to join the team and create great content.




This is an 18-month fixed term contract. The team is based in London but we would be happy to consider applications from other locations. The BBC is committed to redeploying employees seeking suitable alternative employment within the BBC for different reasons and they will be given priority consideration ahead of other applicants. Priority consideration means for those employees seeking redeployment their application will be considered alongside anyone else at risk of redundancy, prior to any individuals being considered who are not at risk.




Role Responsibility




Monitor and audit the performance of assets which have been published across BBC and social media platforms using such tools as Emplifi, Facebook insights and BBC measurement tools.




Develop and maintain documentation, presenting complex data in accessible formats. This may include the partner‚Äôs custom trackers, internal documentation or project specific detail.




Use social media listening tools such as Brandwatch and Crowdtangle and search data to find the most compelling stories, topics and relevant audience profiles.




Are you the right candidate?




Specific Skills & Experience




Experience of using digital and social media analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Emplifi.
Proficiency in a data wrangling/analysis language e.g. R, Python.
Data visualisation principles and the ability to construct a narrative from data insight.
Ability to work in cross-disciplinary teams, collaborating with a variety of analysts and researchers.
Strong technical aptitude, with an interest in learning/improving programming skills that you will use every day.




Ideal Candidates Will Also Demonstrate Any Of The Following




Familiarity with SQL and data warehouses (e.g. Redshift)
Experience of using digital analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, AT Internet)
Experience with data visualisation tools e.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, other
Understanding of media analytics, data, measurement, methodologies and industry standards including online and offline channels
Knowledge and experience of digital media




Package Description




Band: C




Contract type: 18 Months FTC/ Attachment - June 2024




Location: London - NBH, but can be flexible (hybrid working available)




We‚Äôre happy to discuss flexible working. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application . There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at offer stage.




Excellent career progression ‚Äì the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
Unrivalled training and development opportunities ‚Äì our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certification.
Benefits - We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (1 of which is a corporation day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more.




About The BBC




We don‚Äôt focus simply on what we do ‚Äì we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure you‚Äôve read about our values and behaviours in the document attached below.




Diversity matters at the BBC. We have a working environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution, enabling all of our employees to thrive and achieve their full potential.




We want to attract the broadest range of talented people to be part of the BBC ‚Äì whether that‚Äôs to contribute to our programming or our wide range of non-production roles. The more diverse our workforce, the better able we are to respond to and reflect our audiences in all their diversity.




We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles, unless operational requirements prevent otherwise.




To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please click here




Attached documents




BBC Values

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a recent numerical graduate looking to build on your foundation experience and take the next step to become a data analyst? Do you have a passion for using data to solve problems?




If so, we would like to hear from you; we are a fintech start-up offering a rare development environment working closely with an experienced senior management team.




Opportunity




Reporting directly to the co-founders, you will join an entrepreneurial team in a driven, fast-paced environment. This role is a newly created role responsible for supporting the development and further build-out of our platform integrations which are used to acquire, clean and analyse investment data from a range of UK wealth platforms.




We can offer a challenging and constantly evolving career where you will have an impact and develop new skills and knowledge in software development or data analysis.




About The Role




We offer first-hand experience in obtaining, cleaning, transforming and analysing complex investment data with exposure to various wealth managers and other major financial services clients.




The role will include the following:




Monitoring daily data feeds and handling related data processing tasks
Supporting other developers to add new data feeds and build out API connections
Supporting design, implementation and testing of complex analysis and tax calculations
Attendance at client meetings, pitches and dealing with follow-up
Researching relevant technical issues (e.g. data processing technical solutions, new third-party API specifications and tax or performance analysis-related research)
Assisting with special projects





Additional Information




The position is based in our Soho office.




Salary & Benefits




Basic salary: c.¬£30,000, increasing with progression
Holiday 20 days, increasing with longevity
Axa Private Health
Pension
Discretionary Bonuses
Training / Exam support





Essential Criteria




Recently graduated or demonstrate 1-2 years of relevant experience
Strong analytical skills.
Background with mathematical and/or computer science skills will be an advantage.
Knowledge of SQL and/or Python (in particular Pandas)
Unrestricted rights to work in the UK





Desirable Criteria




Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proven team player who is happy to adapt to a wide range of roles and deal with clients, third-party developers, platforms and service providers;
Self-starter and able to stay focused and make decisions within the role profile while working towards tight deadlines
Independent/flexible problem-solver with the ability to cope positively with change
Familiarity with AWS an advantage





About The Company




Confidante is a start-up fintech that aims to revolutionise data integration, analysis and tax reporting for high-net-worth clients of wealth managers and accountants by simplifying workflow and reporting.




We are a former Barclays senior leadership team offering a cloud-hosted application which obtains, cleans and conforms data from a wide range of third-party financial institutions and provides wealth managers with consolidated performance, analysis and tax reporting.




Please view our website for more information about our company and philosophy.




Keywords: Data Scientist, Data Engineer, Analytics Manager, Business Intelligence Analyst, Operations Analyst, Research Analyst and Data Manager,




NO AGENCIES PLEASE




We are using Recruitment Rebellion to run and organise the response for this advert. Please do not contact us if you are a recruiter.




Candidates, please do not apply directly to us, as there is a chance your application will be missed if it does not go through the right channel.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Townhouse

Townhouse was created with a single goal: to disrupt and reinvent the global nail salon industry. We are the fastest growing beauty brand in the UK and are driven by a passionate and disruptive team in achieving our mission. We grew 300% last year and that‚Äôs just the beginning!

We‚Äôve brought together a world class team from a wide range of industries. And as we‚Äôre growing extremely fast, we need brilliant people (like you!) - to join us on our journey and help us deliver our goal.




Reporting directly to the CTO, you will be an experienced Analyst who has a track record in delivering excellent results. Working alongside an experienced Team, you will be assisting with all areas of the business to build and grow the Data function and team.




Your responsibilities include (but are not limited too):

Conducting full life cycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design
Developing our data science function and frameworks from scratch - having a wide range to choose the right technologies, framework and processes needed to achieve world class results
Building sophisticated predictive models to support our operations, acquisition and marketing teams
Building out our analysis and reporting capabilities
Working with complex datasets to extract valuable business insights, and work with other stakeholders across the business to understand business needs, and turn these insights into strategic actions
Monitoring performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.




Qualifications:

BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics (or other data science type course)
Experience in Data models, database design, data mining & segmentation
Experience with programming languages such as Python, R, Javascript, SQL
A sound knowledge of statistics and statistical packages for analysing datasets
Very strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at report writing and presenting findings.
Excellent communication skills, and ability to work with a range of technical and non-technical stakeholders across the business, up to the C-Suite.




Benefits

Competitive salary
Scope for rapid career progression
Hybrid working environment (on agreement with managers)
‚ÄúTownhouse Perks‚Äù comprehensive benefits package




Work

Full time, 40 hours / week
Right to work in UK required
Office based in Tottenham Court Road

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You will join the team in delivering insight and analysis which allow ClearScore to rapidly scale and deliver a seamless experience for our users. Analysts play a key role within ClearScore, driving strategy and key decision-making, which ultimately benefits our users, partners, and other teams within the business.




ClearScore has an amazing analytical community which includes Data Analysts, Scientists and Engineers. The community works collaboratively to ensure a landscape in which team members can develop their full potential and deliver maximum business impact.




ClearScore is both a free credit score and report service and the UK's leading consumer credit marketplace. Working in the Marketplaces Analytics team, you will play a key role in monitoring and reporting on marketplace performance; supporting the commercial and product teams to run experiments and improve UX and monetisation and supporting the marketplaces leadership team in developing the overall strategy.




Responsibilities




Build out new monitoring and reporting dashboards, using SQL and Domo
Work closely with our commercial team to help them understand the performance of each of our partners
Analyse AB tests and experiments to enable us to continuously improve the marketplace and user experience
Deliver in-depth analytics projects, using data to identify opportunities and to analyse and solve complex business problems
Support the ongoing growth of the marketplace, including carrying out analysis needed to launch new products, improve existing products and unlock growth across verticals




Requirements




You must possess advanced SQL and Excel skills. Knowledge of Python and analytical tools such as Amplitude is a plus
Experience using Domo or other data visualisation tools such as Tableau
Ability to plan and prioritise your own workload and that of your team
Previous managerial experience is highly desirable, but not essential
You have a desire to learn and enjoy working collaboratively, with a desire to contribute to our culture.
You do not need to fit into a stereotype: we are really committed to closing our gender gap and are actively trying to create an environment where you, as an individual, can thrive.
Strong quantitative and numerical skills




About ClearScore




ClearScore is a workplace like no other. We've spent the past seven years disrupting an entire industry and building a user base of millions. At the heart of this success is our culture, where we work hard, relish change and treat each other with respect‚Äîhelping everyone to reach their potential and deliver results that make a difference. We're on a mission to positively impact the lives of our users. Our product puts their needs at the centre of our thinking. Through cutting-edge tech, insightful analytics and beautiful design we want to help our users build their financial confidence and make better financial decisions. We want our people to perform at their best, so we trust everyone to work in a way that suits them‚Äîfocusing on output, not time spent at a screen. We have an inclusive culture where everyone is encouraged to look after their own wellbeing whilst growing and developing their career. For more information on our tech stack check out our Tech Radar 2022, how we work is summarised in our Engineering Principles and we have many other Tech Blogs on Medium.




Benefits




25 paid holidays and a "duvet day" on your birthday
Private health and dental cover
GP office visits
Life assurance scheme
Up to 6% matched pension
Brown bags with guest speakers
Access to Perkbox
Dog-friendly office
Daily breakfast and free snacks
Free sports and social clubs
Generous training allowance
Fast progression
Leadership-led training
Regular wellbeing events
In-house psychotherapist
Financial coach to help you plan and achieve your goals
Physical and mental health support through BUPA
No clock-watching culture
Generous maternity and paternity plans
Culture and inclusion representatives




Inclusion Policy




We are always looking for talented individuals to join ClearScore. We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. Please see our People Policy Notice at https://www.clearscore.com/people-notice.
Show more Show less

You will join the team in delivering insight and analysis which allow ClearScore to rapidly scale and deliver a seamless experience for our users. Analysts play a key role within ClearScore, driving strategy and key decision-making, which ultimately benefits our users, partners, and other teams within the business.


ClearScore has an amazing analytical community which includes Data Analysts, Scientists and Engineers. The community works collaboratively to ensure a landscape in which team members can develop their full potential and deliver maximum business impact.


ClearScore is both a free credit score and report service and the UK's leading consumer credit marketplace. Working in the Marketplaces Analytics team, you will play a key role in monitoring and reporting on marketplace performance; supporting the commercial and product teams to run experiments and improve UX and monetisation and supporting the marketplaces leadership team in developing the overall strategy.


Responsibilities


  • Build out new monitoring and reporting dashboards, using SQL and Domo
  • Work closely with our commercial team to help them understand the performance of each of our partners
  • Analyse AB tests and experiments to enable us to continuously improve the marketplace and user experience
  • Deliver in-depth analytics projects, using data to identify opportunities and to analyse and solve complex business problems
  • Support the ongoing growth of the marketplace, including carrying out analysis needed to launch new products, improve existing products and unlock growth across verticals


Requirements


  • You must possess advanced SQL and Excel skills. Knowledge of Python and analytical tools such as Amplitude is a plus
  • Experience using Domo or other data visualisation tools such as Tableau
  • Ability to plan and prioritise your own workload and that of your team
  • Previous managerial experience is highly desirable, but not essential
  • You have a desire to learn and enjoy working collaboratively, with a desire to contribute to our culture.
  • You do not need to fit into a stereotype: we are really committed to closing our gender gap and are actively trying to create an environment where you, as an individual, can thrive.
  • Strong quantitative and numerical skills


About ClearScore


ClearScore is a workplace like no other. We've spent the past seven years disrupting an entire industry and building a user base of millions. At the heart of this success is our culture, where we work hard, relish change and treat each other with respect‚Äîhelping everyone to reach their potential and deliver results that make a difference. We're on a mission to positively impact the lives of our users. Our product puts their needs at the centre of our thinking. Through cutting-edge tech, insightful analytics and beautiful design we want to help our users build their financial confidence and make better financial decisions. We want our people to perform at their best, so we trust everyone to work in a way that suits them‚Äîfocusing on output, not time spent at a screen. We have an inclusive culture where everyone is encouraged to look after their own wellbeing whilst growing and developing their career. For more information on our tech stack check out our Tech Radar 2022, how we work is summarised in our Engineering Principles and we have many other Tech Blogs on Medium.


Benefits


  • 25 paid holidays and a "duvet day" on your birthday
  • Private health and dental cover
  • GP office visits
  • Life assurance scheme
  • Up to 6% matched pension
  • Brown bags with guest speakers
  • Access to Perkbox
  • Dog-friendly office
  • Daily breakfast and free snacks
  • Free sports and social clubs
  • Generous training allowance
  • Fast progression
  • Leadership-led training
  • Regular wellbeing events
  • In-house psychotherapist
  • Financial coach to help you plan and achieve your goals
  • Physical and mental health support through BUPA
  • No clock-watching culture
  • Generous maternity and paternity plans
  • Culture and inclusion representatives


Inclusion Policy


We are always looking for talented individuals to join ClearScore. We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. Please see our People Policy Notice at https://www.clearscore.com/people-notice.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Reference #




264662BR




Job Type




Full Time




Your role




Are you an analytical thinker and data-driven problem-solver? Do you know how to gather and translate business requirements, working with large risk datasets and own these solutions through to implementation? Would you like to work in a truly collaborative environment to find effective and efficient solutions to the reporting needs of our risk business?




We are looking for a Data Analyst like you to:





capture and translate the risk reporting requirements we need to meet regulatory and business change initiatives
work with key stakeholders such as IT, data owners, risk reporting officers & associates plus our business sponsors to create high quality reports and dashboards
provide innovative, robust solutions which contain clear insight and highlights reflecting the status and/or changes in our risk
create the sub-tasks needed to deliver these reporting solutions, allocate the tasks to the appropriate teams and then track to completion
support our business to embed these solutions into live and ensure that we are achieving the full business value from these reports and dashboards
drive standardization, automation and continuous improvements of data collection, analysis, and reporting processes





Your team





you will be working as part of a global team responsible for providing reporting analysis to our business colleagues
you‚Äôll be part of the newly created Agile pods and have the opportunity to play a critical role in enabling the high-paced Agile transformation
our team is part of the wider Group Risk Control organization and is an agent of change for our Risk Control colleagues. We are a diverse team of specialists with different backgrounds and we enjoy finding and implementing first-rate solutions for our business





Your expertise





degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Technology or equivalent
ideally 5 years of experience working in a similar role within the banking industry, preferably in credit and/or market risk
proven experience using Business Intelligence and reporting software and data visualization (e.g. Power BI, MicroStrategy, Tableau)
technical skills are an advantage, including Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Experience with SQL, Python or similar languages
confident communicator able to convey information and ideas clearly, good at building relationships across geographically distributed teams
strong customer focus and passion to enable data-driven decision-making and improvements
effective time management and ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously
attention to detail along with structured organization and planning skills





About Us




UBS is the world‚Äôs largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.




With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?




Join us




At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.




From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we‚Äôre more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?




Disclaimer / Policy Statements




UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: West End, London (hybrid working)

Salary: ¬£40000 - ¬£50000 depending on experience

Bonus: 20-30% of salary




Company: Global FinTech SaaS company that works with private equity / credit and real estate investors. They provide data science that provides insights into client‚Äôs portfolios. Investors make important decisions and produce significant returns based on the data from the platform.




Job role: The Data Analyst will provide financial analytics to support clients, including significant focus on financial modelling / statistical analysis for alternative investors & financial services companies, as well as supporting on-going performance reporting and monitoring.




Responsibilities:




Performance Analysis

¬∑ Development of Asset Management analytics across many geographies and asset types

¬∑ Maintenance and on-going development of models used to analyse performance, refine key assumptions, re-forecast cash flows and update valuations

¬∑ Monitor and analyse credit and service performance of portfolio investments, including forecasts and key covenants tests

¬∑ Deliver analytics to support optimisation of performance, aimed at improving returns as well as managing risks

¬∑ Monitor and assist in the preparation of internal / investor reports

Investment Analysis and Transactional Support

¬∑ Build financial models to assess the value and review risk of potential investments, incorporating asset-based cash flow and credit risk analysis

¬∑ Prepare investment analysis, including asset level analysis and risk-based simulations for presentation to internal / external constituents

¬∑ Assist in broader market research and source external benchmark data

Experience:

¬∑ Experience working in the analytics function of a data driven company preferably within the financial services sector.

¬∑ Experience using R and Python to interrogate large datasets and undertake complex behavioural analysis.

¬∑ Hands-on experience designing, building, and implementing statistical models to predict consumer behaviour.

¬∑ Numerical degree, preferably at a Masters level (i.e. mathematics, science, engineering or economics). Batchelor‚Äôs degree will be considered.

¬∑ Development and improvement of data to support continuous evolution of a more competitive analysis

¬∑ Data modelling, profiling and cleansing techniques.

¬∑ Experience translating data from multiple sources (from different countries/language) and map them to UK standardised data

Desirable:

¬∑ Familiarity with Microsoft technology stack, including data integration, collaboration and business Intelligence tools and their underlying technologies (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, SharePoint, Visual Studio and TFS).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Quality Analyst | London | Hybrid | ¬£40,000 - ¬£45,000 + 15% bonus

Are you looking to take the next step in your career as a Data Analyst?

Do you want to join an established and expanding pharmaceutical distribution company, serving patients globally to ensure they‚Äôre receiving the medicines they require?

Do you want to be a part of an organisation that is working on greenfield projects?




What you‚Äôll be doing:

üí• You‚Äôll be joining a newly formed data governance team ‚Äì a chance to grow into this role and make it your own

üí• Supporting the business with their data quality ‚Äì identifying the gaps and providing solutions

üí• Working closely with the Data Quality Manager & stakeholders to promote best practices & recommendations




What you‚Äôll need:

‚úÖ 2-3 years‚Äô commercial experience as a data quality analyst / data analyst

‚úÖ Hands on experience working with SQL & data viz tools (e.g Power BI)

‚úÖ Understanding of data quality & best practices

‚úÖ Experience with Alteryx or equivalent is a plus!




What to expect in return:

‚ö°Ô∏è Flexible hybrid working model ‚Äì 2 days a week to the London office

‚ö°Ô∏è Learning & development ‚Äì you‚Äôll have time spent during the week for upskilling

‚ö°Ô∏è A base salary ranging from ¬£40,000 - ¬£45,000 + 15% bonus

‚ö°Ô∏è Juicy benefits like 27 days holidays + 4.5% pension match




Next steps:

Hit apply and we‚Äôll be in touch to go through your experience and discuss the opportunity & client in more detail with you.

As an employer and service provider, we are committed to Equity, Equality, Diversity and Inclusion. Please feel comfortable to let us know if you have a difference or disability that would require us or our clients to make any helpful adjustments for you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Salary: Up to ¬£40,000pa




About the role

The Data Analyst is a critical role within RWS Group Technology as the organization moves towards being more data and analytics driven. This change in organisational construct is driving the need to review, rationalize & refine the currently diverse operating models within the organisation. You will be responsible for defining and governing the group data model, global data catalogue and data management strategy.




You will be seen as a trusted advisor on behalf of data across the organisation with development operations, business applications and IT.




This is a growing team with a high bar in terms of inviting new people to join us. We seek people who will help drive our business forward and challenge norms by striving for more. Aside from your skills and experience, we‚Äôre most interested in your growth mindset and development potential.




This is a full-time role that‚Äôs based in one of our European offices, but we expect to maintain a culture of flexibility and a mix of WFH and office time.







What you‚Äôll do

Work with a vast array of data sources including translation, operational & financial to develop data processes and models which support our insight goals
Develop and maintain our group data model in line with our long-term business objectives
Providing technical leadership and direction for the companies engineering team
Advise on duplications & conflicts within the data models of the RWS Group (originating from the different entities) and identify practical solutions for aligning the data models.
Support the alignment of data governance across the RWS group and enforce through solution reviews and audits
Provide guidance as to how data quality and meta data management should be embedded in business processes & systems
Building effective relationships with senior technical staff so there is a common understanding of goals and challenges







What we‚Äôre looking for

Recent, working experience in a Data Analyst role
Experience with assessing and implementing enterprise-wide meta data management tools, data models and data catalogues
Expertise in SQL & SSIS is essential
Strong English communication skills
An expert understanding of data integration
Knowledge of information principles and policies
Strategic mind-set with the ability to focus on the ‚Äúbigger picture‚Äù
Experience in integrating complex and cross-corporate processes
Analytical skills ‚Äî Outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities
Experience with data visualization in a tool such as Tableau, Business Objects, Power BI, Sisense is a bonus
Experience working with Cloud Based solutions is a bonus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üìäüìàüìâ Data Analyst | Global Brand | 50 Million Customers| ¬£50,000 - ¬£60,000 üìâüìàüìä




üåç Hybrid with offices in London

üèÜ Multiple Awards

üìà Steep Learning Curve

‚úàÔ∏è Unlimited holidays




This well-known, hugely successful brand is a unique group of companies that is changing businesses for good, giving customers choice and better service and having fun along the way !




(and I mean a lot of fun) üèèüéÆ




They are now on the hunt for a talented Data Analyst to join their dynamic team of data wizards üßô




They are a fast growing and an exciting company that rewards innovation and hard work. Their goal is to make a difference in the world and also for the customer through data driven decisions and actions.




The role




If you are Data Analyst that wants more than just building reports to pass on to someone else then this is the next role for you. You would help to lead the way in driving data in a positive direction across all areas of the business , not just building reports but actually owning the insights attached to them !




If you enjoy the discovery phase all the way through to unlocking key insights for a business then this is the next data analyst role for you !

‚úîÔ∏è Strong business acumen , understanding the impact that deriving insights have

‚úîÔ∏è Great communication skills and comfortable speaking to technical and non-technical stakeholders




If you feel like working for a brand known all over the globe , want to take on a steep learning curve but also have crazy amounts of fun then this is the next Data Analyst role for you !




Apply now !

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄüöÄ 'Data Analyst' üöÄüöÄ




¬£50K-¬£60K - London, 2 Days per week. -










The Role..




- Working with data sets, to identify improvements to business process




- Presenting Data




- Producing Visual data stories.




Must be capable of working with Tableau







A bit about us...




At Chumley, we are working hard to scale an industry-leading Proptech platform. Recently celebrating 12 months since our launch, and having completed over 80,000 jobs. We are now moving onto phase 3 of our Road Map.




Our digital squad of 22, is made up of Product Owners, Designers and Developers, and aiming to double in size within the next 6 months.




We are very proud to have a well-balanced team, made up of characters from 14 different nations. Part of our recruitment & onboarding program is to ensure that all candidates have the opportunity to meet with any of our team members they choose, for honest conversations about their roles and opportunities. We are confident that our entire team is engaged and supportive of our

collaboration & growth policies and truly believes in the future of our product.




Our office is based in SW London, and this role will require 2 days per week in our offices, alongside your colleagues.




When in our HQ, we work together, eat together, and listen to music together. So we're hoping to find someone who is kind, full of life and enjoys a joke.




If you would like to know more, please message me directly. Or feel free to contact any of my team. We enjoy meeting new people and are happy to guide you as to how your skills & experience may fit into our start-up.




Thanks for your time, Alex. üôè

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst¬†| London


Role¬†




We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our team to drive the Data Strategy of a major retail chain. In addition of hands-on developments, the successful candidate will be directly involved in shaping the data strategy of one of the biggest retailers in Europe and will be working in collaboration with other engineers to define and scope ambitious and long-term data analysis projects including Machine Learning projects.¬†




Responsibilities:

Compute synthetic statistics to support specific business decisions
Develop and maintain automated dashboards to deliver data insights
Perform targeted studies and analysis to support business decision-making
Deliver actionable insights based on the analysis performed
Translate customer requirements into well-defined data analysis projects
Clean and manipulate large and complex datasets
Perform statistical analysis and modelling to identify trends and patterns in data
Communicate data-driven insights to stakeholders and make recommendations for action
Collaborate with other teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and new technologies to support data analysis efforts




Requirements¬†




Strong experience with SQL
Good programming and scripting skills, preferably using Python¬†
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and collaboration skills
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects at once
Ability to transform complex multidimensional data into synthetic metrics for the use of business decision makers
Nice-to-have: Experience with Data and AI applications in the retail industry
Experience with large datasets (TBs)




Company¬†




Founded by two machine learning experts (Cambridge-EBI PhD and Mila PhD) and a former industry executive, J2-Reliance is an R&D consultancy with an obsession for transforming data and technologies into business and societal value. We are experts in identifying what and how cutting-edge technologies from various research fields can be leveraged to solve complex problems. We develop and deploy the corresponding solutions end-to-end.¬†




In the retail space, we have successfully applied Transformers to the development of powerful recommender systems, and we have built deep learning models for demand forecasting in complex business contexts. Building up on this success, we have been selected to be a strategic partner for a leading retail franchise with a three-year mandate to lead the Data strategy and developments centred on core missions: product recommendation, supply chain optimisation and pricing optimisation.




Outside the retail sector we are supporting multiple tech start-ups and leading Machine Learning projects in the pharmaceutical and biotech sector.¬†




Why Join Us




Freedom to express tech and scientific creativity and work on an ambitious project¬†
Contributing to a young fast-growing product
Opportunity to see your work deployed in production¬†
Collaborative environment and mentorship from experienced scientists and engineers
Taking part in the long-term development of a young company¬†




Contact¬†

Damien Arnol¬†¬†- damien.arnol@j2reliance.co.uk¬†

https://www.linkedin.com/in/damien-arnol-27620368/

http://www.j2reliance.co.uk
