HTML:
Data Analyst | London

Role 


We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our team to drive the Data Strategy of a major retail chain. In addition of hands-on developments, the successful candidate will be directly involved in shaping the data strategy of one of the biggest retailers in Europe and will be working in collaboration with other engineers to define and scope ambitious and long-term data analysis projects including Machine Learning projects. 


Responsibilities:

  • Compute synthetic statistics to support specific business decisions
  • Develop and maintain automated dashboards to deliver data insights
  • Perform targeted studies and analysis to support business decision-making
  • Deliver actionable insights based on the analysis performed
  • Translate customer requirements into well-defined data analysis projects
  • Clean and manipulate large and complex datasets
  • Perform statistical analysis and modelling to identify trends and patterns in data
  • Communicate data-driven insights to stakeholders and make recommendations for action
  • Collaborate with other teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
  • Stay up-to-date with industry trends and new technologies to support data analysis efforts


Requirements 


  • Strong experience with SQL
  • Good programming and scripting skills, preferably using Python 
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects at once
  • Ability to transform complex multidimensional data into synthetic metrics for the use of business decision makers
  • Nice-to-have: Experience with Data and AI applications in the retail industry
  • Experience with large datasets (TBs)


Company 


Founded by two machine learning experts (Cambridge-EBI PhD and Mila PhD) and a former industry executive, J2-Reliance is an R&D consultancy with an obsession for transforming data and technologies into business and societal value. We are experts in identifying what and how cutting-edge technologies from various research fields can be leveraged to solve complex problems. We develop and deploy the corresponding solutions end-to-end. 


In the retail space, we have successfully applied Transformers to the development of powerful recommender systems, and we have built deep learning models for demand forecasting in complex business contexts. Building up on this success, we have been selected to be a strategic partner for a leading retail franchise with a three-year mandate to lead the Data strategy and developments centred on core missions: product recommendation, supply chain optimisation and pricing optimisation.


Outside the retail sector we are supporting multiple tech start-ups and leading Machine Learning projects in the pharmaceutical and biotech sector. 


Why Join Us


  • Freedom to express tech and scientific creativity and work on an ambitious project 
  • Contributing to a young fast-growing product
  • Opportunity to see your work deployed in production 
  • Collaborative environment and mentorship from experienced scientists and engineers
  • Taking part in the long-term development of a young company

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst

Salary: From ¬£24,000 per annum negotiable depending on experience

Contract: Fixed Term Contract (9 months) .05 FTE (part time)

Location: Hybrid - flexibility to work from home or at any of our main hubs (London, Bristol, Manchester and Harwell)




Jisc is the UK higher, further education and skills sectors‚Äô not-for-profit organisation for digital services and solutions. We believe education and research improves lives, and technology improves education and research.







Our vision is for the UK to be a world leader in technology for education and research and our mission is to power and empower our members with the technology and data they need to succeed. We know that digital technology has the ability to transform the student experience. We have the experience, expertise and know-how to drive that transformation.







At Jisc, everyone plays a key role and gets the chance to feel part of it, that to us is the definition of a meaningful career. We want to create a culture of lifelong learning. You can look forward to a rewarding job with opportunities to develop and make a real difference to the education and research sectors.







We celebrate diversity, embrace our differences and know that this is critical for our success. We work hard to make sure we‚Äôre inclusive and we are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. So, if you are great at what you do and share our values, we want to hear from you.




About the role:

The purpose of this role is to support the Intelligence and Analytics team to gather, analyse and present data to effectively benchmark, analyse, and monitor the Licensing portfolio to enable presentation to Digital Resources Senior Leadership Team and with other areas of Jisc; drive and inform licensing negotiations; and inform, support, and provide value to our members.







Responsibilities will include:

Work as part of the Intelligence and Analytics team to prototype, develop, launch, maintain and enhance a portfolio of licensing data analytics products that are quality assured, user focused, automated, reliable and secure
Work closely with the Data Analysts, to understand project aim, product vision and timescales and to contribute to sprint backlogs that are understood by everyone, and deliver discrete increments of the project and product
Creating statistically valid, user friendly visualisations and dashboards
Explore opportunities for improved collection, analysis, use and presentation of data and information, both within and without Digital Resources, including identifying where data is missing, needed and how to or who to collect it from







Key Skills and Experience:

Excellent organisational, analytical, problem solving and time-management skills and is detail-focused
Strong IT skills, including MS Office suite or similar, particularly Excel
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal such as creating clear documentation and reports
Experience in gathering data and information using surveys or other routes
Experience of combining and analysing data using software such as MS Excel
Experience of presenting and summarising data and information in written and/or visual ways through tools such as MS PowerPoint or other graphical software







Please refer to the job description for full details.







Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement?

We know that sometimes people can be put off applying for a job if they think they can‚Äôt tick every box but we realise the ‚Äòperfect candidate‚Äô doesn‚Äôt exist. So, if you can do most of what we‚Äôre looking for, go ahead and apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles!







Why work at Jisc:

At Jisc we believe a balance between your personal and professional life is essential to your happiness and fulfilment. We work flexibly at Jisc and focus on outputs rather than presenteeism and are open to a whole range of ways of working. It isn‚Äôt about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it‚Äôs about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life.







We offer hybrid working and although the majority of our staff work from home, getting face to face is something we value and find time for when we can. If you prefer an office environment all our hubs are open and offer a great space to work.







Our benefits are great too. We offer:

Flexible work pattern, which can adapt to suit your schedules and personal commitments
28 days annual leave (plus bank holidays) and an additional three closure days over Christma
A generous pension scheme with above average employer contributions
A range of leave options, including parental leave, volunteer leave and even career breaks.
A generous budget to attend conferences and in-person training
Allocated allowance of up to ¬£250 to equip your home office
A company culture which supports and promotes personal learning and development, including access to thousands of courses on LinkedIn Learning
Mental health first aid trained staff and supportive environment, plus your own Wellbeing allowance to spend on wellbeing for you
Financial well-being support
Discounts on big-name high-street stores
Cycle to work scheme
Employee recognition awards and travel loans







Equality, diversity and inclusion

At Jisc, we strive to be best in practice and are working hard to achieve progressive change. ‚ÄòAlways inclusive‚Äô is one of our six guiding principles - a principle which actively encourages acceptance of differences within individuals.







We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, neurodivergence, trans status, veteran status or gender identity.







Application process:

Please do let us know what reasonable adjustments you need made to the application or selection process so you can do your best. We will be happy to help you.







Just so you know, we review CVs as we receive them, and interview as soon as we have applications that look like a good match (usually within a week). We don‚Äôt use closing dates. So, please apply as soon as possible to avoid missing out on this role. We advertised this role on 24/01/2023

Title: Data Analyst (Renewables)
Description:
London, UK /




Octopus Energy UK üá¨üáß ‚Äì Data /




Full-time




/ Hybrid







Help us make a big green dent in the universe. We're on a mission to drive the global renewable energy revolution, and we need loads more people to help us make our vision a reality.




Octopus buys power directly from wind, solar and hydro sites all over the UK (and soon all over the world). This allows us to supply our customers with green electricity, straight from the source.




We‚Äôre looking for an Analyst to support us as we sign contracts to buy power from more and bigger renewable generators. This Analyst will lead on pricing, risk management and performance monitoring. This will all be done with a view to paying a fair price to renewable generators, and delivering green electricity to Octopus customers at the lowest possible cost.




The ideal candidate will have a passion for using data to enable the transition to renewable energy. And will be comfortable with all the moving parts and complexity that come with the energy industry.




This role will sit within the Octopus Energy Procurement team. However, this is not a typical Energy Procurement team. Instead of working in large, siloed teams, our trading, risk, forecasting and data science functions work closely together. We use technology to maintain a lean operation as the company grows. We focus on the big problems and give people the autonomy and resources to find innovative solutions.




What You'll Do




Create processes to track performance from contracting through to delivery, identifying areas for improvement.
Quantify and categorise risks in Octopus‚Äôs renewable energy origination processes.
Improve and maintain pricing tools, taking risks and historical performance into account.
Develop custom pricing proposals that are mutually beneficial to Octopus and renewable generators.
Work with the Forecasting Team to help Improve and maintain models for forecasting wind, solar and hydro generation at the level of the individual site.
Support the development of innovative commercial structures between Octopus's supply business and Octopus Energy GenerationDevelop alerting for generator outages or reduced performance.
Work with other teams at Octopus, including Strategy, Finance, Generation, Business, Hydrogen and many more.
Support Octopus businesses in other countries by sharing experience and best practices.




What You'll Need




Passion for renewables and the energy transition.
Desire to explore complex systems and an ability to learn fast.
Ability to communicate complicated concepts in a way that everyone can understand.
Commercial awareness and financial literacy to identify and understand the problems that need solving.
Comprehensive knowledge of data design, data modelling, data management and data visualisation.
Experience with a scripting language (ideally Python).Experience writing complex queries in SQL, analysing large datasets and building reports and dashboards.




If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you.




Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our Story

Small and medium size businesses are the lifeblood of the economy. Around the world, they supply vital goods and valuable services. Powering partnerships, increasing innovation, and driving progress.




But when it comes to getting hold of cash, these businesses frequently suffer. Credit and working capital is expensive and difficult to access. It causes existential turmoil and huge emotional distress.




Growth is restricted, and economies suffer as a result.




That‚Äôs why we started Previse. We use advanced machine learning and AI with rich business data, to predict future revenue probability. This decisioning capability is used to re-invent finance solutions for businesses.




Previse is building the infrastructure to connect millions of businesses with billions of dollars of finance, in ways that are otherwise not possible.




This is smarter finance, driven by data. Helping cash flow so businesses can grow.our core product and expand into other adjacent areas and markets are very exciting.




Job title

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to drive and build out our data analysis capability in the areas of marketing, product and risk for our InstantAdvance working capital product.




You will work with senior management and cross-functional teams to take data-driven decisions and actions in growing this early stage business line. Your responsibilities will include everything from searching for relevant data sources the business should leverage to using the performance data generated by our product to monitor the performance and drive actions across marketing, product development and credit risk management.




Being in a startup, you will have the opportunity to get involved in shaping the direction of the business, working with the rest of the passionate and diverse team we have.




What You‚Äôll Do

Data Collection: Use external data sources (e.g. business lists, websites, credit bureau data) and internal data sources (e.g. CRM system, web analytics, campaign management tools) to put together data pools and automated processes for execution / analysis. Some examples:
Collect and process large datasets from various sources using APIs, web scraping techniques and data warehousing using Python.
Automate various aspects of the data collection and data pipeline processes
Prepare data to support marketing campaign targetting Review quality of different external data sources to improve quality of customer contact data and insight
Track and collect data from marketing campaigns for performance analysis
Normalise data from different partner data sources to run risk algorithms on
Consolidate data from different sources (marketing, risk etc) to summarise overall product performance
Data Analysis: Use various pieces of data to analyse different aspects of the business - ad hoc and on an ongoing basis. Some examples:
Analyze data using Python and various data analysis and visualisation libraries (e.g. Pandas, Numpy, Plotly, etc.)
Marketing funnel performance analysis
Customer interaction analysis
Credit risk segmentation analysis
Product profitability modelling
Product process efficiency analysis
Recommendations and Strategy: Using the analysis, work with various teams and stakeholders to conclude on recommendations and actions to take. Some examples:
Defining segmentation filters for marketing based on analysis of significant influencer variables
Reviewing marketing channels to increase / decrease exposure to
Recommendations on sector appetite and portfolio credit actions
Visualisation and Reporting: Present the information in a digestible format to the wider set of business stakeholders. Using the data warehouse and data visualisation tools in use, create interactive reports and dashboards for different teams to use




Requirements

A degree in a numerate subject - ideally in Mathematics or Data Science, or high familiarity with statistical data analysis concepts learnt through practical experience
2-5 years of work experience in data analysis
2+ years of experience in data analysis and visualisation using Python
Strong experience with Python‚Äôs data analysis libraries such as Pandas, Numpy, Plotly, etc.
Experience with SQL and databases, including data warehousing.
Structured approach with attention to detail
Be passionate about solving real-world problems using data and technology
Good teamwork and communication skills




Desirable Skill

Experience using data sourced from different routes - APIs / File Transfer / Web scraping etc
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and Google product suite
Experience working in or alongside marketing and product teams




Who Are You

Self-motivated and proactive - happy to be part of a cross-functional team and assume additional responsibilities as they arise, to deliver results
Ability to learn quickly and pick up new skills/concepts
Can think creatively to reach solutions and results
Comfortable with delivering in an ever changing environment

Show more Show less
HTML:
Our Story

Small and medium size businesses are the lifeblood of the economy. Around the world, they supply vital goods and valuable services. Powering partnerships, increasing innovation, and driving progress.


But when it comes to getting hold of cash, these businesses frequently suffer. Credit and working capital is expensive and difficult to access. It causes existential turmoil and huge emotional distress.


Growth is restricted, and economies suffer as a result.


That‚Äôs why we started Previse. We use advanced machine learning and AI with rich business data, to predict future revenue probability. This decisioning capability is used to re-invent finance solutions for businesses.


Previse is building the infrastructure to connect millions of businesses with billions of dollars of finance, in ways that are otherwise not possible.


This is smarter finance, driven by data. Helping cash flow so businesses can grow.our core product and expand into other adjacent areas and markets are very exciting.


Job title

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to drive and build out our data analysis capability in the areas of marketing, product and risk for our InstantAdvance working capital product.


You will work with senior management and cross-functional teams to take data-driven decisions and actions in growing this early stage business line. Your responsibilities will include everything from searching for relevant data sources the business should leverage to using the performance data generated by our product to monitor the performance and drive actions across marketing, product development and credit risk management.


Being in a startup, you will have the opportunity to get involved in shaping the direction of the business, working with the rest of the passionate and diverse team we have.


What You‚Äôll Do

  • Data Collection: Use external data sources (e.g. business lists, websites, credit bureau data) and internal data sources (e.g. CRM system, web analytics, campaign management tools) to put together data pools and automated processes for execution / analysis. Some examples:
  • Collect and process large datasets from various sources using APIs, web scraping techniques and data warehousing using Python.
  • Automate various aspects of the data collection and data pipeline processes
  • Prepare data to support marketing campaign targetting Review quality of different external data sources to improve quality of customer contact data and insight
  • Track and collect data from marketing campaigns for performance analysis
  • Normalise data from different partner data sources to run risk algorithms on
  • Consolidate data from different sources (marketing, risk etc) to summarise overall product performance
  • Data Analysis: Use various pieces of data to analyse different aspects of the business - ad hoc and on an ongoing basis. Some examples:
  • Analyze data using Python and various data analysis and visualisation libraries (e.g. Pandas, Numpy, Plotly, etc.)
  • Marketing funnel performance analysis
  • Customer interaction analysis
  • Credit risk segmentation analysis
  • Product profitability modelling
  • Product process efficiency analysis
  • Recommendations and Strategy: Using the analysis, work with various teams and stakeholders to conclude on recommendations and actions to take. Some examples:
  • Defining segmentation filters for marketing based on analysis of significant influencer variables
  • Reviewing marketing channels to increase / decrease exposure to
  • Recommendations on sector appetite and portfolio credit actions
  • Visualisation and Reporting: Present the information in a digestible format to the wider set of business stakeholders. Using the data warehouse and data visualisation tools in use, create interactive reports and dashboards for different teams to use


Requirements

  • A degree in a numerate subject - ideally in Mathematics or Data Science, or high familiarity with statistical data analysis concepts learnt through practical experience
  • 2-5 years of work experience in data analysis
  • 2+ years of experience in data analysis and visualisation using Python
  • Strong experience with Python‚Äôs data analysis libraries such as Pandas, Numpy, Plotly, etc.
  • Experience with SQL and databases, including data warehousing.
  • Structured approach with attention to detail
  • Be passionate about solving real-world problems using data and technology
  • Good teamwork and communication skills


Desirable Skill

  • Experience using data sourced from different routes - APIs / File Transfer / Web scraping etc
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and Google product suite
  • Experience working in or alongside marketing and product teams


Who Are You

  • Self-motivated and proactive - happy to be part of a cross-functional team and assume additional responsibilities as they arise, to deliver results
  • Ability to learn quickly and pick up new skills/concepts
  • Can think creatively to reach solutions and results
  • Comfortable with delivering in an ever changing environment


Our Culture

As a growing team in a rapidly developing space, our culture is hugely important to us, and is an area where you can make a great impact. We pride ourselves on our passion and commitment, regardless of specialism. Our success is driven by collaboration - we solve problems together, and our openness helps each individual grow, too. We're looking for people who can contribute fresh insights and the tenacity required to deliver value, and of course, who love to have fun!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Does working for Multi-National Lottery Operator with a market-leading presence in Austria, the Czech Republic, Greece, Cyprus, and Italy sound like the perfect place of employment for you?

Over the next two years we are going to embark on a large-scale transformation journey, unparalleled in the existing market, and a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for anyone both within and outside the betting and gaming industry. They can‚Äôt talk too much about their plans ‚Äì you‚Äôll have to speak to us to find out more ‚Äì but they can promise a fast-paced, exciting environment, innovative projects like none you have worked on before, and the opportunity to transform a core pillar of the UK economy, while contributing to good causes that benefit society.




Job Description:

Data Analyst - Full Time - Hybrid










Join our journey to create a new experience for the National Lottery and help us to power change for the greater good.

About us:

Allwyn UK is part of Allwyn Entertainment Group ‚Äì a multi-national lottery operator with a market-leading presence in Austria, the Czech Republic, Greece, Cyprus, and Italy. In 2022, Allwyn was selected in a Government tender as the Preferred Applicant to operate the UK‚Äôs National Lottery from February 2024.




Over the next two years we are embarking on a largescale transformation journey to build a bigger, better and safer National Lottery that delivers more money to Good Causes. Once-in-a-lifetime opportunities exist for people from within and outside the betting and gaming industry to join us play a part in giving the National Lottery a fresh start




Role Purpose:

Working in the Commercial team that are data and insight driven ‚Äì proactively supporting all team members across the product team and working closely with the Consumer Insights Manager. Also working as part of the wider team executing on the Transition plan for Consumer Insights.

This role will be focused on data analysis for product but may at times be asked to support analysis needs for other areas such as marketing, CRM and digital.

This role will have functional reporting into the Consumer Insights Manager and subject matter reporting into the Head of Product, working closely with the team of Product Managers.




Role Responsibilities:

Analyse a broad array of data points from internal and external sources related to Company IP, Product and Library Assets
Combine and analyse data sets to gain insights into the National Lottery product portfolio and sales performance
Respond to insight queries from the product team
Present analytical outputs to key stakeholders, taking complex information and communicating it as clear and actionable insights.
Execute aspects of quantitative and qualitative research where required, including questionnaire design and development
Proactively analyse research findings to develop Allwyn UK friendly internal reports for both quantitative and qualitative reporting, using a story-based reporting approach
Support product lifecycle research programs to ensure product and planned marketing campaigns will resonate with relevant target audiences
Ensure highest level of data quality and validation




Key Measures of Success:

Respond to queries within the agreed timeframe
Provide high quality outputs with digestible summaries and recommendations
High quality of data visualisation
Proactive approach to data analysis with insights and recommendations actively raised to the team
Support the business planning process with insights, modelling and forecasting inputs
Work closely with other Consumer Insights team members to develop internal qualitative and quantitative best practices




Key Skills and Experience:

Experience with application development is a plus
Experience in using either: SPSS, SAS, SQL
Experience in manipulating data in excel and using other platforms e.g. Tableau
Bachelor‚Äôs degree from a recognized university, Master‚Äôs degree/MBA strongly preferred
3 + years of relevant job experience working in areas of data analysis
Ability to understand and translate technical, numerical data
Experience in data analysis for product development and management
Experience in the interactive entertainment industry a plus, with a preference on gambling
Consumer research or research agency experience a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Trust Payments have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join the team.




Location: London

Salary: Competitive + Benefits




About Us:

¬†

Trust Payments is a global unified payment technology group that was formed in 2019 bringing together technology and financial services into an omnichannel solution. The new business model has enabled Trust Payments to establish itself as a leading Fintech Payments group.




Data Analyst - The Role:




Trust Payments is currently seeking an experienced Data Analyst to support the efforts of the Data-Analytics Team.




This role will suit a candidate with exceptional Analytical skills and strong Communication & Interpersonal skills.




The chosen candidate will be tasked with creating KPI‚Äôs, dashboards and various analytical reports, while also analysing data and providing meaningful insights to both internal and external stakeholders.







Data Analyst ‚Äì Key Responsibilities:




- Interpret data and analyse results using statistical and analytical techniques

- Acquire data from primary and secondary data sources

- Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets

- Build and publish effective Business Intelligence solutions and Analytical visualizations for end users in Tableau/QuickSight or equivalent

- Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize data efficiency and quality

- Perform detailed data analysis (i.e., determine the structure, content, and quality of the data through examination of source systems and data samples)

- Querying databases and manipulating data using SQL, Excel, Tableau, QuickSight or equivalent




Data Analyst ‚Äì You:




- Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst

- Working knowledge of reporting/analytical platforms such as Tableau, QuickSight or equivalent

- Passionate about data visualization

- Advanced Excel knowledge (Pivots, Formulas etc)

- Analytical skills with good attention to detail

- Excellent knowledge of relational/non-relational Database and Data warehouse concepts and technologies

- Experience in SQL, PostgreSQL, or equivalent scripting languages

- Knowledge in data modelling and segmentation techniques will be considered an asset

- Programming knowledge (C#, Python, R, XML, JS etc.) will be considered an asset

- Knowledge of Salesforce CRM system and/or Omnipay processing platform will be considered an asset

- Experience in Statistical Analysis will be considered an asset




Data Analyst ‚Äì Benefits:

¬†

- Opportunity to be part of a rapidly scaling and market leading Fintech business

- Health and Wellbeing ethos including regular wellness sessions, fitness and nutrition and other events as well as supported by internally qualified mental health first aiders

- Family friendly enhanced benefits/policies

- Pension, Healthcare, Life Assurance

¬†

We understand the value that a diverse and inclusive working environment brings to Trust Payments. We celebrate the differences that people can bring through their cultures, backgrounds and perspectives. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other protected characteristic.

¬†

During the recruitment process we welcome you to inform us confidentially of any special adjustments required in order to participate fully in our recruitment experience.




To submit your CV for this exciting Data Analyst opportunity, please click ‚ÄòApply‚Äô now!

¬†

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
London, UK /




Octopus Energy UK üá¨üáß ‚Äì Finance /




Full-time




/ Hybrid







Help us make a big green dent in the universe. We're on a mission to drive the global renewable energy revolution, and we need loads more people to help us make our vision a reality.




We're looking for someone who will work in our credit risk function and develop our capabilities across both business and consumer portfolios.




This could not be a better time to join Octopus Energy. We are already recognised as a global leader in the fight to decarbonise the planet by revolutionising what‚Äôs possible in energy - including investments in renewable energy supply, renewable energy generation, smart energy networks, EVs, heat pumps, etc. The government's new green initiatives and the recent investment by Al Gore‚Äôs Generation Fund will propel us further and faster.




Equally, from a credit risk perspective this is an important time to join. The energy sector has gone through a period of volatility. Businesses and households are facing significantly higher energy prices just as we enter winter. This situation is compounded with the end of furlough and reductions to Universal Credit payments. For these reasons we are looking to add to our credit risk capabilities with this new role.




What You'll Do




Take ownership of our credit strategies for residential and business customers
Develop our credit scorecards
Payments and payment adequacy strategy
Collections insight and strategy
Develop our empathic approaches towards vulnerable customers
Credit risk reporting and management information
Strategies to identify and prevent first party and third party fraud
Bad debt provision and write-offs
Do all the above in partnership with Data Science, Finance, Collections, Ops and other stakeholders




What You'll Have




Excellent SQL skills
Python data science stack experience (NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, Jupyter notebooks, Plotly/matplotlib)
Git for version control experience
Data visualization tool experience (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI or equivalent)
Experience of consumer credit risk and collections is ideal but not essential
DBT experience a bonus but not essential




If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you.




Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone.

The successful candidate will also support the client‚Äôs key workstreams enabling their projects to develop robust data insights that evidence the impact of key activity. Key duties & responsibilities:-Research, collation, capture, store and publish evidence and datasets to support planning and decision making across the programme workstreams.
The post-holder will be required to research and identify external and internal datasets that could support the objectives of the programme workstreams.
The post-holder will be responsible for ensuring that these datasets are captured within Client‚Äôs systems and are accessible to colleagues on demand.
Work with other analysts to ensure that evidence and data is joined up and shared to support better planning and decision making.
Liaise with stakeholders across the department and with partner organisations as well as working to ensure that systems and processes enable effective sharing and joining-up of data, subject to considerations of data protection.
Work with the programme leads to design key performance indicators to reflect priority outcomes and build the necessary systems and processes to capture and report against these. This will include defining and documenting new performance indicators, ensuring that responsibilities for data generation and collation are clearly understood.
Develop systems and processes to efficiently capture, record, validate, analyse and report data against key performance indicators for the programme.
The post holder will also be responsible for ensuring that the relevant systems and processes are in place for efficient and secure data capture, storage and reporting.
Prepare cyclical and ad-hoc performance reports for the programme board, workstreams and projects. This will include development and drafting of performance dashboards using all available tools to ensure efficient and accurate reporting.
Provide support, guidance, advice and challenge to the programme in improving data quality and to ensure that programme performance is maximised. Requirements:
Previous Data Analyst experience
Enhanced DBS on the update service
Good working knowledge of data extraction tools, including Business Objects, SRSS and SQL
Previous experience and working knowledge of R-Studio and Power BI
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills Working hours: 09.00- 17.00, Monday -Friday If you are interested in this position, please apply with your CV

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analytical Innovator

Location: London / Hybrid

Engagement Type: Permanent / 12 Month FTC

Salary: ¬£45,000 plus excellent benefits

Job Summary

Are you someone who loves playing with data to find innovative solutions for insight outputs? Were looking for an innovative data analyst who can transform our offline analytical pathways and insight outputs for our standardised research objectives into an improved version on an analytical platform we use; Diplayr. This will be a 12 month permanent or fixed term contract role.

The role will be to own project delivery of templating the data analysis by research objective with two key objectives:

Enhance the synthesisations of data by identifying and implementing opportunities for increased innovative ways of combining data sets for meaningful synthesisations and visualisations of insight
Identify automation opportunities and enable within the development of templates

Responsibilities

Youll be running each research objective through Displayr with using our standardised framework and enhancing the outputs.
Well have data thats gone through our standardised process for you to use to enable an analytical pathway through Displayr that can be used on every standardised project by our strategists.
Youll digitalise our analytical pathways onto Displayr, enhance them in the process for improved end outputs and visualisations, and automate as much as possible.
Youll need to own and deliver this project for 11 research objectives, reporting into the Head of Product Development, and working with stakeholders in the business to ensure usability of the end product.

Minimum Requirements

Experience or an understanding of market research, consumer insight or similar
2+ years of working with data in innovative ways or proof of applying your skills with data analysis
Data synthesisation analytics and data visualisation skills. Youve turned data into meaningful insight by combining data sets and/or using data visualisation to create insightful meaning from data
Experience of creating standardised data analytical models, frameworks and charting templates for automation/repeated use
Project management of full cycle/end to end analytical projects (innovation projects a plus)
Experience with Displayr or a similar analytical platform is highly preferred
Experience applying an automated lens to build out digitalised data synthesisation pathways is preferred
R code skills are a plus (Displayr is created with R code, it is not needed to use Displayr, but helps when innovating in Displayr)

Benefits

Competitive base salary - we know youre worth it!
Flexible Hybrid Working- to maximise your productivity and happiness around your life commitments
25 days annual leave- we all need to re-charge our batteries
4 Non Sick Wellness days -1 per quarter-your wellbeing matters
Your birthday off -Go and celebrate! Its your birthday after all
Company Pension- your future is important to us
Company Bonus Scheme we appreciate your hard work
Private Healthcare your health comes first
Cycle to Work Scheme
Health and financial wellbeing discounts to help with every day life
Extensive L&D program- everyone should develop new skills and be given the tools and knowledge to succeed
Wellbeing Weekly - weekly tips and advice on self-care and wellbeing
WOW Awards- your peers want to shout out about how awesome you are!
Company Socials- we like to have fun!
Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
THE BUSINESS




Illuma is an independent contextual ad-tech company which runs proprietary machine-learning tools to provide clients with intelligent and privacy-friendly way to scale their most valuable audiences online.




We are at an exciting stage in our journey, having just received Series A funding, and we are now investing in our team as we set our sights on global expansion.




At Illuma we are curious, innovative and progressive, committed to seeking new, intelligent solutions to business problems. You will be working with and learning from some of the brightest minds in AI, tech and data science, and you won‚Äôt be just a cog in a wheel, you will have an active voice with the opportunity to make real impact and grow your career with us as we scale.




Our technology has been developed by leading academics in data science and artificial intelligence, combined with input from senior advertising and publishing professionals. Our core clients are premium publishers, specialist media buyers and major programmatic advertisers including Microsoft, American Express, TUI, Aviva and Pernod Ricard. Our work was been recognised in The Guardian‚Äôs Publishing Trends Report 2019 and by the Digiday Media Awards Europe 2020, where we were finalists for ‚ÄòBest Social Good Campaign‚Äô.




We differentiate in a cluttered technology sector by challenging most of the norms of mainstream data-driven advertising: instead using AI to work reactively in real-time; re-thinking relevance and expanding success.




Requirements




We are looking for a highly motivated Data Analyst to work within our technical team, helping to drive efficiency through innovative solutions. Technology is central to our continued growth, and you will be supported by and work alongside other engineers. Moreover, as illuma focuses on digital advertising, and you will be exposed to the industry domain knowledge and will have the opportunity to develop your career path towards technical account manager.




This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a truly dynamic company under inspiring leadership, where you will have the opportunity to work on some of the most exciting technologies in the sector and support the account managing team and sales team.




On a day-to-day basis, you will be responsible for and take the lead on a number of projects where you will use your analytical skills to understand the given brief and foresee any technical challenges that may arise. Alongside others, you will be responsible for data retrieval and analysis, campaign management, and advertising platform support.




Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities




Using a combined knowledge of computer science and applications, modelling statistics, analytics and maths to solve problems
Using data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns
Performing statistical analysis of data from multiple angles, looking for trends and insights that highlight problems or opportunities
Preparing reports and presenting these to management or clients
Monitoring metrics and developing ways to improve campaign performance
Assisting trading desk platform setup and troubleshoot
Understanding legacy code and executing programmes
Brainstorming for new ideas and technologies to improve development delivery
Continually updating technical and domain knowledge and skills
Following all best practices and procedures as established by the company




Knowledge, Skills And Experience




2:1 degree or higher in Data Science, Statistics, Maths, Operational Research or related area of study
Excellent written and spoken English
Proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL) for data retrieval
Proficiency in Python-Statistical Programming or R (especially packages/libraries for data science & analysis)
Experience with Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Microsoft PowerBI, Metabase, Tableau, etc)
Experience with Linux infrastructures & shell scripting
Knowledge & experience of machine learning, and data visualisation are preferable
Knowledge & experience with digital advertising (e.g. demand-side platforms, sell-side platforms, Ad exchanges, etc) are preferable
Up-to-date on latest industry trends; able to articulate trends and potential clearly and confidently




You Are




Communication - able to get one's message understood clearly by adopting a range of styles, tools and techniques appropriate to the audience and the nature of the information.




Team working - enthusiastic about helping to build and maintain effective working relationships, working cooperatively with others to be part of a team and lead a team.




Strategic thinking - capable of identifying a vision along with the plans that need to be implemented to meet the end goal. You evaluate situations, decisions, issues, etc. in the short, medium and longer-term.




Analytical Thinking - able to simplify complex problems or projects into component parts, exploring and evaluating them systematically, and identifying and resolving problems.




Planning and organising - capable of prioritising and planning activities taking into account all the relevant issues and factors such as deadlines, resources, with line manager guidance at the outset as required.




Flexibility ‚Äì able to adapt and work effectively with a variety of situations, individuals or groups. Able to understand and appreciate different and opposing perspectives on an issue, to adapt an approach as the requirements of a situation change




Details




This role will be based at our London office in Farringdon.




Benefits




25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Private medical insurance
Half price gym memberships
Pension
Team socials, stocked fridge, snacks - fun
We operate a Hybrid working model with initially the opportunity to work remotely for up to one day per week increasing to two days after successful completion of the probation period.




Equal Opportunity Statement




We embrace diversity fully and promote an inclusive environment for all people to do the best work of their lives with us.




We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.




Our Values




United Driven Focused Innovative

Benefits


  • 25 days holiday plus bank holidays

  • We operate a Hybrid working model with initially the opportunity to work remotely for up to one day per week increasing to two days after successful completion of the probation period.

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.

United Driven Focused Innovative

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We go all-out to create wonderful mobile apps and help them reach as many people as possible. As a company of rational thinkers with big visions, our decisions‚Äîfrom the smallest app feature choices all the way up to the most dramatic strategic resolutions‚Äîmust rest on robust foundations of truth. To make this happen, we‚Äôre looking for a brilliant, business-driven number-cruncher, savvy enough to run SQL queries and code their way around large amounts of data‚Äîsomeone who‚Äôs completely obsessed with data and finding (often counterintuitive) answers to complex, crucial questions.




A few examples of your responsibilities

Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.




What we look for

Logical-analytical abilities. You‚Äôre a quick learner who‚Äôs able to investigate and effectively pick up new concepts on your own. You can solve unforeseen challenges with creativity and structure, and can do so independently.
Relevant knowledge. You don‚Äôt need to be a walking encyclopedia on the topic, but you do need to know your ABCs from your XYZs. A solid and ever-expanding knowledge base is a prerequisite‚Äîyou spend a hearty portion of your time seeking to fill in the gaps in your understanding.
Organization and structure. You‚Äôre meticulously organized and superbly structured, so you can handle multiple tasks and responsibilities with poise and precision.
Pragmatism. Far from being too academic or obsessive in your perfectionism, you understand that speed is often as important as quality when getting things done in a competitive world.
Curiosity and initiative. You love exploring, and are forever hunting down new opportunities and testing fresh ideas. Rather than waiting to be told what to do, you go seek.
Passion. You love what you do, and your enthusiasm never wavers with the specifics of a given task or team. Whether you‚Äôre on a plane, train, or sofa, odds are that you‚Äôll be found with your nose in a book or article on the subject.
Drive. You‚Äôre energetic and hard-working, and you persevere through adversity until the job is done‚Äîand done impeccably. You‚Äôre massively into getting results, and always aim for excellence in what you do.
Communication skills. You can pose questions with clarity and explain your reasoning concisely.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.




What we offer

Lots. Of. Data. With millions of users, hundreds of thousands of new users every day, and a large, diverse, and ever-growing portfolio of products, Bending Spoons is the perfect playground for a data nerd (we know you are‚Äîwe are too!).
The finest tools. You get the best hardware on the market and all the software you could need. We can't wait to introduce you to our high-tech approach and our cutting-edge workflows.
Talented, knowledgeable colleagues. Learn from (and teach) some of the brightest and most skilled people you‚Äôll ever meet. Your talent is going to blossom here.
Make a difference. Be the owner of your effort‚Äîfrom day one, you‚Äôre one of the team and fully trusted to take responsibility for your tasks. You‚Äôll have every incentive to make a major impact.
Unique career opportunity. By joining a fast-growing company on a mission to become one of the world's greatest, it‚Äôs an unparalleled opportunity to turbocharge your learning and career prospects.
Continuous education. Spooners get unlimited backing for learning investments, including Italian or English lessons and things like courses, conferences, and books. There‚Äôs no permission or approval process‚Äîyou‚Äôre fully trusted to use the company‚Äôs resources efficiently.
Flexible schedule. Our regular hours are 9-6 GMT+1, but this isn‚Äôt a ‚Äúclock in, clock out‚Äù company. You‚Äôre fully trusted to create the right conditions for your own personal peak productivity. We only ask that you‚Äôre available to your teammates a good chunk of the day (six hours or so). That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs generally best to be based somewhere with a similar time zone‚Äîbetween GMT-2 and GMT+3.
Unlimited time off. Take all the time you need to be with your family or just recharge your batteries. There‚Äôs no maximum number of days off, and there isn't any kind of permission process. We just ask that you make your vacation decisions mindfully.
Remote working. Spend as much or as little time in our Milan office as you choose. Many Spooners like to change up their environment and get out of the city whenever the mood strikes. You‚Äôve always got the freedom to decide where today‚Äôs office is.
Competitive salary and stock options. Our compensation package is highly competitive, and can grow rapidly and include stock options, depending on your performance and seniority.




Commitment & contract

Full time or part-time. Permanent or fixed-term (depending on seniority).




Location

Milan, Italy or fully remote.

If you choose the on-site option, it‚Äôs also fine to sometimes work remotely. We offer substantial support for relocation, including finding an apartment in Milan and paying the rent for 12 weeks.




The selection process

If you successfully pass through our screening process, we‚Äôll invite you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach and solve unfamiliar problems. These tests don‚Äôt require any prior knowledge, and they should take a few hours to complete. If you‚Äôre successful there, we‚Äôll invite you to take part in some interviews‚Äînormally two or three‚Äîto get to know each other and figure out if it‚Äôs a good fit for both parties. The interviews are held remotely, and include some behavioral and problem-solving questions. To limit human bias, all of our hiring decisions are made by a hiring committee rather than any individual.




Spooners come from all over the world and English is our working language. We welcome applications in English or Italian‚Äîwhichever suits you best!




All interviews and assessments take place in English and are held online.




Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment all applicants, regardless of their race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, pregnancy, political affiliation, disability, and any other legally protected characteristic. We‚Äôre committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations, please let us know at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.

That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs generally best to be based somewhere with a similar time zone‚Äîbetween GMT-2 and GMT+3.
  • Unlimited time off. Take all the time you need to be with your family or just recharge your batteries. There‚Äôs no maximum number of days off, and there isn't any kind of permission process. We just ask that you make your vacation decisions mindfully.
  • Remote working. Spend as much or as little time in our Milan office as you choose. Many Spooners like to change up their environment and get out of the city whenever the mood strikes. You‚Äôve always got the freedom to decide where today‚Äôs office is.
  • Competitive salary and stock options. Our compensation package is highly competitive, and can grow rapidly and include stock options, depending on your performance and seniority.


Commitment & contract

Full time or part-time. Permanent or fixed-term (depending on seniority).


Location

Milan, Italy or fully remote.

If you choose the on-site option, it‚Äôs also fine to sometimes work remotely. We offer substantial support for relocation, including finding an apartment in Milan and paying the rent for 12 weeks.


The selection process

If you successfully pass through our screening process, we‚Äôll invite you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach and solve unfamiliar problems. These tests don‚Äôt require any prior knowledge, and they should take a few hours to complete. If you‚Äôre successful there, we‚Äôll invite you to take part in some interviews‚Äînormally two or three‚Äîto get to know each other and figure out if it‚Äôs a good fit for both parties. The interviews are held remotely, and include some behavioral and problem-solving questions. To limit human bias, all of our hiring decisions are made by a hiring committee rather than any individual.


Spooners come from all over the world and English is our working language. We welcome applications in English or Italian‚Äîwhichever suits you best!


All interviews and assessments take place in English and are held online.


Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment all applicants, regardless of their race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, pregnancy, political affiliation, disability, and any other legally protected characteristic. We‚Äôre committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations, please let us know at accommodations-ext@bendingspoons.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
** Data Analyst - ¬£360 p/d (Outside IR35) - Fully Remote **




My client is a leading global telecommunications business looking to hire a highly statistical Data Analyst, responsible for checking, chasing, backfilling and reporting on data, supporting various mobile network projects. The incumbent must possess the ability to work with multiple data sources and be experienced in data model development.




The Data Analyst will be expected to:

Work with Visualisation Tools (Qlik, Power BI, Grafana).
Query data using programming languages such as SQL, Python and DAX.
Confidently drive data quality/cleaning actions and interact with unfamiliar stakeholders on a daily basis.
Host workshops to investigate data quality issues.
Familiar with Databases and Database Designs.
Work with multiple data sources and be experienced in data model development.
Present and translate complex data into simple, customer facing dashboards.




The successful Data Analyst will possess:

Data Analyst experience within the Telco industry, with an understanding of Configuration Management Data (Mobile Networks).
Strong Power BI experience.
Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel.
An understanding of Software Development fundamentals.
Deep understanding of how to query data using SQL.




The client is based in stipulated locations, it is either on site (West Berkshire) or at one of their offices in the area.




Please get in touch for more details.

Keywords: Networks, Development, Analysis, Reporting, SQL, Python, DAX, Analytics, Telecommunications, Telco, 2G, 3G, 4G, 5G, Excel, PowerBI, Qlik, Grafana, Data, Quality, database, modelling, dashboards, mobile,

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: London

Salary: ¬£40-45k




As the Information Systems team grow, a new role has emerged for a Reporting and Data Analyst. This individual will work collaboratively across the business to lead on reporting requirements such as the management of databases, identifying areas of improvement and offering solutions.




This company is a public body providing funding to the public sector to support the investment of low carbon technologies. They work on energy efficiency projects to help the UK progress towards the government's decarbonisation initiative.




Key Responsibilities:

Outline / Analyse the reporting needs of information systems.
Translate reporting needs to production reports
Ensure the data architecture follows best practices.
Identify improvements on database systems.
Data visualisation utilising Power BI
Data Modelling using tools such as UML, ETL, SQL etc.




Must have:

Minimum 3 years in a data analysis or reporting role.
Experience in designing and maintaining BI reports
Experience with Business Systems and ERPs
SQL Server, Oracle and MSQL experience.




If this is of interest to you please click apply!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: London ‚Äì Hybrid




Type: Full-time/Permanent




A speciality Insurance client of mine are looking for a Data Analyst to provide support on Business and Data Analysis activities to strengthen the Data Team to improve decision-making and efficiency by making the best use of its data.




What you will be doing:

You will work closely with the business teams to understand their requirements and perform data analysis to assess quality and meaning of data
You will provide data solution options enabling the business to transform their processes and make the best use of data
You will create/maintain business analysis artefacts like process flows and mapping documents
You will support delivery and testing teams in defining scope, testing coverage, validation of test scenarios and any clarifications
You will identify and analyse problems and challenges that may affect the successful delivery and adoption of proposed solution into the business

Experience you will NEED:

You will NEED previous experience in working on Specialty Insurance domain with understanding of business processes and subject areas like Underwriting, Claims, Actuarial, etc.
You‚Äôll need an understanding of Insurance data and analytics use cases and knowledge on how data can be used to drive business value within insurance
An understanding of Business Analysis processes and experience in producing BA artefacts like business process diagrams, mapping documents, etc.
Must have an ability to communicate effectively (both verbally and in writing) with a diverse set of business and technical stakeholder groups
Must have the ability to lead teams and take accountability for delivery
You‚Äôll need advanced problem-solving skills and ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing
Experience with Specialty and Reinsurance Modelling data / processes
Experience on data visualisation and reporting tools like Power BI
Demonstratable interest and awareness in emerging technologies
Previous experience as a team lead/scrum-master, experience of Agile and traditional SDLC delivery

This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing company who are embarking on exciting new initiatives across the entire business.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Description




If you‚Äôre at home managing complex datasets and AI systems, your intelligence could help drive our digital revolution.




Our Data Analysts are trusted to work closely with a wide range of clients on exciting projects with real-world purpose and impact.




In 2022, CGI was voted a ‚ÄòBest Workplace in Tech‚Äô by Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢ and was named one of the ‚ÄòWorld‚Äôs Best Employers‚Äô by Forbes magazine. We offer a competitive salary, excellent pension, private healthcare, plus a share scheme (3.5% + 3.5% matching) which makes you a member not just an employee.




We are committed to inclusivity, building a genuinely diverse community of tech talent and inspiring everyone to pursue careers in our sector. Join us and you‚Äôll be part of an open, friendly community of experts. We‚Äôll train and support you in taking your career wherever you want it to go.




Your future duties and responsibilities




You‚Äôll join a collaborative team working on activities pertaining to application retirement for one of our financial services clients. You will need to understand the data model ‚Äòas is‚Äô and be able to design/identify the optimal target model for archiving the date - or - mapping the data to the target/replacement application. The role also involves managing other activities of a technical nature in the context of application retirement, leveraging project Management experience and discipline. There is a large volume of data sets to be analysed.




Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role




Demonstrable Data Analysis skills
SQL skills on large data sets
Good technical knowledge of the Unix OS/Environment
Desirable but not essential - experience within Banking & Financial Services sector




Insights you can act on




While technology is at the heart of our clients‚Äô digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.




When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees ‚Äúmembers‚Äù because they are CGI shareholders and owners, and, as owners, we enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today‚Äîone of the world‚Äôs largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.




At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where everyone belongs, and we collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal opportunity employer, we empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.




Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI‚Äîwhere your ideas and actions make a difference.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are

Cashplus is a leading UK challenger bank for small businesses. We offer faster, smarter, simpler current accounts for the entrepreneurs, independent businesses and consumers that power the UK economy, yet are too often overlooked by high street banks. Since 2005, we‚Äôve created easier ways for more than 1.6m customers to pay, bank and borrow through our user-friendly digital platform. We understand what our customers need ‚Äì time and money to run their businesses and live their lives ‚Äì and our secure, innovative products are designed to help, where others can‚Äôt or won‚Äôt. A true fintech pioneer, we are a fast-growing and credible UK challenger bank.




http://www.cashplus.com/







Our Values & Behaviours

Cashplus puts the fair treatment of customers at the heart of our business model. Our business goals are:

1. Becoming a bank that customers love

2. Developing brilliant, sustainable products

3. Earning an outstanding reputation




Cashplus values are:

¬∑ We innovate with purpose

¬∑ We are upfront

¬∑ We do it right

¬∑ We are all in







The Role

The Data Quality Analyst role provides a vital role in ensuring that the organisation maintains control over data quality.




Working within the Chief Data Officer‚Äôs data team the role will working with stakeholders to develop data quality requirements and build the frameworks and controls to ensure they are implemented.




In our data driven and heavily regulated organisation, you‚Äôll monitor enhance data at Cashplus through continuous improvement to its quality, this will drive confidence in business decisions, improve customer experience and assist in ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements relating to data.




Working here

If you enjoy being collaborative, hands-on and have an entrepreneurial spirit you‚Äôll love it here. We‚Äôre offering the excitement, scope and stimulation of an innovative fintech with the security of joining an established, sustainable and profitable business.




We are very proud to offer one of the most flexible hybrid working arrangements in the industry!

The expectation for this role will involve a minimum of one day each month - working out of our London Bridge office.




Key Accountabilities

Delivery of business requirements

‚Ä¢ Defining and reporting data quality metrics

‚Ä¢ Performing data quality audits to find inconsistent data, incomplete data, rule violations

‚Ä¢ Identifying root causes of data quality issues; develop recommendations for addressing data quality issues and ensuring the data quality issues are addressed in a timely manner

‚Ä¢ Tracking data quality issues, resolutions, and consistently publish their status to stakeholders

‚Ä¢ Understanding data lineage and work with Data Owners to document metadata, controls, and business definitions

‚Ä¢ Establishing and enhancing processes and standards to improve data governance and data quality across the organisation

‚Ä¢ Working with stakeholders to catalogue, prioritise and certify Critical Data Elements

‚Ä¢ Identifying and resolve any gaps in implementation of data retention policies

‚Ä¢ Support maintenance and audit activity relating to regulatory requirements for data management

‚Ä¢ Owner of the Single Customer View processing, working with external parties to ensure effective deployment, data quality and usage as well as ensuring FSCS requirement are met

‚Ä¢ Developing excellent working relationship across data science, analytics, development and business stakeholders to build data governance and resolve data questions / issues

You‚Äôll need to have

Essential Skills:

‚Ä¢ Experience of writing SQL code to perform data analysis.

‚Ä¢ Demonstrated passion for finding and resolving problems.

‚Ä¢ Ability to analyse systems and code to understand data lineage through systems.

‚Ä¢ Understanding of relational database systems.

‚Ä¢ Experience of data analysis and data mapping.

‚Ä¢ Excellent written & verbal communication skills.

‚Ä¢ Ability to deliver in a fast-moving environment with changing priorities.

‚Ä¢ Effective team working.




Desirable skills:

‚Ä¢ Beneficial financial services experience in consumer and commercial banking

‚Ä¢ Payment schemes and processing.

‚Ä¢ Microsoft SQL Server and analytical stack




In return you'll enjoy

¬∑ Competitive basic salary

¬∑ 7.5% of salary in cash allowing you the flexibility to decide your own benefits (or simply take the cash)

¬∑ Share Option Scheme

¬∑ 26 days‚Äô holiday increasing each year of service to 33 days

¬∑ Ability to buy and sell a further 5 days holiday each year

¬∑ 4 x Life Assurance

¬∑ Pension salary sacrifice

¬∑ Family friendly policies

¬∑ Regular social activities and team events

¬∑ Charity Volunteering Day




Cashplus is an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment are considered without regard to race, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location

Bristol, Cardiff, Edinburgh, Leeds, Manchester, Newcastle-upon-Tyne, Telford, Worthing




Job summary

A data analyst collects, organises and studies data to provide business insight. In this role, you will apply tools and techniques for data analysis and data visualisation (including the use of business information tools) identify, collect and migrate data to and from a range of systems manage, clean, abstract and aggregate data alongside a range of analytical studies on that data manipulate and link different data sets and present data and conclusions in the most appropriate format for users.

Are you an experienced Data Analyst looking for an organisation that cares about the work-life balance of its workforce? An employer who offers structured personal development, progression opportunities and outstanding training. Well look no further!

We are the digital Borders & Trade team. We support many interesting projects like the delivery of the new Customs Declaration Service system and other Customs/Border systems such as GVMS. We're currently looking at Non-Functional Requirement‚Äôs (NFR) volumetrics and performance of the same.




This is an exciting opportunity to be involved in HMRC‚Äôs top priority due to the links with EU Exit and Northern Ireland protocol. This role will give you the platform to showcase your strong business analytical skills, and we'll be drawing on your versatile experience from operating in a complex Programme/Project environment.

We have invested in the latest technology to exploit one of the largest data sets in Europe. This uses a cloud based service and integrated SAS visualisation tools to revolutionise how end users can generate insight from our information.




The DDaT Profession consists of people who work in a digital, data or technology specialist role. They design, build and run government digital services. They are responsible for the way we find, access and use data and for the technology infrastructure which support those services. There are currently about 17,000 people working in the Profession. The Profession consists of people working within specialist communities of practice. There is a full list of roles on GOV.UK: www.gov.uk/search?q=DDAT




Job description

As a Data Analyst, you will:

Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and data visualisation (including the use of business information tools)

Working with large data sets of Customs declarations for imports and exports.

Producing datasets to inform stakeholders and testing of CDS

Working with project/programme staff as required to facilitate resolution of issues which could delay planned activities and deliverables.

Working closely with contractors assigned to the team to ensure the overall delivery of the team‚Äôs scope.




Manage, clean, abstract and aggregate data alongside a range of analytical studies on that data

Summarise and present data and conclusions in the most appropriate format for users.




Person specification

Essential Criteria:

Proficient in Microsoft Office suite skills (Visio, Word, PowerPoint and Excel)

Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, including presentational skills.

The insight to understand the business implications of technical decisions.

The ability to build relationships within HMRC and suppliers.

Analytical and problem-solving skills. Understand and help teams apply a range of methods to analyse data and synthesise findings.

Data modelling, data cleansing and data enrichment skills. Produce data models and understand where to use different types of data models. Using Power Bi to automate reports/dashboards and present data in a visual manner.

Data visualisation. Know how to use the most appropriate medium to visualise data to tell compelling and actionable stories relevant for business goals.

Proven IT and mathematical skills.
