#RQ800484

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Business Data Analyst - Automotive Protection

London/Hybrid




We are looking for a highly motivated versatile Business Data Analyst to join our global Automotive Protection business unit. We specialise in developing affinity insurance solutions to the global automotive sector, offering products in over 20 countries. Your primary focus will be to work with one of our larger clients understanding their data and performing analytical and performance output. This will enable you to further understand and support the pricing of specific products. You will also be responsible for suggesting changes to their products making sure they are optimised for performance and growth.




The individual will need to demonstrate excellent data mining abilities, analytical skills and very good knowledge of Microsoft applications, particularly MS Access, Excel and SQL Server. You need to be adaptable, enthusiastic and have ability to learn and problem solve.




Your responsibilities for this role may include, but are not limited to:




Design, develop and enhance analytics reporting that generates valuable business insights and drives key business decisions
Putting the customer at the centre of the role with intimate understanding and anticipation of needs, driving customer-centric approaches to analysis and design
Communicate and present data derived insights to business stakeholders
Analyse existing claims and projecting future claims using actuarial forecasting techniques, including basic pricing techniques
Forecasting performance and supporting Service Contract Managers in pricing
Monitor internationally received data checking for accuracy and reporting exceptions
Collaboratively work across the business functions. Liaising with clients, senior stakeholders, IT developers, underwriters, account managers, claims, finance and actuaries




Due to the uniqueness of the Automotive Protection business, a definitive role cannot be scheduled. You will therefore need to be versatile, having the ability to adapt to any eventuality that might come about. You should have the ability to think for yourself and act when confronted with unique situations.




You will need to be able to display you have the following qualifications and experience, or clear potential to develop these:




Demonstrable experience as a Business Analyst
Excellent knowledge of MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Very good knowledge of MS SQL Server and Access (strong understanding of relational databases and ability to write SQL queries and macros is a must)
Strong analytical skills - methodical, logical and rational approach to problem solving
Ability to capture and document business requirements in a structured and efficient manner to key stakeholders across the business.




Preferred Knowledge:




Experience with generalized linear modelling techniques and the Emblem software package will be an advantage
Experience in the insurance industry, particularly the automotive sector




QBE Cultural DNA




‚Ä¢ Everything we do at QBE is underpinned by our DNA (which interlinks seven cultural elements) ‚Äì because we know it's not just what we do that matters, it's how we do it that makes the difference. We expect all employees to role model and inspire the right behaviours that link to our cultural elements:-We are customer-focused-We are technical experts-We are inclusive-We are fast-paced-We are courageous-We are accountable-We are a team. All employees are expected to adhere to QBE‚Äôs Code of Ethics and Conduct and apply sound risk management practices

Why QBE? At My Best

At QBE, we want our people to feel rewarded and inspired to perform at their best, that‚Äôs why we have created ‚ÄúAt My Best‚Äù. It‚Äôs our connection, our way of showing we have your back. We understand that one size doesn‚Äôt fit all and that priorities can change depending on your life stage. That is why our blend of wellbeing initiatives and benefits offer flexibility to suit what matters most to you. It‚Äôs in the culture of our business, our QBE DNA, to support our people. Everything we do is underpinned by our QBE DNA - because we know it‚Äôs not just what we do that matters, it‚Äôs how we do it that makes the difference. In addition to this, we also offer flexible parental leave for both parents and have several employee network groups that support and empower our diverse workforce.

At QBE, we view our people as our most precious asset. We understand the importance of fostering a work environment that is responsive to the changing needs of today's workforce. QBE aims to build a workplace that is fair and inclusive because we want to attract and retain the best people to do the job, we have adopted flexible working across the company and welcome this conversation.

Some of the award‚Äôs QBE are proud to have won, been a finalist for, and shortlisted for include;

Employer of the Year 2022 Winner ‚Äì Insurance Insider

British Claims Awards 2022 Winner - InsurTech Award

Insurance Times Claims Excellence Awards 2022 Winner - Claims Product Solution of the Year

Working Families Best Practice Awards 2021 Finalist for: Best COVID-19 Response

Insurance Post British Insurance Awards 2022 Shortlisted for: Best Customer Care, Diversity & Inclusion Initiative of the Year 2022, Specialist Insurer of the Year (for Construction), General Insurer of the Year

We are proud to have partnerships with organisations such as Stonewall and Working Families, and our commitment to the Women in Finance Charter, the UN Women‚Äôs Empowerment Principles and Race at Work charter helps keep us accountable and transparent

Inclusion of Diversity

We are striving to create a workplace culture where all our people feel included, and we are committed to building a diverse workforce that is reflective of the communities we operate in.

We know that diversity of thought, background and experience enables better decision making, improves the quality of our delivery and helps us to meet the needs of our customers.

What next?

If you have a passion to contribute to QBE‚Äôs vision of enabling a more resilient future for our customers and the community, we encourage you to APPLY NOW! Simply click the ‚Äúapply‚Äù button to submit your CV and other relevant documents, and a member of our friendly Talent Acquisition team will be in contact to discuss your interest further if you meet the requirements of the role.

Please make the Talent Acquisition aware should there be any reasonable adjustments that may need to be made for the interview and the remainder of the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are:




Zilch, the world‚Äôs first Commerce Card, is a UK-headquartered payments technology company, known for creating the Googlisation of Payments. Our mission is to create the best and most empowering way to pay, for anything, anywhere our customers want to spend. Using Zilch‚Äôs virtual Mastercard that sits in a customer‚Äôs digital wallet, Zilch combines the best of debit, credit and savings. Meaning our customers can either earn rewards on debit payments in the form of instant cashback (‚ÄòPay in 1‚Äô) or spread interest-free repayments over six weeks (‚ÄòPay in 4‚Äô), bringing them financial choice and maturing their credit profiles.




This is uniquely made possible by the proprietary Ad-Subsidised Payment Network (ASPN) that Zilch has built, which in cookieless world enables merchants around the world to connect directly with the millions of Zilch customers they otherwise couldn‚Äôt reach and offer them savings, deals and discounts.




By vertically integrating with consumers, rather than with merchants, Zilch allows customers to pay using either reward-earning debit or interest-free credit, both online and in-store, anywhere Mastercard is accepted. To ensure we are helping our customers to manage their cash flow responsibly when they make credit payments, we set dynamic borrowing limits using best-in-market data from leading credit reference agencies, open banking technology and behavioural data analysis. Together these generate a real-time, comprehensive, 360-degree view of a customer‚Äôs affordability profile, allowing us to set personalised borrowing limits accordingly. To further bolster our customer safeguards, we are fully regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority, having obtained a consumer credit license prior to our launch.




Since launching as an FCA regulated business in the UK in September 2020 and in the US in May 2022, Zilch has amassed over 3 million customers in 24 months and turned gross profitable ‚Äì years faster than other well-known fintechs. In that time, we have provided our customers with over ¬£80 million in aggregate rewards and savings on fees and interest. Zilch is Europe‚Äôs fastest-ever company to go from Series A to double-unicorn status, in just 14 months, after raising capital at a $2bn valuation in November 2021 and maintaining that valuation in a subsequent equity funding round in Summer 2022.




We‚Äôre looking for‚Ä¶.

An analyst keen to be part of a collaborative team who is passionate about the data domain
Someone who looks for opportunities to improve process and support stakeholders
An enthusiastic data person with attention to detail who sets a high standard for themselves
A champion of metrics and the measurement of impact, with the inquisitive acumen to explain the ‚ÄúWhy‚Äù, not just the ‚ÄúWhat‚Äù
Someone with a thorough approach to model and report building who can identify solutions that meet business needs




Day-to-day responsibilities will include:

Working alongside data scientists, data analysts, data engineers and analytics engineers
Supporting business requirements for model and report building
Enhancing and optimising existing models and visualisations
Assisting with ad-hoc development and data dictionary related duties
Maintaining the metric definitions across the business
Collecting and proposing data requirements
Working to agile methodologies




Key requirements:

Strong SQL background (this is a prime requirement)
Strong experience in data visualisation (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Quick Sight, PowerBI, etc)
3+ years‚Äô experience as a data analyst working in a fast-paced environment
Strong deep-dive skills, the ability to tell a strong data story
Good stakeholder engagement experience and the ability to prioritise delivery
Understanding of operational processes




Bonus skills:

A financial technology background, e.g., risk, finance, credit, or electronic trading
Understanding of DBT
Experience with Python
Experience of automation and optimisation

What we offer:

Hybrid working - 3 days per week in the London office
Income protection - long term injury or illness the company will pay 75% of your base salary for up to 5 year
Pension scheme, 5% employee contribution and 3% employer contribution
26 days holiday + UK Bank Holidays
Family friendly policy
Maternity - 6 months full pay
Paternity - 6 weeks full pay
Enhanced Shared Parental Leave Pay
Enhanced Adoption Pay and return to work bonus
Death in Service - 3x your annual basic salary up to ¬£550k
Private medical insurance
Specialist referrals
Counselling / Talking Therapy / CBT
Dental
Optical
Physiotherapy / osteopathy
Cancer cover
Virtual Doctor Online - online GP appointments within 2 hours
Gym membership discounts
¬£200 joining bonus for WFH set up on Zilch app
Learning & Development - company support for professional qualifications and learning development
Employee assistance programme
Legal advice
Financial advice (including mortgage advice)
Childcare support
Relocation advice
Lifeworks perks - online cash back at over 1200 brands, cinema discounts, digital gift cards
Hybrid working model
Casual dress code
Work related social events
Free fruit, snacks, and refreshments in the office (and in office barista)
Opportunities to work from overseas offices
Office breakout zone, including table tennis, pool, and comfortable seating

Zilch is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.

HTML:
Who we are:


Zilch, the world‚Äôs first Commerce Card, is a UK-headquartered payments technology company, known for creating the Googlisation of Payments. Our mission is to create the best and most empowering way to pay, for anything, anywhere our customers want to spend. Using Zilch‚Äôs virtual Mastercard that sits in a customer‚Äôs digital wallet, Zilch combines the best of debit, credit and savings. Meaning our customers can either earn rewards on debit payments in the form of instant cashback (‚ÄòPay in 1‚Äô) or spread interest-free repayments over six weeks (‚ÄòPay in 4‚Äô), bringing them financial choice and maturing their credit profiles.


This is uniquely made possible by the proprietary Ad-Subsidised Payment Network (ASPN) that Zilch has built, which in cookieless world enables merchants around the world to connect directly with the millions of Zilch customers they otherwise couldn‚Äôt reach and offer them savings, deals and discounts.


By vertically integrating with consumers, rather than with merchants, Zilch allows customers to pay using either reward-earning debit or interest-free credit, both online and in-store, anywhere Mastercard is accepted. To ensure we are helping our customers to manage their cash flow responsibly when they make credit payments, we set dynamic borrowing limits using best-in-market data from leading credit reference agencies, open banking technology and behavioural data analysis. Together these generate a real-time, comprehensive, 360-degree view of a customer‚Äôs affordability profile, allowing us to set personalised borrowing limits accordingly. To further bolster our customer safeguards, we are fully regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority, having obtained a consumer credit license prior to our launch.


Since launching as an FCA regulated business in the UK in September 2020 and in the US in May 2022, Zilch has amassed over 3 million customers in 24 months and turned gross profitable ‚Äì years faster than other well-known fintechs. In that time, we have provided our customers with over ¬£80 million in aggregate rewards and savings on fees and interest. Zilch is Europe‚Äôs fastest-ever company to go from Series A to double-unicorn status, in just 14 months, after raising capital at a $2bn valuation in November 2021 and maintaining that valuation in a subsequent equity funding round in Summer 2022.

Title: Data Analytics - 3 month Intern
Description:
Paysend is a UK-based FinTech company that has over 5 million customers and is on a mission to change the way that people and businesses globally manage their money.

Our growth has been fast and exciting. We were the first FinTech company to introduce global card-to-card transfers, connecting 12 billion cards issued by the international payment systems Mastercard, Visa, China Union Pay and local cards schemes, and we have strategic partnerships with many of the world's top payment companies. Born in April 2017, we now serve customers in over 150 countries and have over 200 employees, having more than doubled in size since March 2020.

In May 2021, we secured US$125 million in a Series B funding round which valued the company at US$700+ million. Since then we've expanded into Asia-Pacific with the opening of our Singapore headquarters, we've opened our Americas and LatAm headquarters in Miami, and recently launched our new European Technology Centre in Belgrade, Serbia. Additionally, we've been recognized by Deloitte as the third fastest growing technology company in the UK in 2022, as well as featuring in Sifted's UK start-ups and scale-ups to watch in 2022 ranking.

Paysend is one of the most popular and trusted digital money services in the world with 4.7/5 Trustpilot score

Our success is built on supreme technology, friendly customer service and, of course, the very best talent in the FinTech industry. We're looking for the future gamechangers of FinTech to join us as we positively disrupt the personal and business payments markets and make financial services more accessible and inclusive for individuals and small businesses around the world.

Every day is a new challenge at Paysend, and we approach each project with ambition, innovation and creativity.

About The Role

Working within the People and Culture team, the main objective will be to help us partner with the business to turn people data into insights that will enable business stakeholders to understand their teams, what matters most to them and act accordingly. This is a summer internship starting late June/early July.

What you'll be doing:

Developing dashboards with clear data visualisations in Tableau and superset (or a similar reporting tool)
Help us connect all of our people data into a single data warehouse and as such SQL knowledge is appreciated
Help us explore opportunities for automation using any script/language of your choice
Conduct descriptive, confirmatory and exploratory data analysis
Work in an agile manner to help us use the insights generated to lead to real change


What you'll need to be successful:

Currently pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree that provides dedicated modules for math or scientific study
Enjoy working with data and have knowledge or experience with SQL (or other query language) and general-purpose programming languages such as Python or R
Have proven analytical and problem-solving skills
A real curiosity to understand for how things work and how they can be improved
Ability to communicate complex information in a clear and simple manner
Mindset that focuses on reaching core of problems; not just the first issue encountered


Why Paysend?

We're looking for people who share our passion for innovation, buy into the Paysend ethos and add value to our team. When you join Paysend, you'll have the chance to grow and develop as the business does.

We believe in empowering people to be successful in their jobs, and we pay them fairly for their expertise. We give everyone the context and tools to operate as business owners and encourage our people to contribute with their hearts, minds and creativity.

In the fast-paced FinTech industry the Paysend journey may not always be easy, but we succeed by working together to create solutions that break the status quo. We employ the right people to help us steer the business towards success and global influence.

If Paysend sounds like the perfect company for you, we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us
We aim to encourage a culture where people can be themselves and be valued for their strengths. We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. At KatKin we celebrate differences, and everything that makes our colleagues unique, by upholding an inclusive environment in which we can all thrive.¬†
We want to make our recruitment processes accessible to everyone, so if there is any way that we can support you to be the best you can be, please contact terrie@katkin.com

KatKin‚Äôs Opportunity
Did you know that some cat food contains as little as 4% meat? Considering cats need meat to thrive, that‚Äôs a problem. Cats have been neglected by the pet food industry for too long, being offered variations of dog food, rather than food designed specifically for their enjoyment and health. KatKin gives cats what they really need and crave - 100% Fresh premium meat. Pure and simple. Rated 4.9 out of 5 on Trustpilot with many cat owners reporting transformative benefits, we‚Äôre the highest rated cat food brand in the UK. Join our fast-paced, innovative team and help more cat people discover the best food for their cat‚Äôs health!

Why You‚Äôll Love Working With Us
If you want to join and grow an ambitious, mission-led, high-growth startup that‚Äôs making a genuine difference to cat‚Äôs (and their people‚Äôs) lives, you‚Äôll love working at KatKin. With a growing audience of cat people, an expanding Fresh meals recipe book, and the science to back it all up, you get the sense that KatKin is a mere whisker away from becoming a household name for helping cat people do the best for their cats.

The Role
This role is based in our London office a minimum of 3 days a week.

As a Data Analyst at KatKin, you‚Äôll be key in providing insights for effective decision making and improve our insights capability. You‚Äôll have a big and meaningful impact on how we do data and we want to hear your opinions about what we do and how we do it. You will get to use data to build reports, dashboards and data visualisations tailored to various departments across the business. You will be a central point of contact for data analytics, ad-hoc queries and support to key stakeholders in teams like Growth, Finance, R&D and KatKin Executives.

This Hands-On Role Includes Ownership Of

Help design and run experiments (i.e. A/B tests), communicate the results, and make recommendations to senior stakeholders to impact business decisions

Working in a fast and agile environment using Looker, SQL and Spreadsheets to deliver insights and value to the business.

Play a key role in the Growth team to help shape the direction and inform decisions with data.

Help answer more difficult questions that can‚Äôt always be solved with SQL or Looker using the tools of your choice (e.g. Excel, Python, Machine Learning)

You‚Äôll be constantly learning and improving with support from other team members and senior stakeholders to upskill in areas of your choice (e.g. analytics, engineering, science).

You‚Äôll work within the analytics team sharing responsibilities


Who You Are
Essential

You have at least 2 years experience as a data analyst, BI analyst, or analytics engineer using a modern data stack.

Ability to write and understand complex SQL queries as well as being comfortable reading and understanding relational data models

Experience building Looker Dashboards, Explores and Views (LookML, github (PRs etc))

¬† Desirable

You have experience in a B2C business

You are confident communicating with non-technical stakeholders and delivering data products

You have experience working in a fast-paced, start-up environment


Nice to Have (but not essential)

Experience with dbt development

Experience with at least 1 database architecture¬†

Cat lover

¬†

What We Offer

Competitive salary and a MacBook

Career defining opportunity in being instrumental to scaling our brand, fast

No egos and a small close-knit team

25 days holiday every year plus your birthday off

4 week WFA (work from anywhere) policy

2 days WFH every week

12-weeks paternity / maternity leave

Discount for KatKin fresh meals

AXA Health Insurance including optical and dental

Yearly personal development budget¬†

Company pension

Free popcorn, all the tea and coffee you can drink, fresh fruit, great banter and a cat (and dog) friendly office


To Apply
Submit your details below or send your CV to jon@katkin.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About MyTutor:

MyTutor is the UK‚Äôs leading online platform for one-to-one learning, and we're on a mission to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people. We‚Äôre building a future where access to high-quality learning is stress-free for those who can afford it, and funded for those who can't.

One-to-one tuition is one of the most powerful ways to improve pupils‚Äô grades, confidence and life chances. Yet it remains out of reach for many. Our handpicked community of tutors work online with students from all walks of life, raising results on average by one whole grade. Since Covid-19 and all the disruption to education, we've worked with the government to provide safe and reliable tuition to more students than ever. We're proud to have worked with over 650 schools across the UK, and our tutors have given over a million lessons.

Since the pandemic, we've scaled up and kept a working environment that encourages collaboration and support. We always prioritise our team's development and well-being, remotely right now, and in an office again in the future. We have regular company socials, and there are chances every week to sit down with someone for a cuppa and a chat.

The role in a nutshell:

Here at MyTutor we are growing our data team, and we‚Äôre looking for an experienced, data-driven and passionate Analytics professional to support our wider business.

You‚Äôll be the 7th member of our collaborative data team, which is made up of data analysts, a data scientist and an analytics engineer. You‚Äôll be working in a fast-paced environment with stakeholders across product, marketing, customer success, sales and business operations to drive deeper understanding of the impact of customer and tutor behaviour, acquisition and retention, and overall business health.

With your data expertise and commercial awareness, you‚Äôll influence the strategy and decisions that fuel our rapid growth as we look to become one of the world‚Äôs leading learning platforms.

You‚Äôll be working with our analytics engineer to ensure that we build insights in a sustainable fashion, getting a chance to develop your data modelling and coding skills along the way.

We work in an agile way, so expect daily stand-ups, regular retrospectives and beautifully crafted tickets!

Our stack

We have a state-of-the-art data stack at MyTutor:

Snowflake for our data warehouse
Stitch/Airbyte for data ingestion
dbt for data transformation
Paradime for lineage/data catalogue
HighTouch for reverse ETL
Machine learning using Python + Snowpark
Tableau and Lightdash for Data Visualisation


What you can expect:

Be one of the go-to people for business insights and provide a vital link in the strategy - execution - analysis chain to ensure we move quickly and stay ahead.
Lead analysis of various business areas, focused on developing the capability to translate data into actionable insights that will improve campaign performance.
Spend time building beautiful, well-tested and well-documented data models that make self-serve analytics easy
Work with our data scientist to support product discovery and experimentation using cutting-edge advanced analytics techniques
Drive deeper understanding of customer and tutor behaviours, and efficiency of business operations - anything from acquisition, churn and lifetime value to the efficiency of our tools in serving customers.
Assist with ad hoc queries and provide analytical support to our fast-growing business as it evolves.
Seek out new techniques and opportunities for greater efficiency as well as owning best practices across the data function.
A progression framework that includes pathways to analytics engineer and data scientist


The type of person we would love to meet:

You have experience tackling complex analytical challenges, supporting various functions with funnel/spend optimisation and making decisions based high-quality information.
You have advanced skills in data analysis - SQL, statistical methods and modelling on large data sets.
You have excellent data visualisation skills and storytelling, capable of driving actions from stakeholders (e.g. self-service visualisation tools or slide decks).
You have a passion for solving ambiguous, complex and unstructured problems
You are a bar-raiser who sees improving those around you as important as your own delivery
You are comfortable working across multiple projects in a rapidly changing environment, able to balance the need for accuracy and efficiency to prioritise work.
You deliver accurate, meaningful and timely information, based on well-thought-through research and your interpersonal skills enable you to articulate complex concepts in simple terms to stakeholders.


Great if you have:

Experience with dbt (if you don‚Äôt have this, it‚Äôs basically just SQL with some config so if you‚Äôre a SQL whizz you‚Äôll pick it up in no time!)
Experience with git
Experience with AB testing
Experience with GA (not a huge part of the role but we are currently light on GA skills in the team!)
Experience with digital/performance marketing


Benefits:

Flexible working culture with access to our London HQ, global co-working spaces and home office setup
Investment in your learning with a personal L&D budget of up to ¬£350
Workplace pension
¬£40k - ¬£63k salary, depending on experience (we are hiring at multiple levels)
Private Healthcare option through BUPA
Enhanced parent policies
Cycle, tech and gym schemes
Mentor/mentee scheme
Regular team events & socials (we've just had a remote Sofar Sounds gig and wine tasting!)
25 days holiday (plus public holidays)
A culture that champions well-being with workshops and 1:1 coaching


MyTutor is committed to creating an inclusive workplace, and we have set up our own EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who hosts regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.

HTML:
About MyTutor:

MyTutor is the UK‚Äôs leading online platform for one-to-one learning, and we're on a mission to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people. We‚Äôre building a future where access to high-quality learning is stress-free for those who can afford it, and funded for those who can't.

One-to-one tuition is one of the most powerful ways to improve pupils‚Äô grades, confidence and life chances. Yet it remains out of reach for many. Our handpicked community of tutors work online with students from all walks of life, raising results on average by one whole grade. Since Covid-19 and all the disruption to education, we've worked with the government to provide safe and reliable tuition to more students than ever. We're proud to have worked with over 650 schools across the UK, and our tutors have given over a million lessons.

Since the pandemic, we've scaled up and kept a working environment that encourages collaboration and support. We always prioritise our team's development and well-being, remotely right now, and in an office again in the future. We have regular company socials, and there are chances every week to sit down with someone for a cuppa and a chat.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst (Poland)
Description:
Vantage Point is a leading Consultancy dealing with Top Investment Banks and Buy-Side Financial Services Businesses. Our areas of specialism include Process Engineering, Data Operations, Front-Back Office Operations, Regulatory Compliance and Risk.




We are focused on recruiting the brightest graduate talent. We hire people with passion that demonstrate that they have what it takes to succeed in the Financial Services industry. Through our experience we have created the Vantage Point Advantage Accelerator Programme, this unique Model delivers formal training, personal development and mentoring to create high calibre, highly skilled Change Professionals.




With a rapidly expanding client base, Vantage Point is looking to hire Data Scientists with a strong academic background in data science, statistics and/or mathematics to join our ambitious and fast growing team. This will be a client-facing role (following a fast tracked training process) and you will be working on client site in London. Employed under our innovative AdVantage Accelerator Programme, this is a 18 month scheme.




Requirements:

University degree in a data science, statistical, mathematical, accountancy or finance degree or other relevant subject.
Experience of working within analytics and/or data science is beneficial but not essential
A real passion for data and analytics
Excellent communication skills (Must be Fluent in English) ability to generate ideas and execute them effectively
The ability to organise time, learn quickly and work well under pressure
Deliver focused and strong attention to detail
An Analytical Mind
Confident, Ambitious, Client focused attitude
Strong entrepreneurial, analytical, quantitative and client relations‚Äô skills.
Eligibility to work in Poland at the time of starting employment. Please note, we are not able to sponsor work visas.




What we are offering:

Training in Investment Banking business knowledge
All relevant technical and analytical training
A fantastic starting point for a career in Banking
Dynamic and exciting environment
Excellent experience




If you feel that you meet the criteria of the Graduate Business Consultant then please apply! Deadlines




This program has a start date for the beginning of March 2023. We are recruiting on a rolling basis so please apply earlier for consideration. We look forward to receiving you application.




If you feel that you meet the criteria for this exciting opportunity then please apply!

Title: Data Insight Analyst
Description:
Data Insight Analyst, Contract, ¬£400 p/day, Outside iR35, 6 months, London Hybrid Contract role for an Insight and Data Analyst to work on a commercial real estate programme. You will use your data analytics, visualization and insight skills to providing ongoing data analytics with a focus on the workplace and the 'office of the future', trends, swipe rates, occupancy and space planning - basically, and data and insight into how offices and work spaces are used on both a micro and macro level. You will need to have a good background in gathering and presenting insights, to make data and analytical led decisions. You will be part of a large programme team so you will need and want to speak with colleagues, communicate with stakeholders and project teams - and be able to report back. You would be working alongside a senior data analyst / data science, and the need for this interim position is the sheer size and scope of what's needed. If you enjoy providing in depth data analysis within a corporate programme please apply. The project is for a large tier 1 investment bank, and their shift to a new workplace and new ways of working. Data Insight Analyst, Contract, ¬£400 p/day, Outside iR35, 6 months, London Hybrid

Title: Data Analyst, Digital Analytics and Insights
Description:
Role Description:



We are building the data analytics and insights capabilities within the Corporate Affairs, Brand and Marketing function. We'll need to centralise, structure, and analyse data from across the function and deliver insights to increase and assess the value of the bank's global marketing efforts.
We have an opportunity for a talented data analyst skilled in data management, visualisation and storytelling to influence how marketing budgets are spent.

Key Responsibilities



Work with the Data Analytics & Insights Director to build and implement a data strategy for the Corporate Affairs Brand and Marketing function.
Manage a central repository of data from various sources.
Query that data in response to business questions, including how to position a campaign, how to measure the function's impact and how to resonate better with our target audiences.
Visualise and present insights from various data sources to inform decisions made by stakeholders from both technical and non-technical backgrounds.
Keep up-to-date with the latest trends in data analytics and insights, including MarTech.

Regulatory & Business Conduct



Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct.
Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.

Key Stakeholders







Corporate Affairs, Brand & Marketing professionals
Digital Channels & Content
Global Head, Data Analytics & Insights
Client Insights & Research teams

Role Specific Technical Competencies



Social Media Strategy
Channel optimisation /Digital Marketing Channels
Account Management
Content Management skills
Crisis Management
Data & Insights
Campaign Evaluation skills
Reporting & Analytics
Campaign Management Skills
Customer Service skills
Sales skills
Training skills
Personal data management
Financial analytics
Brand Management
Project management

Qualification



Analyst with 3+ years' experience in Data Science/ Data Analytics. Experience with digital marketing data (web & social media analytics preferred).
Data visualisation (e.g. Tableau/ PowerBI/ Looker) and data management platform experience essential (Customer Data Platform experience preferred).
A passion for data strategy and management.
Proven SQL and Excel skills.
Exception attention to data quality.
A talent for distilling data from various sources into actionable insights.
A strong focus on communicating and sharing compelling insights with stakeholders of all seniorities, enabling data-led decision making.
Self-motivated, thrives in ambiguity, and ability to manage multiple projects at once.
Good all-round communication skills, including fluent written and spoken English.

About Standard Chartered



We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 160 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents. And we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.

Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion. Together we:



Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
Be better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations
Time-off including annual, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 weeks maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum
Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns
Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning
Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.
Recruitment assessments - some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.

Visit our careers website

Description:
Data Analyst: Power BI, Excel, PowerPoint, Data Analytics, Construction




Data Analyst required for a Global Construction & Property Consultancy that boasts an impressive portfolio of blue chip clients. In a newly specialist Analyst team, you will utilize how data is reported and collected, developing a company wide data strategy.




The successful Data Analyst will have excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills and proficient knowledge of Power BI. This is an exciting opportunity for a diligent Data Analyst to join a diverse team who truly value the training and development of their employees.

Identify and recommend digital platforms to assist with data collection and analysis




Requirements:

Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills
Experience of Power BI
Proficient Secondary research skills
Demonstrate excellent data analytical skills
Construction/Property background is highly desirable

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - London Based Studio. Remote in Europe.

Join our data analytics team and take a key role in the continued growth of our live games and the successful launches of new games. With your analysis, our teams (product, marketing, art, engineering etc.) will make better informed decisions. This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact on a highly respected and fast-growing mobile games studio.

We continually re-evaluate our analytics stack, aiming to have an industry-leading approach. You will be working especially closely with senior management, other analysts, product managers, and the marketing team.

You will help lead deeper explorative analyses to directly shape the future direction of our games. The ability to clearly articulate hypotheses, run complex SQL queries to mine the wealth of data we collect, and present findings and suggestions is also critical to the role. You will be expected to be proactive in contributing data-backed recommendations for our gaming titles.

Responsibilities

Writing and maintaining SQL queries and SQL-driven dashboards
Delivering accurate, insightful and actionable analysis to the rest of the company, including Product Managers and Performance Marketers
Creating self-conducted deep-dive reports, mining available behavioural data to spot barriers to and opportunities for improved performance
Assisting in designing and assessing the results of split testing experiments conducted in our games Requirements
Strong experience in creating SQL queries
Experience with designing and setting up dashboards in BI tools is a plus
Advanced MS Excel skills
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets (Ideally with R or Python) is highly desired
Experience within, or a passion for game, bonus points for mobile
Life at with us

Our HQ is in the heart of central London - although currently we work completely from home due to COVID policy. We‚Äôre a fast-moving, creative studio. Our people are what makes our studio fun, exciting and productive.

We Reward Our Employees With

Flexible working hours - core hours 10am-5pm
We strive to maintain a healthy work/life balance
Competitive salaries
There is a discretionary bonus based on company and individual performance and we keep salaries up to date during the annual pay review
Support with relocation
Support to learn, develop and progress with us
Free snacks and drinks
Amazing socials, company outings, game jams, Friday night drinks and more!
Company pension contribution
28 days holiday and additional days off between Christmas and New Year. There is a tenure reward scheme where you will gain extra holidays
We value diversity and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all suitable applicants. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status

Title: Data Analyst (Fraud)*
Description:
At Digital Turbine, we make mobile advertising experiences more meaningful and rewarding for users, app publishers, and advertisers ‚Äî intelligently connecting people in more ways, across more devices. We provide app publishers and advertisers with powerful ads and experiences that captivate consumers, fuel performance, and help telecoms and OEMs supercharge awareness, acquisition, and monetization. In a rapidly evolving industry, we are constantly innovating and creating better paths of discovery to connect consumers, publishers, and advertisers across the mobile ecosystem.




Digital Turbine is looking for a Data Analyst (Fraud) to join our Offerwall Tech Operations team. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying suspicious behavior in our traffic and taking appropriate action.




Responsibilities of Fraud Analyst:




Extracting and analyzing data from various data sources
Automatize recurrent operations
Executes routine tasks according to department service level agreement
Thoroughly investigating fraud cases to identify the source of suspicious behavior and to research ways of reducing it
Supporting the team in global fraud and risk projects, identifying pain points and tackling them to drive performance and ensure best practices
Build high-level working relationships with Account Managers, and communicate with internal stakeholders on fraudulent activities
Helping to implement, optimize and follow fraud processes across our organization
Working with the product team on fraud-related investigations and implementation of anti-fraud solutions.
Introduce routine practices for looking for suspicious indicators/ transactions/ behaviors and trends.




Requirements of Fraud Analyst:




3+ years working in a role that involves querying, analyzing, and getting insights from very large amounts of data
3+ years in a position that requires communication with stakeholders
Proficient with SQL and comfortable working with different data tools (MySQL, Athena)
Proficient with Google Sheet (or equivalent spreadsheet technology) for analyzing data
Practical knowledge of at least a programming language for automatizing recurrent work (Python etc.)
Curiosity to find anomalies in the data that reveal fraudulent behavior
Ability in problem-solving
Previous experience in managing fraud and claims disputes; customer support or client services - an advantage
Familiarity with implementing reporting dashboards - an advantage
Excellent English, both written and spoken




About Digital Turbine:




Digital Turbine (NASDAQ: APPS) powers superior mobile consumer experiences and results for the world‚Äôs leading telcos, advertisers and publishers. Our end-to-end platform uniquely simplifies the ability to supercharge awareness, acquisition and monetization ‚Äî connecting our partners to more consumers, in more ways, across more devices.




The company is headquartered in Austin, Texas, with global offices in New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, London, Berlin, Singapore, Tel Aviv, and other cities serving top agency, app developer, and advertising markets. Listed on Deloitte Technology Fast 500 for six consecutive years since 2015 and winner of Austin Chamber of Commerce‚Äôs Company Culture in 2020.




Digital Turbine is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We embed diversity in our mindset, products, and teams to empower an inclusive, equitable, and culturally fluent environment. Building this culture within our teams makes us better collaborators and partners, driving better outcomes.




To view our Global Recruitment Privacy Notice, please click here .

Title: Data Analyst*in the toll environment (d/m/w)
Description:
Your tasks




You will create and visualize statistical analyses based on multidimensional data
You maintain & optimize reporting tools and scripts including user support and consulting, which are used in the field
You monitor data interfaces and operate problem analysis and troubleshooting in case of malfunction
You collaborate significantly in the development of departmental key figures and prepare them for management purposes
You co-develop a monitoring for the control process and work on the conception of the configurations and parameters necessary for it
You perform application tests and implement them after release approval
You actively collaborate on future topics and projects & contribute your ideas and knowledge in the field of artificial intelligence and digitization of processes
You will contribute ideas for optimizing reporting for the Federal Office for Logistics and Mobility
Your profile




You have already gained initial experience as a Data Scientist or Business Intelligence Analyst and are now looking for a new challenge
You preferably have a degree in computer science or a comparable field of study
You have very good knowledge in statistics and experience with reporting and data warehouse systems
You bring routine in dealing with databases
You have experience in analysis and modeling and a keen interest in automating processes
You have a strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills as well as an independent and structured working style




What we offer




Broad range of qualifications for professional and personal development
Hybrid work
Interdisciplinary, motivated and dynamic team that shapes progress
Attractive remuneration as well as extensive social benefits from the job ticket to a subsidy for lunch to the company pension scheme.




Interested?




We look forward to receiving your meaningful application documents, including the earliest possible start date and the expected end of studies. Please send us your documents exclusively as a PDF file with a maximum total size of 3 MB. Your personal data will be processed in accordance with our privacy policy for applications.




Applicants* with a severe disability (d/m/w) will be given preference in case of equal suitability.




Your contact person




Jule Heldt - 030/74077-3653 - karriere@toll-collect.de




Toll Collect GmbH - Human Resources Management - Linkstra√üe 4, 10785 Berlin

Title: Product Data Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
Company Description




At Omio we take a unique approach to travel. Our pioneering search platform provides a seamless way to find and book the fastest, cheapest and best travel options by train, bus,flight and rental cars to thousands of cities, towns and villages across Europe, the United States and Canada. That translates into savings‚Äîon money and time‚Äîfor you!‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã




Job Description




We are looking for a multitasking person who can thrive in a fast paced environment by engaging in quick data backed decisions.




You apply statistical methods to analyze and mine business data, identify correlations and new metrics, find trends and patterns, and create data reports to formulate, answer questions and solve business problems.




As a strong collaborator with different teams especially in Tech (Product, Engineering, Design) you foster a customer-driven and data-driven strategy to drive product evolution, enhance customer experience and deliver growth and financial impact.




As a Product Analyst at Omio, you will:

enable product and business teams by providing meaningful dashboards that include relevant KPIs to measure product initiatives
generate data backed actionable insights that help improve product experience
spot gaps in front end tracking and recommend solutions (capturing schema) to Business Intelligence and Product team, and assure quality of the implementation
generate tactical insights from analytics and visualization to drive strategy
create and help others create best-practice dashboards and reports




This is what you bring to the team

2 - 4 years of experience working as a data analyst, product analytics experience is a plus
Understanding of how analytics helps in business decisions and growth
Ability to think in a structured way
Hands-on in Tableau dashboard development
Proficiency in office tools like Excel, Powerpoint
Strong SQL knowledge
Hands-on experience of implementation and analysis from web analytics tools like Amplitude, Omniture, GA, etc.
Knowledge of basic R/Python is a plus
Fluent English is a must, additional languages are always welcome




What‚Äôs in it for you? #LifeAtOmio

Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are changing the way people travel, and you too can have an impact on this ride
A competitive and attractive compensation package
Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
A diverse team of more than 45 nationalities




We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst - Digital Products
Description:
Working Hours: Monday to Friday (37.5 hours per week)

Location: Hybrid (working from our Bath/Berlin office 3 times per week)

We are expanding our Digital Product Team with an Analyst, to assist with the end-to-end execution of experiment and CRO initiatives across our portfolio of websites.

The purpose of this role is to ensure our storefront and experimentation teams are provided with proactive and regular analysis and reporting to measure performance and act where appropriate.

You will help shape and influence the design and flow through the Lovehoney websites to support the optimisation of user experiences that are intuitive, engaging and provide value to the business. You will be assisting the team in the discovery, design, and development of a wide variety of products, features and journeys, including optimising page layouts, promotional devices, campaign pages, user self-service tools, loyalty engagement journeys and more.

You‚Äôll be responsible for undertaking exploratory analysis to uncover new opportunities for optimisation, pre-launch analysis to support the prioritisation framework and reporting on the impact new code releases have on key metrics and user journeys for each website.

You‚Äôll be a true advocate for the customer, putting your understanding of ecommerce, evidence gathering, statistical analysis and reporting to full use to help form best-in-class website features and functions that will improve the user experience and deliver on business objectives. You‚Äôll thrive on seeing the value added by your work and will develop and hone your technical skills to have maximum commercial impact and relevance to the business.

To succeed in this role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be exceptional at providing clear actionable insight. You‚Äôll love ecommerce, statistical analysis and customer behaviour and have a drive to continuously improve our performance to exceed targets.

If you love working with data, strive to improve business performance and have hands-on experience of experimentation within an ecommerce context then we‚Äôd love to meet you.

Key Responsibilities

Regularly review and interrogate the Lovehoney analytical packages to identify emerging user struggles and to measure & report on the performance of newly deployed features and products

Gather and evaluate user feedback, transaction and clickstream data using tools such as GA, ContentSquare and Tableau in collaboration with UX, product managers and developers

Use familiar web analytics tools such as GA360, GA4, GTM and Contentsquare as well as develop bespoke analytics tools and data pipelines using SQL, Python and R

Help develop experiment plans and help shape the experiment roadmap

Deliver insights to Product Managers to inform their decisions and help them prioritise their backlog

Design effective experiments (A/B tests) with data driven hypotheses, calculating appropriate sample sizes & run times and ensure they are run in a scientifically valid way

Analyse experiment data when ready using techniques such as Bayesian inference and Null-hypothesis t-testing

Report on results and test outcomes & keep stakeholders informed, producing clearly articulated summaries of research & testing activities for relevant business stakeholders and the wider business.

Collaborate with our Digital Analytics Implementation Team and Data Teams to help define what we need to measure on our sites to quantify the successes & failures of product features & initiatives

Ad-hoc exploratory analysis of user journeys

Create dashboards in R, Tableau and Google Data Studio to present data drawn from multiple sources in a meaningful

Set up and run data pipelines alongside our BI team, connecting data sources as required for analysis and monitoring

Assist in improving our processes and tooling to enhance our testing & analytics capabilities.

Advise teams on the right metrics to use when setting up experiments and the right way to retrieve those metrics from our data sets during the evaluation phase.

Seek to challenge stakeholders to drive accountability and ownership.

Work closely with our Data/BI and Commercial Insights teams

Deliver ongoing support to product teams to assist them at every stage of the experiment lifecycle, from helping them to decide on the right type of experiment to use, all the way through to making sure they reach the right conclusions when analysing the results.

__Skills, Knowledge and Expertise

A Statistics or Science degree (or similar qualification)

Curious and proactive with a strong attention to detail

1 - 2 years' experience working in a commercially driven team

Advanced in the use of Google Sheets or Excel

Experience in online retail analytics

Strong working knowledge of Google Analytics

SQL, Python, ETL Systems and R for data analysis

Experience with BigQuery and Tableau or similar visualisation tools.

Technical experience of analytical tracking, website tagging and creating intricate funnels.

Experience of A/B/n and Multivariate Testing including a solid understanding of Bayesian & Frequentist statistical approaches

Knowledge & experience with R (ideally including the Tidyverse), SQL and Excel in an experiment analysis context

Be an expert at data storytelling with the ability to distil complex quantitative and qualitative data down to key insights and present actionable recommendations in an accessible and coherent way

Work with the wider analytics teams to ensure we have the correct instrumentation in place to answer business questions. For example, working with the GTM team to support the definition and briefing of site analytics tracking improvements

Strong interest in Digital and/or Agile Product Development

Comfortable working in a fast-paced, changing environment

Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complicated data analysis to non-technical users.__

Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchie√ºbergreifend ‚Äì auch im Home-Office. Die Mauteinnahmen dienen dem Erhalt und Ausbau der Verkehrsinfrastruktur und damit der Mobilit√§t von Personen und G√ºtern im Herzen Europas.

Unterst√ºtzen Sie unseren Fachbereich Kontrolle in Berlin am Potsdamer Platz zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Zeitpunkt als:

Data Analyst*in im Mautumfeld (d/m/w)

Referenznummer: 20475

Aufgaben

Sie erstellen und visualisieren statistische Auswertungen auf Basis mehrdimensionaler Daten
Sie pflegen & optimieren Reportingtools und Skripte inkl. Anwenderunterst√ºtzung und -beratung, welche im Bereich eingesetzt werden
Sie √ºberwachen Datenschnittstellen und betreiben Problemanalyse und Problembehebung im St√∂rungsfall
Sie arbeiten ma√ügeblich bei der Entwicklung von Fachbereichs-Kennzahlen mit und bereiten diese management-tauglich auf

Sie haben vorzugsweise ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung
Sie haben sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Statistik und Erfahrung mit Reporting- und DataWarehouse-Systemen
Sie bringen Routine im Umgang mit Datenbanken mit
Sie verf√ºgen √ºber Erfahrung in der Analyse und Modellierung und haben ein gro√ües Interesse an der Automatisierung von Prozessen

Hybrides Arbeiten

Attraktive Verg√ºtung sowie umfangreiche Sozialleistungen vom Job-Ticket √ºber einen Zuschuss zum Mittagessen bis zur betrieblichen Altersversorgung

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst - Growth (f/m/x)
Description:
Description

We at elopage believe that everyone can turn their passion into a career! With our cloud-based SaaS platform solution elopage.com, we offer everyone the opportunity to create and sell digital products and online courses quickly and easily. More than 55,000 elopagers already trust in our expertise!

Our story started in 2015. For the first 5 years of our existence, we grew organically and became a profitable company with around 60 employees. Then, in September 2021, we raised $38 million in series A funding, led by Target Global and with participation from Partech Ventures and Avid Ventures. Since then we have more than doubled in size and are currently employing 150 people.

Our Values

We perform like entrepreneurs - we start with yes, we act like owners, and we trust you to know the how.
Explore & overcome - we always want to understand the why and we never quit.
Always reimagining towards tomorrow - change is constant and failure an opportunity to learn.
One tribe - together we can achieve more than we can on our own. Our people are our most important asset and we support you to get the best out of yourself.


Diversity & Inclusion

At elopage we are all different and that‚Äôs our greatest strength. We draw on the differences in who we are, what we‚Äôve experienced, and how we think. We drive inclusion, internally and externally, as we want to make growth available for everyone. We do not tolerate discrimination based on racial identities, religious beliefs, colour, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you unique.

Responsibilities

Data is a critical part of our Growth department. With the analyses and insights that you will create, the Growth department will be able to make decisions that have the highest business impact. As a Data Analyst - Growth, you will play a key role in developing and executing the data strategy for the Growth department within Elopage. You will be part of the central Data team and will work closely together with the different stakeholders across the Growth department, delivering end-to-end data projects based on priorities.

Work collaboratively with the CGO, VPs/Heads of Sales, Marketing, CRM and Customer Support, to define and track meaningful KPIs, assess opportunities, prioritize tasks with the highest business impact and proactively find trends / insights that change the focus of the business units.
Work on a wide variety of projects within our Growth department, for example provide insights to optimize marketing campaigns, improve efficiency of our Sales teams, Revenue Operations optimization, increase Customer Lifetime Value, predict churn, increase the customer satisfaction score, and more.
Create and maintain dashboards for the different functions within the Growth department.
Use quantitative analyses to deep-dive into the full customer journey: from acquiring and activating leads to retaining and upselling existing customers.
Join and present in business decision meetings as the advocate of the Data team to uphold data-driven thinking.
Mentor other team members and proactively improve the Data team by introducing new techniques and technologies.
Contribute to the development of our data warehouse, which helps our entire company using uniform metrics, getting better insights and having easier access to data.


Requirements

Strong quantitative background and 3+ years of relevant experience as data / business analyst.
Good understanding of and experience with several Marketing-, Sales and Rev Ops analytics tools and processes, e.g. Web / App tracking tools like Google Analytics & Google Tag Manager, CRM systems like Salesforce, Marketing attribution, Campaign optimization & ROI measurement, Customer Lifetime Value tracking & prediction etc.
Great knowledge of SQL, data relationships and DWH ecosystem concepts.
Flexibility and adaptability to work in a fast-paced startup.
Experience in using data visualization tools, e.g. Metabase, Looker Studio, Looker, Tableau etc.
Excellent commercial awareness and being able to prioritize work with the highest business impact.
Strong communication and project management skills. Capable of sharing complex insights in a clear and simple language and managing different stakeholders; business/product owners, engineers and management.
Python or R for analytics & statistics is a plus.
A background in SaaS / experience with SaaS metrics is a plus.
Speak and read English fluently. German is a plus.


Benefits

Paid Time Off - 30 vacation days
Personal Training & Development
Responsibility and trust from day 1
Individual coaching and further training to support you in your development
A free BVG ticket
Employee discounts at numerous companies (e.g. at the gym or in online stores)
Pension Program with company match
A Culture of equity and Inclusion where you are appreciated for the person you are

  • A Culture of equity and Inclusion where you are appreciated for the person you are

Title: Growth Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat forever by offering our customers high quality food and recipes for different meal occasions. Over the past 10 years, we've seen this mission spread around the world and beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are a global food solutions group and the world's leading meal kit company, active in 18 countries across 3 continents. So, how did we do it? Our weekly boxes full of exciting recipes and fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of customers looking for delicious, healthy and sustainable options. The HelloFresh Group now includes our core brand, HelloFresh, as well as: Green Chef, EveryPlate, Chefs Plate, Factor_, and Youfoodz.

The role

As a Growth Data Analyst in the Growth Analytics team, you will join the wider International Marketing Analytics which acts as a key consultant for the International part of HelloFresh business. Your main focus will be on supporting your Growth stakeholders in their decision making, and you will be their key contact person regarding data and analytics questions. Your experience with Growth analytics and related technologies, together with your excellent communication, stakeholder management and organizational skills will have a big impact on the company‚Äôs performance.

Above all, we are looking for people who will make HelloFresh better. We believe there are many different ways of developing skills and we love diverse experiences! So even if you don‚Äôt ‚Äútick all the boxes‚Äù but think you‚Äôd thrive in this role, we would really like to learn more about you.

What You‚Äôll Do

You will provide cracking insights to optimize marketing campaigns and channel targeting and efficiency
You will work closely with stakeholders from Growth channels, cross-functions and translate their business questions into structured and meaningful analytics - combining business and technical understanding
Your work will span across creating ad-hoc insights, Lift Tests, AB test analyses, reporting & visualization
You will be utilising various databases and querying/programming languages to access, manipulate and present the data needed
You will discuss the results of your work to stakeholders of various seniority
You will not only take responsibility of own projects, but also be a team player to collaborate and share knowledge with other analysts

What You‚Äôll Bring

3+ years of experience in Data Analytics/ Business Intelligence/Business Analytics/Marketing Analytics/Data Science
1+ years of experience in marketing related domains (special focus on campaign and channel management)
A degree in Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Preferred experience in working with web analytics (Google Analytics, Meta AA, ADH etc.)
Preferably experience with growth marketing analytics (campaign analytics, channel efficiency, Lift Test, AB testing)
Expertise in SQL & Python with excitement to learn more on the technical side!
Expertise in Tableau paired with understanding of data structures and warehousing
Experience in performing analysis with large datasets and knowing what the common pitfalls are
Analytical and critical thinking combined with good presentation and communication skills
Strong problems solving skills
Hands-on & can-do attitude
Ability to work independently

What We Offer

Healthy discount on weekly HelloFresh boxes
Annual learning and development budget to attend conferences or purchase educational resources plus access to the HelloFresh Academy
Budget for home office supplies
Monthly transportation budget through Rydes app
A diverse and vibrant international environment of 70+ different nationalities
Additional perks include: Free crash course in German, compensation for advanced external German classes, discounts for John Reed gyms & Urban Sports Club, summer & winter parties, discount on our Convini vending machines
The chance to have a significant impact on one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Europe in an exciting growth phase

Are you up for the challenge?

Please submit your complete application below including your salary expectations and earliest starting date.

After submitting an application our team will review this and get back to you within 5 business days.

About HelloFresh

We believe that sharing a meal brings people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures together. We are committed to celebrating all dimensions of diversity in the workplace equally and ensuring that everyone feels a sense of inclusion and belonging. We also aim to extend this commitment to the partners we work with and the communities we serve. We are constantly listening, learning, and evolving to deliver on these principles. We are proud of our collaborative culture. Our diverse employee population enables us to connect with our customers and turn their feedback into meaningful action - from developing new recipes to constantly improving our process of getting dinner to our customers‚Äô homes. Our culture attracts top talent with shared values and forms the foundation for a great place to work!

At HelloFresh, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of an individual's race, national origin, color, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, marital status or any other protected characteristic under applicable law, whether actual or perceived. As part of the Company‚Äôs commitment to equal employment opportunity, we provide reasonable accommodations, up to the point of undue hardship, to candidates at any stage, including to individuals with disabilities.

We want to adapt our processes and create a safe space that welcomes everyone so please let us know how we can accommodate our process. In case you have any accessibility requirements you can share that with us in the application form.

To learn more about what it's like working inside HelloFresh, follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn

Title: Business Intelligence/Data Analyst Working Student (f/m/d)
Description:
IMAGO is one of the leading image & video providers for media, brands & sports, based in Berlin.

Over 10.000 national & international top clients use a variety of our media, from news videos to stock photos, for their editorial & commercial productions. Spanning two close-by offices and 70 employees, IMAGO operates with flat hierarchies.

We are looking for a motivated and open-minded Business Intelligence Working Student.

The position is available immediately for our team in Berlin.

Tasks

Further development of our Data Warehouse through data integration and -enhancement processes (ETL)
Conceptualization and development of data visualizations via Tableau
Support of our C-level & other departments with ad-hoc analyses for data-driven decision-making
Optimization and automation of business operations


Requirements

First experience with SQL and ability to learn quickly
Very good English skills - German language skills are a big plus but optional
At least 20h available hours/week
You like to work independently with the support of our team
An analytical and solution-oriented mindset


Benefits

A multi-disciplinary team passionate to develop new international sales channels
Insights into a leading medium-sized company as well as the international media industry
projects with a lot of responsibility and direct exchange with management & other teams
Flat hierarchies, creative freedom and short decision-making processes
Remuneration and benefits in line with market conditions
In case required, hybrid possible


Our team is all about the development of IMAGO and the ability to learn and grow everyday.

Have we caught your interest?

Then please do not hesitate to apply with your CV and all relevant application documents.

We are looking forward to your application.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Our highly ambitious team around serial entrepreneur Mario Kohle is supported by experienced investors like Alexander Samwer (Picus Capital) and Lukasz Gadowski (Team Europe, Delivery Hero). In addition, we were able to bring Princeville Climate Technology (advised and funded among others by Leonardo DiCaprio) and Peter Rive (SolarCity) on board. As the first green unicorn in Germany, we see it as our duty to continuously drive forward our mission of green energy for all. Be part of our success story and change the world by joining us!

Job Description

Develop a deep understanding of our end-to-end business model.
Develop analytical infrastructure by designing, implementing, and optimizing the BI capabilities for either our HR or New Venture Teams using Tableau/Python/SQL/Azure/Excel.
Support senior management and business teams with technical and statistical analysis around key business drivers.
You create data-driven analysis with the goal to formulate effective strategies and recommendations for action.
You see eye to eye with all internal stakeholders, understand their business needs, and actively look for innovative solutions to their problems
You create analytical output and visualizations in Tableau/Power BI/SQL that enables automated reporting and you help them with your deep knowledge of the underlying data


Qualifications

You have at least a bachelor's degree in a quantitative (Physics, Math, Computer Science, etc.), statistical (Machine Learning, Data Science, Statistics, etc.), or economic (econometrics, etc.) field
You have professional experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst (min. 2 years)
If you have worked with HR or Finance Teams before, it's a big plus
You have experience working in a fast-growing, high pace environment like consulting or a Start-Up
You have professional experience with creating analysis and visualizations of large and complex data sets with the purpose of gaining business insights
You have 3+ years experience in SQL
You have worked with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI
You like to work with a multitude of stakeholders and you manage to turn their problems into quantitative solutions
Ideally, you have worked with Azure before
You speak English fluently


Additional Information

The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.
Direct impact on our corporate success and exciting career opportunities: leave your footprint.
Close cooperation with the management team while shaping Enpal‚Äôs tech DNA: you will be part of our first Tech Team.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there‚Äôs plenty of room for your ideas.
A great work environment in our Berlin office, or focused work from home - you decide.


At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.
