Es verbindet die Themen Mikromobilit√§t, Containerisierung, Physisches Internet und k√ºnstliche Intelligenz, um die Citylogistik deutlich effizienter und nachhaltiger zu gestalten. Das E-Cargobike, die ONO, ist in vielen deutschen St√§dten bei den Kund:innen im Einsatz. ONOMOTION hat aktuell 90 Mitarbeiter:innen.

Aufgaben

Deine Aufgaben - Tu was Du liebst
  • Durch Deinen Beitrag werden wir effizienter und transparenter in der Umsetzung unserer Unternehmensstrategie
  • Du extrahierst, strukturierst und analysierst unternehmensweit Daten und unterst√ºtzt uns damit ma√ügeblich, die richtigen Entscheidungen zu treffen
  • In Zusammenarbeit mit den Gr√ºndern, dem CFO und den Fachbereichsleitungen entwickelst Du die Datenstrukturen und -systeme sowohl im Financebereich als auch in angegliederten Systemen
  • Du f√ºhrst zentrale Erfolgsmetriken ein und verantwortest den Unternehmensplanungsprozess
  • Du erstellst und optimierst Reports f√ºr wertschaffende Analysen zur Unternehmenssteuerung und kannst daraus Entwicklungspotentiale ableiten
  • Du bist die Sparringperson, an die sich alle gern wenden

Qualifikation

Dein Profil - Sind wir ein Match?
  • Du hast eine erfolgreich abgeschlossene betriebswirtschaftliche Ausbildung mit Schwerpunkt Controlling, Business Intelligence, Datenverarbeitung o.√§. und/oder ein entsprechendes Studium (bspw. Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL mit quantitativem Schwerpunkt, Data Science)
  • Du konntest bereits erste Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Controlling, Finanzen oder in der Beratung/Wirschaftspr√ºfung sammeln
  • Du hast eine gro√üe Affinit√§t zu Datenstrukturen und -analysen
  • Neben sehr guten Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten in deutscher und englischer Sprache bringst Du eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe, hohes Qualit√§tsbewusstsein sowie unternehmerisches Denken und Handeln mit
  • Flexibilit√§t, Engagement und ausgepr√§gte Teamf√§higkeit runden Dein Profil ab
  • Idealerweise bringst Du Begeisterung f√ºr nachhaltige Mobilit√§t mit

Benefits

Was Dich bei ONOMOTION erwartet:
  • Ein innovatives Produkt, das die urbane Mobilit√§t nachhaltig ver√§ndern wird und die M√∂glichkeit, eine Vision Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen
  • Familienfreundliche Arbeitsbedingungen: Flexible Arbeitszeiten, M√∂glichkeit zu Home Office
  • Auf Dich wartet eine verantwortungsvolle Aufgabe mit einer zielgerichteten und umfassenden Einarbeitung
  • Hervorragende Gestaltungs- und Entwicklungsm√∂glichkeiten
  • Spannende Teamevents, Weihnachtspartys und gemeinsam gefeierte Erfolge st√§rken unseren Teamgeist
  • Moderne B√ºrofl√§chen an unserem neuen Standort am Humboldthain in Berlin

Du f√ºhlst Dich angesprochen? Dann schicke uns Deine vollst√§ndigen

Bewerbungsunterlagen (Motivationsschreiben & Lebenslauf).

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Team

The Data Analytics team brings together the theory and practice to identify and communicate data-driven insights that allow stakeholders and other executives at Raisin to make more informed decisions. Team‚Äôs responsibilities include reporting (define and set-up consistent business KPIs), deep-dive analysis and predictive analytics amongst many. In summary, team is responsible for:

Providing and maintaining Looker as a platform
Providing analytics as a service


We are looking for a Data Analyst who is deeply passionate about data driven decisions, transforming raw data into clear actionable business insights and who is constantly driving themselves and the team towards meeting the next challenge.

Your Responsibilities

Following the end-to-end analytical cycle of defining the problem to data preparation to data analysis to quality check measures to results presentation to measuring success/ results.
Analyzing large, complex data sets representing the behavior of customers to address strategic and operational business questions.
Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions from data to shape features, economies and possible future product/ CRM/ Marketing, etc. roadmaps. Deriving value by identifying key business findings and insights through analysis or reporting.
Analyzing and assisting senior analysts with value-adding projects where effective data analysis is central. Assisting co-workers in analytical tasks and helping to explain the structure of the data.
Supporting business stakeholders with ad-hoc questions on internal performance, external partner/business development efforts.
Build automated dashboards and reports to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding of key business metrics customer‚Äôs experience - key for teams to make informed quantitative decisions.
Looker specific: Defining new tables in LookML along with measures and dimensions. Maintaining quality of code in LookML by performing regular clean-ups of unused views and explores.


Your Profile

Bachelors or master‚Äôs in Economics, Statistics, Finance (mathematics focus), Mathematics, Business - Any other relevant quantitative fields.
Work experience in data analysis (descriptive/ reporting, inquisitive or predictive analytics) and/ or BI.
Strong SQL skills with experience in querying large, complex data sets: Snowflake preferred. Experience in working with version controls like Git
High level of analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to details.
Ability to turn complex concepts into actionable recommendations.
Basic experience in analytical tools and technologies such as R, Python.
Experience in reporting and data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI.
Experience in solving data science related problems or building and applying machine learning algorithms: advantage.
Good communication and organizational skills.
Eagerness and hunger to learn and grow.


Join our mission, join our team - and grow with us!

At Raisin, we care about each other and it is one of our top priorities to foster an open and caring environment in which everyone feels welcome and comfortable. Our culture is strongly driven by our ambitious team, which, connects more than 40 different nationalities.

You'll find us in our modern and open office in the trendy Kreuzberg district with a view of the Spree River, ideally connected to public transportation and surrounded by a variety of restaurants and shopping opportunities.

As part of our team, you will benefit from:

Personal training budget of 1,700 ‚Ç¨ and four full training days per year.

Free choice of hardware.

Hungry all the time? Snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks provided at the office.

Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days.

Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than ‚Ç¨20 per month.

A company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20%.

Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch & Learn, Tech Lunch, Female Empowerment Forum, CEO Talks as well as our yearly Summer- and Christmas Party.

Do you miss being in the office? The corporate ticket gets you there, which we subsidize with ‚Ç¨25 per month (BVG Firmenticket for Berlin and HVV ProfiTicket for HH).

You are moving from another country or city to join us? We will support your relocation.

Title: Data Analyst - Digital Marketing (all genders)
HTML:
For 25 years, Native Instruments has been at the heart of musical innovation. We've created communities, pushed technological boundaries, and opened new creative horizons for amateurs and professionals alike. Guided by our mission to make music creation more inclusive and accessible, Native hardware, software, and digital services provide fully-integrated solutions for musicians, producers, and DJs of all genres and levels of experience. Native Instruments is part of Soundwide, whose mission is to make music and audio creation a more joyful and inspiring experience for creators everywhere by helping them to find, and stay in, their creative flow. Soundwide's collective vision is to inspire and empower creators to express themselves and reimagine the future of sound.

Our Commercial Data Insights team designs, builds and maintains data models, reports and dashboards for stakeholders throughout our organization. We manage, evaluate and mine vast volumes of web, sales, customer and usage data for information and insights to enable data-informed business choices. Our data team collaborates with all level contributors in Marketing and Product Creation on stimulating projects, transforming Soundwide into an insights driven organization where analysis, data and reasoning are embedded in all decisions - large and small.

What You'll Do
  • Evaluate user experience, engagement and purchasing data across our digital touchpoints to provide insights and actionable advice for marketing purposes;
  • Collaborating with our Digital Marketing Managers, you will develop insightful reports & dashboards to evaluate and optimize campaign performance;
  • Turn business questions into clear analysis problems and search for answers by assessing historical information, collecting new data and conducting experiments;
  • You will collaborate with data engineers, data scientists and digital marketing managers at different levels of seniority to implement a data strategy, expand our data-driven marketing campaigns and increase the data literacy throughout our organization;
  • Build relationships and connect with a range of internal stakeholders to create and refine the tools and processes needed to support the commercial growth of our e-commerce business.

What You'll Need
  • You bring previous working experience in similar roles, having operated in more technical positions (i.e data engineer, web developer or BI developer) would be considered a plus for this role;
  • A strong investigative mindset and your demonstrated ability to collaborate with stakeholders and translate requests into requirements;
  • A profound knowledge of SQL is a must, any additional knowledge of Python or R is a plus;
  • A solid understanding of descriptive statistics and exploratory data analysis;
  • Experience with modern data analytics tools and platforms, especially the Google stack: Google Analytics / Tag Manager / Ads, BigQuery, Data Studio;
  • Your demonstrated experience in leveraging analytics and systematic experimentation to improve e-commerce KPIs for customer acquisition and engagement;
  • Hands-on experience in data-driven performance optimisation in one or more of these areas: email and digital ad campaigns, attribution modeling, conversion rate optimization;
  • Your strong sense of ownership, and your ability to achieve high-quality results based on imperfect data;
  • You are fluent in English with strong verbal and visual communication skills in order to present your findings to diverse audience groups.

About Us

Native Instruments is a Soundwide company; together we embrace diversity and a respect for all people. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we believe the foundation of our dynamic and pioneering spirit starts with a fair and inclusive culture. At Soundwide we strive to embrace teamwork and passion, deliver inspiring experiences, continuously innovate and empower our communities, while also serving our planet.

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment at Native Instruments and we encourage everyone to apply ‚Äì regardless of gender identity, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Help us reach our goal in making the future of music diverse, inclusive and exciting! We encourage you to submit your application without the requirement for a photograph, identifying factors or personal status information.

Title: Data Analyst, Business and Product Analytics
Description:
Smartly.io is looking for a customer success and product analytics focused Data Analyst to join our Analytics and Business Intelligence team! Our centralized analytics team works with different parts of the organization, spanning from Product Management and Design to Customer Success, Marketing and Financial Planning and Analysis.




You will work with different types of data, ranging from sales and revenue data to in-app user interactions. Our goal is to develop a unified view of crucial business and product metrics, such as engagement, revenue development, and key action monitoring. We operate in a rapidly evolving business environment, working with the world's most advanced advertisers. This means that our business is constantly changing and we need reliable ways to estimate where we are and where we are going in terms of our customer metrics.




You will work as a part of a wider analytics and business intelligence team that automates operations by creating internal BI tools, dashboards and internal data warehouses. Your primary stakeholders will be our Customer Success and Product Management organizatios.




As a Data Analyst at Smartly.io, you will:




Work closely with our Customer Success Operations, Product Management and Product Design teams to build and optimize our customer experience with data.
Build, develop and maintain reporting of key product adoption metrics
Develop an understanding of our product data and help develop our tracking of key features.
Have end-to-end ownership of data: define data requirements and dive deep into data sets to provide actionable insights.
Develop an in-depth understanding of what drives our customer and product success
Be an important part of our higher level data driven decision making process as well as day-to-day business operations





What we are looking for:




Skills in writing complex analytical SQL queries (we use Snowflake and PostgreSQL as our warehouses)
Proficiency in one or more BI and visualization tools like Looker, Periscope, Tableau or Power BI (we use Tableau and Redash at Smartly.io)
Strong communication and presentation skills, you can turn data into stories and actionable insights
Experience with business & product analytics or a strong interest in the field
Basic understanding of data warehousing
Basic knowledge of typical key business KPIs for SaaS companies
Basic understanding of financial processes, including forecasting, target setting, and budgeting





Meet Smartly.io




Smartly.io combines the power of media automation, creative agility, and advertising intelligence in a next generation digital advertising platform.




We serve marketers across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Snap, Pinterest, TikTok, and Google. We manage about $4B in ad spend and help 700+ brands worldwide, including eBay, Uber, and TechStyle. Our technology and outstanding customer service help brands to reach and engage their audiences, and scale their results.




We offer growth-minded people opportunities to make an impact in a fast-paced, collaborative and inclusive environment built on a culture of trust, transparency, and feedback. You‚Äôll work with a team of 650+ Smartlies, representing 60+ nationalities. We operate in 13 countries across 24 locations.




At Smartly.io, you can enjoy the freedom to harmonize work and personal life. On top of flexible hours, we offer a hybrid workplace where Smartlies can choose to work at the office, from home, or a bit of both. As a global, hybrid organization, we are mindful to collaborate in ways that allow everyone, everywhere to be productive and feel included.




Join our global team to reshape the future of digital marketing!




Learn more at smartly.io/careers and smartly.io/careers/life-at-smartly.

Title: Data Strategy Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Your tasks

InstaFreight is looking for a Data Strategy Analyst (m/f/d) to join our Team Data. As such, you will be the senior leadership's main partner to explore our data orbit for strategic insights and develop tool prototypes. As a Data Strategy Analyst (m/f/d) you will be a key agent in analyzing complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide data-driven solutions, and ensuring analytics are valid, meaningful, and provide actionable and comprehensive insights. For example, you may be asked to build a more precise model to predict our truck sourcing cost for the months ahead. Or the leadership may be interested in exploring the commercial potential of new Sales channels (e.g. automatically bidding on requests for shipping).

In this role you will:

Conduct project-driven work in close collaboration with your team lead and the senior leadership
Derive key strategic insights from our data (‚Äòone-off analyses‚Äô) and summarize them in crisp communication materials to trigger new initiatives
Develop data-driven tool prototypes to further improve the efficiency and quality of our internal processes
Take full ownership of your projects incl. stakeholder management and communication of updates / results (e.g. jour fixes, final presentations)
Champion best practices and data literacy across the organization
Come up with new project opportunities for yourself and pitch them


Your Profile

You have gained 3+ years of working experience in strategy & business development, data analytics, or management consulting
You have strong skills in quantitative exploration and analysis
You have Python and SQL skills
You have distinct business intuition and the ability to understand complex business system requirements
You have a master's degree in a quantitative subject (e.g. engineering, finance) with strong grades
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and commitments, solving critical-to-operations issues
A passion and curiosity for data, systems, and data-driven decision making


Good to have:

Industry expertise in road transportation/logistics


Recruiting Process:

HR call
Business case
Presentation of the case to the Data & Analytics Team Lead
Final call
Offer


The current working model of InstaFreight is hybrid and the office's location is in Berlin.

What We Offer

__Take the driver seat

Take charge - Be accountable for your own field of responsibility from day one onwards.
Have impact - Drive development projects and steer the course of the company.
Make mistakes - Take risks, learn from failures and grow personally with us.


Hit the gas pedal

Learn as you go - Be supported in a great learning environment with training, mentoring and feedback.
Accelerate - Go out of your comfort zone and climb your personal growth ladder step by step.
Outgrow yourself - Unlock your full potential and accomplish things you hardly dare to dream of.


Enjoy the ride

Be part of the team - Join a great group of individuals standing behind a common goal.
Have fun - Take part in our legendary parties, company events or just the regular office craziness.
Write history - Shape the future of an entire industry together with us.__

Title: Data Analyst for Energy Market
Description:
We recruit and prepare international green technicians for Germany‚Äôs energy transition. We serve German partners operating in the fields of offshore and onshore wind, solar, heat-pump installation, hydrogen and geothermal energy.

Based in Berlin, we are a member of the European Solar PV Industry Alliance, the Berlin Senate's Solarcity Masterplan, and work with companies actively supporting the German Federal Government's Renewable Energy Sources Act (EEG 2023).

Tasks

We are currently sourcing Data Analysts specialising in Renewable Energies with B1/2 German language proficiency and B2 English language proficiency. To be considered, you will need to demonstrate the following:

Requirements

Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university
Equivalent knowledge and experience with market research
Experience in analysing energy-related market data is preferred
Knowledge of European energy data is beneficial


Benefits

All positions offered through us are socially secured and based in multiple regions across Germany. This means relocation may be required. We support both technicians and companies with internal relocation services, professional recognition via the IHK/HWK (for electrical installation activities and/or where desired by the company), as well as with additional supporting documents related to work permits.

Submit your CV here on JOIN or to our e-mail address. We aim to reply to suitable candidates within three working days with a short questionnaire and/or invite to a pre-interview. German-based respondents with CEF-B1 German who meet minimum criteria will be added to our growing pool of green technicians ready for presentation to partners.

If you do not speak B1 German, we offer selected international energy and environmental professionals intensive, affordable bridging courses to help them quickly gain professional fluency in German. Note: participation in these remote courses is currently only offered to those who can meet the above requirements or similar.

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing & Communications
Description:
As stewards of the Polkadot and Substrate ecosystem, Parity is laying the foundation for a better web which respects the freedom and data of individuals and empowers developers to create better services through decentralised technology. The internet is too important to billions of people for it to be at the mercy of a few powerful companies.

Like Polkadot, Parity was built on a foundation of being decentralised and open, which trickles down to how we work. We're a distributed organisation and have been from the beginning. Being distributed isn't just a way of doing business‚Äîit's a mentality that is at the core of our culture. We have a flat structure that pushes power to the edges and empowers our people to take ownership of their role, authority coupled with responsibilities.

As the Polkadot ecosystem grows, so does the data associated with it. We are looking for a data analytics professional to perform analytics on all our marketing activities, drive the definition of metrics and implement reporting structures within the Marketing & Communications (Marcomms) department at Parity Technologies.

This is a great opportunity for someone who is passionate about marketing, Web3 and open source blockchain development to spearhead some cutting edge analytics within the Blockchain industry. Also the ability to play a pivotal role in the formation of the data platform and culture at a rapidly growing open-source technology startup.

Key Responsibilities

Lead metric definition and measurement for the department, including supporting the KPI and OKR framework and processes
Work directly with a variety of stakeholders and multiple data sets to derive sophisticated data solutions and dashboards
Create and maintain dashboards to visualize the performance (ROI, attribution etc) of different marketing activities (social media, paid advertising, website traffic, CRM, organic content etc.)
Support the mapping of existing business processes into reporting structures.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on marketing data and open-source blockchain development data within and outside the ecosystem.
Coordinate with the data engineering team to turn the results of this EDA into user-friendly, consumable and automated dashboards.
Coordinate with other departments within Parity to help ensure organizational-wide visibility of Ecosystem Development data.


Qualification and Skills

3+ years of work experience in data analytics.
Strong proficiency in Python,SQL and dashboarding tools.
Experience defining metrics, implementing reporting structures, building and automating dashboards.
Professional experience with marketing data (paid ads, website traffic, CRM etc.) workflows and activities
Knowledge and practical application of statistical techniques in a professional setting.
Familiarity with connecting and harnessing data from a number of different sources.
Ability to work autonomously, be proactive, prioritise, communicate, and function in a small team.
Strong program management skills and able to address multiple projects in parallel managing competing interests and aligning various parties on a common goal.
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Nice-to-haves

Understanding of blockchain technologies and ecosystems.
Experience with GCP.
Knowledge of GDPR.


Benefits

Working at Parity means focusing on the stuff that counts: building the most cutting-edge technology for the future web. Our teams enjoy a high degree of trust, freedom and autonomy to achieve that goal.
You will gain a keen understanding of blockchain technology and business development and have a skill set transferable to many jobs.
Because we value initiative and learning, we've defined a generous personal budget to attend conferences or skills courses of your choosing. We think you know what's best for you!
Parity is a diverse company with people from various countries, and we will support you with German or English language courses where needed.
Not all of us who collaborate work in the same place. Bringing the team together is something we value a lot, so we regularly go on team retreats.


To see how we use your data, please see our Applicant Notice: https://www.parity.io/applicant-notice/

As stewards of the Polkadot and Substrate ecosystem, Parity is laying the foundation for a better web which respects the freedom and data of individuals and empowers developers to create better services through decentralised technology. The internet is too important to billions of people for it to be at the mercy of a few powerful companies.

Like Polkadot, Parity was built on a foundation of being decentralised and open, which trickles down to how we work. We're a distributed organisation and have been from the beginning. Being distributed isn't just a way of doing business‚Äîit's a mentality that is at the core of our culture. We have a flat structure that pushes power to the edges and empowers our people to take ownership of their role, authority coupled with responsibilities.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for your next challenge? Do you want a job that‚Äôs exciting with a team that loves what they do? Then we may have just the thing...

At Doodle, we‚Äôre the kind of people who wake up every morning passionate about what we do. That‚Äôs what we‚Äôre looking for in our new Doodlers. You‚Äôll be brimming with new ideas, driven by curiosity and don‚Äôt flinch at the thought of experimenting - even if the test fails. You‚Äôre someone who challenges the status quo and enjoys pushing yourself and others to reimagine, optimize and innovate.




Who Are We?

Doodle is the world‚Äôs leading scheduling platform, helping millions of people instantly set meetings with clients, colleagues and teams. Tapping into the unique nature of smart scheduling with AI, Doodle simplifies the planning of 1:1 and group meetings for busy professionals. As the world's most trusted online scheduling platform, Doodle attracts more than 25 million monthly active users.

Now‚Äôs your chance to join 100+ ambitious engineers, designers, product managers, marketers and salespeople on a mission to make great meetings happen. Be a part of a global team headquartered in Zurich, with offices in Atlanta, Belgrade and Berlin.




Who we're looking for

Doodle is looking for an experienced (Senior) Data Analyst who can gather data, understand problems, and makes recommendations based on Doodle's data, stakeholder input and company goals.




Ideally, You Have

3+ years of experience in a Data Analyst role, ideally in SaaS
Excellent SQL skills and experience in data visualisation and Power BI. Python experience is a plus
Experience working with DBT is a must
Knowledge of database modelling, version control, testing and continuous integration
Experience with Google Analytics or other event tracking platforms. We use Google Analytics and Avo
Incredible communication skills and a customer-centric mentality
Self-starter, high energy, adaptable, inquisitive and excited to work in a startup environment
Ability to work independently, be proactive and think holistically
Fluency in English




What the role involves

Play a leading role in making Doodle data-driven
Collaborate across teams to define key metrics, develop dashboards, track metric progress, investigate changes in metrics, and propose next steps
Exemplify best practices for data management
Use data analysis to proactively address company and product problems and solutions with sometimes broad scopes and minimal specifications - the ability to drill down to the essential analytics insights is important
Fulfil requests for data and analysis coming from other teams while guiding them on which data to use and how to interpret it, automating solutions to be self service were possible.
Provide clear and concise views into company and product data that enable everyone at Doodle to understand the data
Provide data-supported recommendations for company and product strategy
Help define success metrics and oversee product and marketing experiments




What‚Äôs Awesome About Working at Doodle?

Top talent deserves a competitive salary.
We‚Äôre a team that cares about each other. We think we work best when we work together, so you‚Äôll always feel included.
Diversity is what makes us successful. We all have different strengths and push each other to try new things, innovate and deliver impactful results for the business.
Your personal development matters and we mean it. Every Doodler gets a yearly budget to use for anything that promotes your continuous learning (be it an industry conference, language classes, leadership training, or anything else).
Your well-being matters to us. Access thousands of beneficial meditation tools with your free Headspace account.
Get together with the entire team of Doodlers (from all offices) to connect, bond, play games and unwind at the annual international retreat.
Travel to and spend time with other Doodlers in some of our lovely offices worldwide.
Take advantage of our remote friendly policy.
Enjoy complimentary Doodle Premium memberships for you, your friends and your family.
Free snacks and fruit in all our office locations.







Hiring Journey

Applicant initial validation
BRYQ assessment
Cultural Fit Interview
Coding Challenge
Meet the team
Offer




So, Get in Touch!

At Doodle, we‚Äôre committed to providing an environment of mutual trust and respect, where equal employment opportunities (EEO) are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to age, race, color, disability, religion, gender and sexual orientation. Diversity and inclusion are of utmost importance to us. We‚Äôre committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work and our products will be. We want to hear from you, so please don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
What To Expect

We are looking for a (Senior) Data Analyst (all genders) passionate about improving patient care with data. You will work closely with our stakeholders (sales, product, marketing, operations) within the Data Analytics Department at Caspar Health. Your work will contribute to one of the most transformative shifts emerging in healthcare.

Your Challenges

You will be conceptualizing and evaluating new data architectures, structures, fields and their relationships for (complex) analysis.
You will be building data sources for use in data visualization and business critical processes
You will be communicating with key stakeholders to develop dashboards and analyses that can be used to make business-critical decisions.
You will be providing quality assurance of data, working with various departments to ensure accuracy and consistency.


Your profile

You bring at least 2+ years experience as a Data Analyst / Data Engineer / Analytics Engineer or in a related role
You have a degree in computer science, mathematics, natural science, physics or in a related field
Your are a strong analytical thinker and problem solver
You are self driven and take ownership of your tasks
You can work independently as well as in a team
You are a motivated and fast learner
You have strong communication skills in both English and German


You have profound knowledge of and practical experience in:

Data querying and transformation - SQL
Data visualisation - Tableau


Ideally, you could also already gain experience with:

Python
Git
dbt
Snowflake


Why Caspar Health?

Looking for commitment? Perfect match! We offer a permanent employment contract.
You don't want to just be a number? Understandable. With us, the human-being is the focus. We currently have initiatives on diversity and inclusion as well as a common reflection room on our work culture in which every Casparian* can participate and thus actively contribute to your working environment and Caspar‚Äôs development.
You appreciate feedback? We're happy to hear it. We encourage an open feedback culture to learn and grow together.
You value a good work-life balance? So do we, and that's why we offer flexible working hours, mobile working and various models for part-time work.
You want to develop yourself continuously? We support this with an individual annual training budget for all Casparians*.
You value your health? So do we! We offer a generous remote policy to protect you according to your health needs during the pandemic. Plus, as a Casparian*, you can take advantage of our health app with mental health-, exercise -, and nutrition modules for free.
Of course, we also offer fresh fruit and a variety of healthy snacks and drinks in the office.


Diversity and Inclusion:

At Caspar Health, we strive to provide a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for all Casparians* regardless of ethnic origin, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, limitations of any kind, physical appearance, social background, age or religion (or lack thereof).

When you apply, we purely focus on your experience and motivation. You decide what additional information you want to disclose (picture, marital status, religion, gender, nationality, etc). We value and treat all applications equally.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

Title: Data Analyst / Data Product Manager
HTML:
Data Analyst / Data Product Manager (m/w/d)

Lot Internet GmbH ‚Äì 14473 Potsdam

 

Lust ‚ÄûBig Data‚Äú mit Leben zu f√ºllen? Den Umgang mit gro√üen Datenmengen zu revolutionieren? Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig!

Gegr√ºndet 2011 mit Firmensitz in Potsdam hat sich die Lot Internet GmbH auf das Erfassen und Analysieren strukturierter Daten aus dem Internet spezialisiert.

Als Data Analyst / Data Product Manager liegt Dein Schwerpunkt in der Nutzbarmachung von heterogenen Online-Datenquellen durch die Entwicklung von effizienten Daten-Services. Du ber√§tst und unterst√ºtzt unsere Kunden bei der digitalen Transformation und hilfst diesen, durch Daten einen echten Mehrwert zu generieren.

Ziel ist die Erkennung von Zusammenh√§ngen und Mustern in den Datenwelten, sowie die Schaffung von Transparenz im Marktgeschehen. Der Branchenschwerpunkt liegt dabei im Bereich Automotiv, wo gro√üe Konzerne unsere Kunden sind.


Deine Aufgaben

‚óè     Erstellung von ganzheitlichen Analysen, basierend auf Datenbankabfragen;

‚óè     Interpretation und Bewertung von Datenanalysen und Kennzahlen;

‚óè     Konzeption von Online-Applikationen zur Datenanalyse;

‚óè     Verantwortlich f√ºr die Datenqualit√§tssicherung, u.a. durch fortlaufende Optimierung von Datenverarbeitungsprozessen;

‚óè     Strategische Beratung unserer Kunden bei Big Data-Analysen;

‚óè     Fachlicher Key Account Manager;

‚óè     Produkt- und Projektmanagement bei unseren Daten-Services;

‚óè     Steuerung von Entwicklern zur Datenerfassung und -aufbereitung;

‚óè     Unterst√ºtzung des Managements im Bereich Business Development.

 

Dein Profil

‚óè     Abgeschlossenes Studium der Mathematik, Informatik, Physik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder einschl√§gige Berufserfahrung;

‚óè     Strukturiertes, reflektiertes und analytisches Denken

‚óè     Sicherer Umgang mit Methoden zur Analyse und zur Aufbereitung von Daten;

‚óè     Erfahrung mit relationalen Datenbanken (z.B. PostgreSQL);

‚óè     Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement, idealerweise auch im Produktmanagement;

‚óè     Sicheres und kompetentes Auftreten bei unseren Kunden;

‚óè     Sehr gute Pr√§sentations- und Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch;

‚óè     Zielorientierte, sorgf√§ltige und eigenst√§ndige Arbeitsweise.

 

Wir bieten

‚óè     Eine umfassende und praxisorientierte Einarbeitung;

‚óè     Ein familienfreundliches Unternehmen mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und drei Tage Home-Office;

‚óè     Flache Hierarchien f√ºr ein effizientes und zielorientiertes arbeiten;

‚óè     Ein motiviertes und kollegiales Team;

‚óè     Ein Umfeld mit Respekt vor dem Kunden und zwischen den Kollegen;

‚óè     Offene, kooperative und vertrauensvolle Unternehmenskultur;

‚óè     Fachliche als auch pers√∂nliche Weiterentwicklung im Job durch vielf√§ltige Trainingsangebote und Coaching;

‚óè     Einen verkehrsg√ºnstig gelegenen Arbeitsplatz im Zentrum von Potsdam.

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Marketing
Description:
Vinted is Europe‚Äôs biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 75+ million registered members in 18 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted‚Äôs offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that‚Äôs based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

At Vinted, marketing is one of the most impactful channels to grow our platform by making high-stake investment decisions. As a Marketing Decision Scientist, you‚Äôll join our Marketing Data Science & Analytics team where a mix of talented people with backgrounds from academia, econometrics, e-commerce, consulting, and media apply a scientific approach to solve worldwide business problems. In this team we develop statistical and business models, create new methods to measure marketing success, perform advanced data analyses, and ensure that marketing data is reliable. You will report to the Manager of Data Science & Analytics, Marketing Intelligence, and will work in the team of experienced Marketing Decision and Data Scientists. You‚Äôll be expected to be able to accomplish projects individually but at the same time, you‚Äôll have all the support from the team, the DSA guild, and your lead that you may need. You will be responsible for moving millions of people to the path of sustainable consumption.

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:

Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation ‚Äì translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


In this position, you‚Äôll:

Contribute to the development of new ROI/ROAS and payback models to measure marketing performance
Investigate revenue streams that marketing generates ‚Äì think of acquisition, reactivation, engagement on both sides of a two-sided market
Analyse how a multitude of marketing channels drive user acquisition and retention, engagement, and revenue
Drive the usage of data & analytics within the organisation by making the marketing data obvious for everyone to understand, interpret, and use in daily decision making
Pitch your findings to your team and marketing colleagues to pivot the models used to measure success
Occasionally help with ad-hoc requests (data questions and consultations, data bugs, analyses, etc.)


About you:

Strong analytical, strategic, and business skills
Highly business-results oriented and able to connect science with pragmatic problem solving
A good communicator who can present results in an informative and persuasive manner to a wide range of stakeholders
Intermediate working experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, or Data Scientist
Strong knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)
A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field
Excellent at communicating in written and spoken English
Advantage: Previous experience with Marketing Analytics, in particular, ROI/ROAS models
Advantage: Strong econometrics knowledge (statistical models, regression analyses)
Advantage: Advanced knowledge of R/Python/Scala


Work perks:

Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (10% from gross yearly salary)
30 working days of holiday
Mental and emotional health support from Mindletic
Frequent team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
A daily allowance for ordering lunch
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year and up to 21 days outside the EU
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided and a personal budget of 540 for home workplace furniture)


We want people to work from where they‚Äôre most comfortable, which is why we‚Äôre using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.

Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it‚Äôs not required. You‚Äôre welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.

The salary range for this position is 51,400‚Äì67,500 ‚Ç¨ (gross) per annum.

If this sounds interesting ‚Äì you may well be just who we need!

Vinted is Europe‚Äôs biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 75+ million registered members in 18 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted‚Äôs offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that‚Äôs based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Volkswirtschaftslehre, Mathematik / Statistik oder (Wirtschafts-) Informatik
Erste Erfahrung durch Praktika oder Nebenjobs in der Unternehmensberatung, Marktforschung oder im CRM Bereich
Gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie in mindestens einem der Programme R oder Python
Erste Erfahrung mit Regressions- oder Zeitreihenanalysen bzw. Wirksamkeitstests (A-/B-, Hypothesentests)
Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse

Deine Vorteile

Wir legen Wert darauf, dass sich dein Einstieg bei uns lohnt! Daher profitierst du bei uns nicht nur von einer √ºberdurchschnittlichen Verg√ºtung und allen Sozialleistungen eines Gro√üunternehmens. So findest du dich bei uns schnell zurecht ‚Äì und so kannst du von Beginn an das kollegiale Miteinander und die individuellen Weiterbildungsm√∂glichkeiten f√ºr dich entdecken.

Mobiles Arbeiten bis zu 5 Tage pro Woche

√úber flexible Arbeits-/Teilzeitmodelle kannst du dir deine Arbeitszeit ortsunabh√§ngig, d.h. vor Ort oder im mobilen Arbeiten, in Abstimmung mit deinem Vorgesetzten mit bis zu 5 Tagen pro Woche so einteilen, wie es am besten zu deiner pers√∂nlichen Situation passt.

Ein tolles Team

Gesundheit am Arbeitsplatz

Wir haben die gesundheitlichen Aspekte deines Arbeitsplatzes im Blick und ein eigenes Gesundheitsmanagement. Die Arbeitspl√§tze bei Lidl sind daher so ausgestattet, dass du dort sicher arbeiten kannst.

Moderne Ausstattung

Die IT-Ausstattung deines Arbeitsplatzes ist auf deine T√§tigkeit abgestimmt. Je nach Position bekommst du auch ein Gesch√§ftshandy oder -iPad, regelm√§√üiger Tausch gegen aktuelle Modelle inbegriffen.

Kantine

Hunger ist nicht gut f√ºr deine Karriere, das wissen wir. Abhilfe schaffen wir an Verwaltungsstandorten mit einer Kantine oder verg√ºnstigten Lunch-Angeboten.

Einarbeitung nach Plan

Wir m√∂chten, dass du gut bei uns ankommst. Daher geben wir dir ausreichend Zeit, deine fachlichen Aufgaben zu erlernen. Dein Einarbeitungsplan gibt dir die n√∂tige Sicherheit fuÃàr einen guten Start und regelt alle Schritte.

Sabbatical

Nach f√ºnf Jahren Betriebszugeh√∂rigkeit hast du die M√∂glichkeit, ein dreimonatiges Sabbatical einzulegen. Egal, was du in dieser Zeit vor hast - wir geben dir den Freiraum.

Arbeitsplatz mit Verantwortung

Ob Branchenkenner oder Quereinsteiger, bei Lidl kannst du dein volles Potenzial entfalten. Du √ºbernimmst schnell Verantwortung und kannst so deine Karriere gestalten. Wir unterst√ºtzen dich dabei, Herausforderungen zu meistern.

Weiterbildungen und Schulungen

Dein fachliches Wissen kannst du in Seminaren und Schulungen vertiefen. Damit qualifizierst du dich nicht nur f√ºr h√∂here Positionen, sondern entwickelst dich auch pers√∂nlich weiter.

Wertsch√§tzung

Wir trauen unseren Mitarbeitern jede Menge zu und haben Respekt davor, wie sie sich t√§glich engagieren. Mit Teamgeist und Fairness bringen wir gemeinsam Dinge voran.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Pitch is the collaborative presentation platform for modern teams. With a focus on real-time collaboration, smart workflows, and intuitive design features, we make it fast and delightful for teams to create and deliver beautiful presentations. Our presentation and template galleries give everyone the ability to publish their own standout work, learn from one another, and find the creative spark for their next presentation. Tens of thousands of teams have made the switch to Pitch, including top brands like Intercom, Superhuman, and Notion. We've raised over $135 million to date, and have been recognized by FT-backed Sifted as Europe's Top B2B Soonicorn in 2022. And we're just getting started.

We built Pitch for people who are thirsting for a better way to design, collaborate on, and share presentations. In order to improve our product, we continuously seek to improve our understanding of the user journey from first hearing about Pitch, to creating the first deck, to inviting team member to collaborate, and beyond.

One lens we've relied on to better understand this complex journey is data.

As a Senior Data Analyst on our Analytics team, you'll shed numerical light on the many mysteries that await us as we build and position Pitch as the greatest presentation tool known to humanity in 2023 and beyond.

What You'll Get To Do...

Inform and influence our growth and product strategy through data exploration.
Collaborate with Marketing, Sales, User Research, Customer Support, Finance and Product to make data-driven insights and recommendations.
Play a key role in enabling and promoting self-service analytics among stakeholders in the wider organization.
Guide teams through experimentation-based execution.
Partner with Data Engineering to maintain and extend our Data Warehouse (SnowFlake), improve data quality and documentation.


This role is perfect for you if you bring...

4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or in a relevant field.
High proficiency in SQL and comfortable navigating data to perform a wide range of analyses.
High proficiency in using BI tools.
Experience with Git.
Strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience in playing the role of "project manager" when the occasion calls for it.


Not a must, but it would be great if you have‚Ä¶

Experience in SaaS business models.
Experience with marketing analytics.
Experience with dbt.
Understanding of statistical concepts like causal analysis.


Curious what it's like to work at Pitch? Find out more about how Pitch operates as a remote-first company through using powerful collaboration tools and dogfooding our own products!

Pitch was founded in Berlin, but as a remote-first company, our team works together from all over the world. With that mindset, we're building an inclusive workplace that invites diverse perspectives, and values talent from diverse personal and professional backgrounds. For more specifics on how we honour our commitment to diversity in our hiring process, check out our Recruiting D&I Pledge.

Sounds like a good fit? Join us on our mission to enable every team's best thinking - we look forward to hearing from you!

Not quite sure whether that's a role for you? No problem! If you can't find any open role that caught your eye, but are interested in working at Pitch, you can always submit your resume here. We will follow up as soon as we open up a position that matches your skillset and aspirations!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/w/x)
Description:
√úber COMO

#Produkt

Willkommen im COMOverse!

Social Media Analytics, datengesteuertes Influencer Marketing oder kreative Content-Produktionen - COMO hat alles im Griff.

COMOs einzigartige Analytics-Technologie erm√∂glicht es unseren Kunden, Transparenz √ºber ihre Social-Media-Landschaft zu gewinnen, die Trigger ihrer Konsumenten zu verstehen und alle ihre Social-Media-Aktivit√§ten auszuwerten und zu √ºberwachen - weltweit.

Konzeption, Scouting, Durchf√ºhrung und Auswertung von Influencer Marketing sind das A und O im COMOverse. Auf der Grundlage von Daten schaffen wir authentische und bereichernde Verbindungen zwischen Marken, Influencern und Followern, um f√ºr alle Beteiligten den gr√∂√ütm√∂glichen Nutzen zu erzielen.

Und mit Hilfe innovativer Creator unterst√ºtzen wir Marken bei der Erstellung von ansprechenden Inhalten f√ºr alle wichtigen Social-Media-Plattformen, um eine hohe Content-Frequenz ohne aufwendige Inhouse-Content-Produktion zu gew√§hrleisten.

Deine Aufgaben

Unser Bestreben ist es, die WARUMs zu eliminieren und mehr Zeit f√ºr das "Let's do its" zu schaffen! Als Marketing Data Analyst bei COMO helfen Sie, das Unbekannte in Sachen Influencer Marketing aufzudecken. Sie werden die M√∂glichkeit haben, mit Kunden und verschiedenen Abteilungen innerhalb von COMO zu interagieren, um komplizierte Datenanalyseprojekte zu organisieren und zu strukturieren.

Verantwortlichkeiten

W√∂chentliche Priorisierung und Terminierung von Projekten in enger Abstimmung mit den jeweiligen Projektleitern unter Ber√ºcksichtigung von externen Terminen. Die Kernbereiche sind dabei:

Koordinierung und Optimierung von:

SLAs
Consumer Insight Reporting
Channel- und Account-Reporting
Standard- und erweiterte Analysen
Umsetzung von Problemen in l√∂sungsorientierte Datenmodelle


Weitere Aufgaben:

Schriftliche und m√ºndliche Kommunikation mit Ansprechpartnern bei Kunden und Partnern
Koordination und Abstimmung mit anderen Teams (Operations, Engineering und Product)
Priorisierung von Aufgaben und Delegation von Aufgaben an bis zu 3 Praktikanten.


Dein Profil

Sie sind Absolvent eines einschl√§gigen Studiengangs, z.B. Betriebswirtschaft oder Marketing
Sie haben idealerweise bereits erste praktische Erfahrungen im Marketing gesammelt und m√∂chten in die Marketingdatenanalyse eintauchen
Sie lieben es, mit Zahlen und Daten zu arbeiten und haben fortgeschrittene Erfahrung in Excel/Google Sheets und erste Erfahrungen mit Metabase, Tableau oder anderen BI-Tools sind von Vorteil

Title: Market Data Analyst
Description:
We at Yara are part of a global network, collaborating to profitably and responsibly solve some of the world's key challenges - resource scarcity, food insecurity and environmental change.




About The Unit




The Continental Europe business unit is one of three commercial business units in Yara Europe Region together with BU Nordics and BU South. BU Continental is comprised of the commercial teams - agronomy, marketing, and sales - of several major European markets, including UK and Ireland, France, Germany and Benelux, Poland, Czech Republic, Romania, and Ukraine. At the BU level are roles working across these markets, supporting business development of core fertilizer products as well as digital agronomic tools and services to customers in these markets.




The Market Data Analyst role is responsible for analyzing user data from our digital tools and services to provide meaningful insights which enable effective, data-driven decision making for the markets within the business unit and the business unit overall. This position will support the local commercial teams to understand and interpret data from various tools including Atfarm, N-Tester, N-Sensor, Megalab, Yara Premium Program, Salesforce, and Request for Quote. This analysis will be used to implement actions for improving growth, engagement, and retention of customers and product, and service development opportunities of our digital solutions, in line with our strategic ambitions.




The Market Data Analyst will report to the Marketing & Agronomy Director and act as a trusted advisor to the local teams and as a liaison towards other units within the regional and global organization when it comes to use of relevant data for marketing, commercialization, development, and continuous improvement of our digital solutions.




Responsibilities




Analyze data and provide insights and recommendations on acquisition, retention, and activation to support implementation and market development of Yara's digital offering
Guide and facilitate discussions concerning identification of opportunities for growth, activation, and churn reduction through data-driven analysis and insights and contribute to marketing strategies
Analyze data and provide insights to support product development and improved user experience of our digital tools and services
Dive into behavioral data to support markets in understanding the user-base and, together with the local commercial teams, determine how to optimize marketing, user journey, and user experience of the digital tools
Improve existing dashboards and develop new dashboards or information-sharing tools to make data more accessible and understood by relevant stakeholders; prepare and present recommendations, reports, and findings using relevant visualizations
Oversee KPIs, establish a dynamic reporting cycle, based on which decide on and implement responsive actions
Map and structure data from existing sources, for example Atfarm, Premium Program, RFQ, to create integrated "360¬∞ views" of customers to support customer-centricity across our portfolio of products, tools, and services




Profile




At least Bachelor degree in business analytics, data science, marketing, user experience, agribusiness, statistics or any other related field
Minimum 5 years of experience in market data analyses and growth and engagement; experience in the agricultural industry - an advantage
Experience participating in strategic discussions, interpreting and integrating data from various sources and clearly communicating the findings from analyses to a diverse collection of stakeholders to drive and support decision-making
Excellent data analysis skills with strong business acumen and understanding of how data insight can meet business needs and contribute value
Experience increasing retention and engagement, managing churn, translating insight into improvements and implementing feature adoption strategies
Proactive, resourceful and experienced working in a complex matrix organization with excellent collaboration, listening and communication skills
Experience with digital marketing and other user-data oriented products
Good understanding of Yara's business in Europe, its strategy and change agenda - an advantage




Additional Information




Periodical visits to the local markets throughout the year for workshops are expected
Operational language - English, knowledge of any other language spoken in the Continental Europe markets (i.e., French, German etc). is an advantage
The location for this role can be any Yara site relevant to Continental Europe markets




Yara is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage qualified applicants from all backgrounds to apply.




Contact details




R≈´ta Povilaitytƒó




Senior HR Advisor




ruta.povilaityte@yara com




Allison O'Dell




Director, Marketing & Agronomy




allison.odell@yara.com




Apply no later than




February 22, 2023




Knowledge grows through differences




Yara is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe that creating a diverse and inclusive work environment is not only the right thing, but also the smart thing to do. To deliver on this, Yara has firmly anchored Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) in our business strategy and has more than 400 employees worldwide involved in D&I ambassadors networks.

Title: Junior Data Protection Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
We don't wait for the future, but shape today¬¥s digital world. Grow along our company and take on responsibility.

Join Helios Global Health's Data Protection team as a

Junior Data Protection Analyst (m/w/d).

Das erwartet Sie


Participate to the continued development and improvement of Helios Global Health‚Äôs data protection program
Serve as a liaison between the data protection department and external third parties e.g. Consultants, contractors, service providers, etc.
Draft, review and update the data protection policies, SOPs and guidelines and be an instrumental part of the data protection‚Äôs monitoring program to enhance and insure internal compliance
Actively participate and assist with all data protection specific processes including Subject Access Requests, Data Privacy Impact Assessments, Transfer Impact Assessments, Unauthorized Disclosure, Company Trainings, (‚Ä¶)
Review company¬¥s new products, features and designs and provide guidance on data protection requirements and applicable industry standards
Support the maintenance of the data protection relevant documentation like the records of processing activities (ROPA) and all the data protection related inventories


Das bringen Sie mit


Bachelor¬¥s degree or prior experience in data protection, compliance, legal, audit or equivalent function, preferably within an international organization. Experience with Governance, Risk and Compliance programs is a plus
Ability to communicate comfortably with stakeholders across the organization including Heads of department and higher management in German and English
Strong knowledge of global and international data privacy laws and regulations and of compliance standards and frameworks, such as (ISO 27001, NIST, etc.)
Willingness to develop and in-depth understanding of Helios Global Health‚Äôs business model and trends in the global healthcare industry
General interest in new technologies and aspiration to learn more about information technology, data flows, cloud solutions, databases, access management etc.
Willingness to travel (approximately 10-20% of time) and to work independently with minimal supervision


Freuen Sie sich auf


A flexible schedule including remote work and an attractive and modern work environment (Frankfurt - Berlin)
A comprehensive benefits package including competitive salary
Direct contact with World-class managers
Learning and development opportunities
Real and impactful tasks with the possibility to learn and grow as a professional
Mission-driven work that changes the lives of people around the world

  • Strong knowledge of global and international data privacy laws and regulations and of compliance standards and frameworks, such as (ISO 27001, NIST, etc.)
  • Willingness to develop and in-depth understanding of Helios Global Health‚Äôs business model and trends in the global healthcare industry
  • General interest in new technologies and aspiration to learn more about information technology, data flows, cloud solutions, databases, access management etc.
  • Willingness to travel (approximately 10-20% of time) and to work independently with minimal supervision

Freuen Sie sich auf

  • A flexible schedule including remote work and an attractive and modern work environment (Frankfurt - Berlin)
  • A comprehensive benefits package including competitive salary
  • Direct contact with World-class managers
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Real and impactful tasks with the possibility to learn and grow as a professional
  • Mission-driven work that changes the lives of people around the world

Jetzt liegt es nur noch an Ihnen!

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact HK-Personalmanagement-Zentrale[at]helios-gesundheit.de.

Helios Global Health is offering a unique opportunity for young professionals wishing to learn and develop in the field of data protection.

The address of your new job as a Junior Data Protection Analyst (m/w/d) is: Friedrichstra√üe 136, 10117 Berlin or Speicherstra√üe 49-51, 60317 Frankfurt/Main

We are looking forward to your application.

Equal chances at the workplace are important to us. Therefor, we explicitly encourage people of any sexual identity and ethnicity or with disabilities to apply.

Title: Data Analyst in Pricing Systems (m/f/d) - Remote Option GER
Description:
Agriculture is all about balance. The balance that is crucial to everyone's existence - also applies to our Agricultural Solutions division. We connect innovative thinking with practical action to find the right balance for success - for farmers, agriculture and future generations. With seeds and traits, crop protection and digital solutions, we help farmers produce food more efficiently, protect the land and meet the needs of society.




Responsibilities




Join our Agricultural Solutions Expert Services team at our Berlin Hub.




Within our global network you coordinate and continuously develop pricing, forecasting as well as CRM processes and manage all integration requirements on the units business data for our pricing tool solution.
In addition, you optimize and define processes as well as interfaces with a holistic data management approach based on the comparison of best practices, monitoring and analysis of KPIs as well as new or changed requirements in other units.
You exploit full potential of customer insights across local marketing and sales sources, exploring for patterns as well as insights, which effectively connect across digital, marketing and sales teams.
Moreover, you interlink tools to achieve process synergies and enable holistic data management including full support of growth analytics approach.
You define and handle data processes and flows within the given technical infrastructure and business needs.
Last but not least, you create and implement business specific guidelines within the given standards and strategies of BASF.


QUALIFICATIONS




degree in business administration, computer science or a related field of study with several years of work experience
knowledge in customer relationship management, process modelling and process analysis as well as project experience
good understanding of sales and marketing business processes‚Äô
excellent communication in English with strong presentation and moderation skills
team player with innovational drive, analytical thinking and consulting skills


BENEFITS




Onboarding to help you settle in quickly, ensuring you are part of the BASF team from day one.
30 days of paid vacation, special leave and sabbatical options.
Flexible working hours so that you can organize your working and private life according to your needs.
Location-independent work models with defined days of presence in Berlin and place of residence in Germany.


ABOUT US




Do you have any questions about the application process or the position? Please reach out to: Viktoria Pohl (Talent Acquisition), Tel.: +49 30 2005-58390




As an international service hub, the BASF Services Europe GmbH bundles a wide range of services for the BASF Group throughout Europe. In the heart of Berlin, we combine expertise in the areas of finance, HR, supply chain, procurement, product safety and IT. We focus on digital and customer-focused solutions, to create services for future. Learn more about us and our location-independent work models at basf.com/en/servicehub-berlin/smartwork




At BASF, the chemistry is right. Because we are counting on innovative solutions, on sustainable actions, and on connected thinking. And on you. Become a part of our formula for success and develop the future with us - in a global team that embraces diversity and equal opportunities irrespective of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, disability or belief.




Please note that we do not return paper applications including folders. Please submit copies only and no original documents.




Please upload the documents, summarized in a PDF if possible.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
You will join the Growth Tribe within SumUp and help us grow SumUp's multi-product merchant base. Our goal is to turn interested merchants into live merchants by offering an intuitive, trustworthy and cohesive experience from the first touch point on the marketing site to engaging with our products & services as they need them.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will turn data into insights for growth and product teams to empower them to make better decisions and provide insights to the leadership team, e.g., on the impact of strategic initiatives on the key metrics. The successful candidate is hands-on and strategic, especially when collaborating closely with our product teams, Analytics Engineer, and multiple squads. This means you will be responsible for analyzing how different initiatives contribute to our core OKRs and product strategy, setting up and owning end-to-end dashboard development, including requirements gathering and monitoring, and maintaining existing dashboards in production (Tableau). You will identify opportunities, manage stakeholder reporting expectations, and influence SumUp partners to act.

As a Product Analyst, you will:


Collaborate with organizational leaders to identify informational needs
Develop a deep understanding of specific areas of the business and the key metrics to drive data-driven performance measurement of product strategies
Create KPIs based on business requirements and align them globally
Generate reports (i.e., Tableau) and presentations on results findings to promote a data-driven organization
Analyze data sets to spot trends and patterns that can be translated into actionable insights
Collect data from different sources using SQL and assess the quality of the data
Running product experiments by designing and analyzing AB tests
Build Data Products together with Analytical Engineers, provide clear documentation and ensure the quality of the data models
Present findings in an easy-to-understand way to inform data-driven decisions
Build and maintain a strong communication network with key stakeholders


Your Profile:


5+ years of experience in a similar role
Strong SQL skills
Experience with designing and analyzing experiments (A/B tests)
Experience with Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar
Experience with Tableau (or a similar visualization tool)
Strong written and verbal skills with the ability to communicate technical subjects to non-technical audiences
Self-driven and highly motivated with strong attention to accuracy and detail
Ability to manage multiple priorities in an efficient manner
Analytical thinking and problem-solving skills


Nice to Have


Experience with Python or R
Experience with Git, Airflow
DBT Experience
Experience with Google Analytics (or similar web analytics tool)


Why you should join SumUp


We‚Äôre a truly global team of 3000+ people from 60+ countries, spread across 3 continents. We have a close, welcoming and international community
SumUp Corporate Pension Plan
Yoga classes, running & football teams, subsidised Urban Sports Club membership
Learning & development budget for attending conferences and training
Mobility Options : company transportation ticket or bike leasing
Kita Cooperation


Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don‚Äôt tick every box, it‚Äôs ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Pitch is the collaborative presentation platform for modern teams. With a focus on real-time collaboration, smart workflows, and intuitive design features, we make it fast and delightful for teams to create and deliver beautiful presentations. Our presentation and template galleries give everyone the ability to publish their own standout work, learn from one another, and find the creative spark for their next presentation. Tens of thousands of teams have made the switch to Pitch, including top brands like Intercom, Superhuman, and Notion. We‚Äôve raised over $135 million to date, and have been recognized by FT-backed Sifted as Europe's Top B2B Soonicorn in 2022. And we‚Äôre just getting started.




We built Pitch for people who are thirsting for a better way to design, collaborate on, and share presentations. In order to improve our product, we continuously seek to improve our understanding of the user journey from first hearing about Pitch, to creating the first deck, to inviting team member to collaborate, and beyond.




One lens we‚Äôve relied on to better understand this complex journey is data.

As a Senior Data Analyst on our Analytics team, you'll shed numerical light on the many mysteries that await us as we build and position Pitch as the greatest presentation tool known to humanity in 2023 and beyond.




What you'll get to do...




Inform and influence our growth and product strategy through data exploration.
Collaborate with Marketing, Sales, User Research, Customer Support, Finance and Product to make data-driven insights and recommendations.
Play a key role in enabling and promoting self-service analytics among stakeholders in the wider organization.
Guide teams through experimentation-based execution.
Partner with Data Engineering to maintain and extend our Data Warehouse (SnowFlake), improve data quality and documentation.




This role is perfect for you if you bring...




4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or in a relevant field.
High proficiency in SQL and comfortable navigating data to perform a wide range of analyses.
High proficiency in using BI tools.
Experience with Git.
Strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience in playing the role of ‚Äúproject manager‚Äù when the occasion calls for it.




Not a must, but it would be great if you have‚Ä¶




Experience in SaaS business models.
Experience with marketing analytics.
Experience with dbt.
Understanding of statistical concepts like causal analysis.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir suchen zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Eintrittstermin einen Marketing Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Vollzeit am Standort Berlin.

Als Teil des Brand Strategy & Analytics Teams beeinflussen Sie aktiv die Ausrichtung unseres Marketings, das Image unserer Marke, bauen den Marketing-Anteil unserer bereichs√ºbergreifenden Reporting-Struktur aus und entwickeln effiziente und effektive Reports mit klaren strategischen Ableitungen. Kontinuierliche Analyse und Verbesserung der Datenquellen, -qualit√§t und Datenkompetenz mit den Channel Ownern, f√ºr die effektive Verkn√ºpfung aller Touchpoints

Fundierte Erfahrung im Bereich Data Science und dem Analysieren, Auswerten und Aufbereiten von Daten

Ausgepr√§gte Probleml√∂ser-Mentalit√§t

Bereichs- und funktions√ºbergreifendes Verst√§ndnis von betrieblichen Abl√§ufen und dem Zusammenhang von Gesch√§ftsprozessen im interkulturellen Management
Flie√üende Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch zwingend erforderlich




Was wir bieten:

Von Media-Kampagnen √ºber PR und bis hin zu Event- und CRM-Aktivit√§ten, nicht nur im HQ-Team, sondern weltweit, begutachten und analysieren Sie die Effekte auf Schnittstellen wie Sales und Business Transformation und leiten daraus Handlungsempfehlungen f√ºr unsere Markenstrategie ab.


Sie stellen unsere Ma√ünahmen und Ergebnisse in den Kontext von Marken- und Vertriebszielen, unseren bisherigen Marketing-Aktivit√§ten sowie externer Consumer & Market Intelligence.


Zusammen mit den Experten aus dem Marketing-Team und weiteren Fachbereichen finden Sie die richtigen Fragen und Antworten, erstellen Handlungsempfehlungen und arbeiten aktiv an der zuk√ºnftigen Ausrichtung unserer Marke.


Als Teil des Brand Strategy & Analytics Teams beeinflussen Sie aktiv die Ausrichtung unseres Marketings, das Image unserer Marke, bauen den Marketing-Anteil unserer bereichs√ºbergreifenden Reporting-Struktur aus und entwickeln effiziente und effektive Reports mit klaren strategischen Ableitungen. Sie kreieren daf√ºr die richtigen Tools und Analysen f√ºr verschiedene interne Zielgruppen und auf Konzernseite.


Ihre Aufgaben:


  • Vollst√§ndige Begleitung von Marketingkampagnen, von der Kampagnenentwicklung bis zur Bewertung und Erkl√§rung der Performance vs. der definierten Marketing- und Sales-Ziele, sowie Entwicklung von Handlungsempfehlungen f√ºr die Zukunft
  • Tracking, Reporting und Analyse s√§mtlicher relevanter Performance KPIs und Entwicklung von standardisierten Reports
  • Bearbeitung von Ad-hoc Analysen und Realtime Tracking zur optimierten Kampagnensteuerung
  • Konzeption von Testszenarien f√ºr AB-Tests zur Analyse von User-Verhalten und Conversion-Optimierung
  • Vollst√§ndiger Aufbau des Marketing Performance Dashboards in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Brand Strategy Team
  • Weiterentwicklung der Client Equation, unter Ber√ºcksichtigung relevanter KPIs und deren Bedeutung und Auswirkungen
  • Kontinuierliche Analyse und Verbesserung der Datenquellen, -qualit√§t und Datenkompetenz mit den Channel Ownern, f√ºr die effektive Verkn√ºpfung aller Touchpoints
  • Schnittstelle zur Analytics Community und des Marktforschungs-Teams auf Konzernseite


Ihre F√§higkeiten:


  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium mit der Fachrichtung Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Informatik, Mathematik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder eines verwandten Studiengangs mit analytischem Schwerpunkt
  • Mindestens drei Jahre Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Position
  • Fundierte Erfahrung im Bereich Data Science und dem Analysieren, Auswerten und Aufbereiten von Daten
  • Programmierkenntnisse in SQL, Python, R o.√§. von Vorteil
  • Ausgepr√§gte Probleml√∂ser-Mentalit√§t
  • Hohes Ma√ü an Selbst√§ndigkeit, Proaktivit√§t und Zielorientierung
  • Ausgepr√§gte Kommunikations- und Teamf√§higkeit, stark im Bereichs- und Hierarchie-√ºbergreifenden Netzwerk-/Beziehungsaufbau
  • Bereichs- und funktions√ºbergreifendes Verst√§ndnis von betrieblichen Abl√§ufen und dem Zusammenhang von Gesch√§ftsprozessen im interkulturellen Management
  • Flie√üende Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch zwingend erforderlich


Was wir bieten:


  • Leistungsgerechte, attraktive Verg√ºtung mit 13. Gehalt und Teilnahme am Bonusprogramm
  • Hohes Ma√ü an Eigenverantwortung und M√∂glichkeit zur Umsetzung eigener Ideen
  • Internationale Zusammenarbeit innerhalb des Richemont Konzerns
  • Ein modernes Arbeitsumfeld im Herzen von Berlin
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und die M√∂glichkeit zu Homeoffice
  • Zuschuss zum Jobticket
  • Arbeitgebergef√∂rdertes Altersvorsorgemodell und verm√∂genswirksame Leistungen

  • Kostenfreie Nutzung der konzerninternen digitalen Sprachsoftware Speexx
  • Umfangreiche Corporate Benefits Angebote


Es erwartet Sie eine anspruchsvolle Aufgabe in einem modern ausgerichteten Unternehmen des Richemont-Konzerns. Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte und hinterlassen Sie Ihre Fu√üspuren.
