Title: Data Analyst / Data Product Manager (m/w/d)
HTML:
Lust ‚ÄûBig Data‚Äú mit Leben zu f√ºllen? Den Umgang mit gro√üen Datenmengen zu revolutionieren? Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig!

Gegr√ºndet 2011 mit Firmensitz in Potsdam hat sich die Lot Internet GmbH auf das Erfassen und Analysieren strukturierter Daten aus dem Internet spezialisiert.

Als Data Analyst / Data Product Manager liegt Dein Schwerpunkt in der Nutzbarmachung von heterogenen Online-Datenquellen durch die Entwicklung von effizienten Daten-Services. Du ber√§tst und unterst√ºtzt unsere Kunden bei der digitalen Transformation und hilfst diesen, durch Daten einen echten Mehrwert zu generieren.

Ziel ist die Erkennung von Zusammenh√§ngen und Mustern in den Datenwelten, sowie die Schaffung von Transparenz im Marktgeschehen. Der Branchenschwerpunkt liegt dabei im Bereich Automotiv, wo gro√üe Konzerne unsere Kunden sind.

Aufgaben
  • Erstellung von ganzheitlichen Analysen, basierend auf Datenbankabfragen;
  • Interpretation und Bewertung von Datenanalysen und Kennzahlen;
  • Konzeption von Online-Applikationen zur Datenanalyse;
  • Verantwortlich f√ºr die Datenqualit√§tssicherung, u.a. durch fortlaufende Optimierung von Datenverarbeitungsprozessen;
  • Strategische Beratung unserer Kunden bei Big Data-Analysen;
  • Fachlicher Key Account Manager;
  • Produkt- und Projektmanagement bei unseren Daten-Services;
  • Steuerung von Entwicklern zur Datenerfassung und -aufbereitung;
  • Unterst√ºtzung des Managements im Bereich Business Development.
Profil
  • Abgeschlossenes Studium der Mathematik, Informatik, Physik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder einschl√§gige Berufserfahrung;
  • Strukturiertes, reflektiertes und analytisches Denken
  • Sicherer Umgang mit Methoden zur Analyse und zur Aufbereitung von Daten;
  • Erfahrung mit relationalen Datenbanken (z.B. PostgreSQL);
  • Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement, idealerweise auch im Produktmanagement;
  • Sicheres und kompetentes Auftreten bei unseren Kunden;
  • Sehr gute Pr√§sentations- und Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch;
  • Zielorientierte, sorgf√§ltige und eigenst√§ndige Arbeitsweise.
Wir bieten
  • Eine umfassende und praxisorientierte Einarbeitung;
  • Ein familienfreundliches Unternehmen mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und drei Tage Home-Office;
  • Flache Hierarchien f√ºr ein effizientes und zielorientiertes arbeiten;
  • Ein motiviertes und kollegiales Team;
  • Ein Umfeld mit Respekt vor dem Kunden und zwischen den Kollegen;
  • Offene, kooperative und vertrauensvolle Unternehmenskultur;
  • Fachliche als auch pers√∂nliche Weiterentwicklung im Job durch vielf√§ltige Trainingsangebote und Coaching;
  • Einen verkehrsg√ºnstig gelegenen Arbeitsplatz im Zentrum von Potsdam.

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Our highly ambitious team around serial entrepreneur Mario Kohle is supported by experienced investors like Alexander Samwer (Picus Capital) and Lukasz Gadowski (Team Europe, Delivery Hero). In addition, we were able to bring Princeville Climate Technology (advised and funded among others by Leonardo DiCaprio) and Peter Rive (SolarCity) on board. As the first green unicorn in Germany, we see it as our duty to continuously drive forward our mission of green energy for all. Be part of our success story and change the world by joining us!

Job Description

Disrupting the conservative energy market, that‚Äôs what Enpal is all about! We offer speed, agility, and steep career opportunities. Our vision is to make sustainable solar energy available to everyone. Join us to develop your professional skills, take part in the solar-energy revolution, and let us take ownership of the sustainable change we want to see in the world together!

As Data Engineer in our Data Platform Team, you will be responsible for working with Enpal‚Äôs data collection and projects. You will be in charge of developing and improving our data infrastructure and evaluating new tools and services we can use to extend our data offerings.

Your Responsibilities

Create and maintain data ingestion ELT pipelines to the Data Warehouse
Ensure high data integrity and implement solutions to constantly improve data reliability and quality
Build required infrastructure for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from various data sources using Azure and SQL technologies
Assemble large, complex, high-quality data sets that meet business requirements
Work together with members of Business Intelligence and efficiently communicate both solutions and results to stakeholders
Develop efficient solutions to problems alongside cross-functional communication with other project team members


Qualifications

You have 2+ years experience as a Data Engineer or a similar role
You have working knowledge of Python & SQL
You acquired prior experience with one of the cloud platforms (Azure, AWS or GCP) and its services
You possess a deep understanding of databases
High level of written and spoken English to work in an international team


Additional Information

The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.
Direct impact on our corporate success and exciting career opportunities: leave your footprint.
Close cooperation with the management team while shaping Enpal‚Äôs tech DNA: you will be part of our first Tech Team.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there‚Äôs plenty of room for your ideas.
A great work environment in our Berlin office, or focused work from home - you decide. Your location should be in Germany or at least willingness to relocate. At the moment we don't offer full remote Jobs.


At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Forecasting Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and creativity, where you can be on the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you‚Äôre interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to crafting an ambitious and inclusive work environment, join eBay ‚Äì a company you can be proud to be with.




Company Perspective




The eBay Global Customer Experience (GCX) team is responsible for building experiences that customers love in Service Delivery. The role we are hiring for is a Forecasting Analyst as part of the Workforce Operations team within the GCX organization. This team is responsible for extracting learnings and insights from our customer interactions and influencing direction inside GCX through volume forecasting and analysis.




Forecasting




Primary Job Responsibilities:




Analyzing and understanding call volume drivers and trends
Developing and Implementing a closed loop to feed these learnings back into both the business and the forecast
Developing a short, mid and long-term forecast based on our service delivery strategy using statistical modelling
Creating Region, Channel and Staff Group level forecast at weekly/monthly level based on strong analytics
Proactively determining risk and opportunities through scenario analysis
Supporting planning strategies with clear, concise review of volume drivers
Providing variance analysis of volume forecast vs. Financial Forecast, Budget and Various Scenarios
Communicating critical data in a format that is immediately useful to answer questions about the inputs and outputs of Demand Forecasting systems and improving their performance
Communicating verbally and in writing to business customers with various levels of technical knowledge, educating them about our systems, as well as sharing insights and recommendations




Process Management & Improvement




Implementing continuous improvements in the forecast including opportunities to streamline and automate.
Developing Forecast Accuracy measurement methodology
Implementing Forecast Accuracy measurement reporting and communication strategy




Special Analysis




Analysis of special cause drivers including billing, bugs, outages, etc.
Executive Summaries of volume risks and opportunities
Addition Ad Hoc Analysis as needed




Minimum Qualifications




Demonstrated forecasting experience using statistical modelling
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience
Minimum of 4 years of experience forecasting in either a multi-channel contact center or operations environment.
Must be open to Hybrid work out of our Draper, UT office




Preferred Qualifications




Demonstrated SQL experience
5+ years of experience forecasting in either a multi-channel contact center or operations environment.
Advanced forecasting, statistical modelling, Excel, SQL, PowerPoint, business presentations




Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you‚Äôre single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. Including maternal & paternal leave, paid sabbatical, and plans to help ensure your financial security today and in the years ahead because we know feeling financially secure during your working years and through retirement is important.




Here at eBay, we love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn‚Äôt just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about eBay‚Äôs Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/




eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible. View our accessibility info to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. HTML:
Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and creativity, where you can be on the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you‚Äôre interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to crafting an ambitious and inclusive work environment, join eBay ‚Äì a company you can be proud to be with.


Company Perspective


The eBay Global Customer Experience (GCX) team is responsible for building experiences that customers love in Service Delivery. The role we are hiring for is a Forecasting Analyst as part of the Workforce Operations team within the GCX organization. This team is responsible for extracting learnings and insights from our customer interactions and influencing direction inside GCX through volume forecasting and analysis.


Forecasting


Primary Job Responsibilities:


  • Analyzing and understanding call volume drivers and trends
  • Developing and Implementing a closed loop to feed these learnings back into both the business and the forecast
  • Developing a short, mid and long-term forecast based on our service delivery strategy using statistical modelling
  • Creating Region, Channel and Staff Group level forecast at weekly/monthly level based on strong analytics
  • Proactively determining risk and opportunities through scenario analysis
  • Supporting planning strategies with clear, concise review of volume drivers
  • Providing variance analysis of volume forecast vs. Financial Forecast, Budget and Various Scenarios
  • Communicating critical data in a format that is immediately useful to answer questions about the inputs and outputs of Demand Forecasting systems and improving their performance
  • Communicating verbally and in writing to business customers with various levels of technical knowledge, educating them about our systems, as well as sharing insights and recommendations


Process Management & Improvement


  • Implementing continuous improvements in the forecast including opportunities to streamline and automate.
  • Developing Forecast Accuracy measurement methodology
  • Implementing Forecast Accuracy measurement reporting and communication strategy


Special Analysis


  • Analysis of special cause drivers including billing, bugs, outages, etc.
  • Executive Summaries of volume risks and opportunities
  • Addition Ad Hoc Analysis as needed


Minimum Qualifications


  • Demonstrated forecasting experience using statistical modelling
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience
  • Minimum of 4 years of experience forecasting in either a multi-channel contact center or operations environment.
  • Must be open to Hybrid work out of our Draper, UT office


Preferred Qualifications


  • Demonstrated SQL experience
  • 5+ years of experience forecasting in either a multi-channel contact center or operations environment.
  • Advanced forecasting, statistical modelling, Excel, SQL, PowerPoint, business presentations


Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you‚Äôre single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. Including maternal & paternal leave, paid sabbatical, and plans to help ensure your financial security today and in the years ahead because we know feeling financially secure during your working years and through retirement is important.


Here at eBay, we love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn‚Äôt just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about eBay‚Äôs Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/


eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible. View our accessibility info to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. For more information see: EEO is the Law Poster and EEO is the Law Poster Supplement.

Title: Analytics & Data Lead
Description:
Job Description

About Kittl

With Kittl we are building the most intuitive and easy-to-use design platform for creators. Creating beautiful designs can be a long and painful process. We decided to tackle this problem heads-on and have built Kittl.com to provide an alternative to professional tools. With offices in Berlin and Dusseldorf, we are a diverse team of 25 creators - hailing from 10+ nationalities.

Your mission

You will be responsible and leading data & analytics at Kittl. You will have an enormous impact on Kittl's future by building modern data infrastructure from grown up, helping business users define KPIs and implementing them in our reporting, being the first go-to person on data insights for marketing, product and C-management.

Tasks & Responsibilities

Act as a partner for business users discovering and understanding business users‚Äô needs and translating them into data tasks for further data analysis and reporting
Take full ownership of the project from the idea generation, requirement gathering and successful implementation
Collaborate with our software engineers to design needed events for product understanding and data gathering
Own integration of new data sources into our data warehouse, design and implementation of high performant and scalable data models on well-defined standards and methodology
Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure high
Proactively explore and leverage new technologies to improve our processes
Drive data quality and governance, and monitoring standards to ensure data is correct, consistent and reliable


Requirements
Strong SQL skills - you are able to generate insights with efficient SQL
Strong analytical thinking - you can conceptualise how to measure the impact of tests/product changes
Experience in data modeling, data warehousing and creating code-based ELT pipelines - from raw data you generate optimized models that even business users can query and understand easily
Good communication to share complex ideas with business and engineering teams using simple language and a team player who would support Kitt‚Äôs team in any data requests
Understanding of main business metrics or the willingness to learn about them
Ability to prioritize and structure work or ask for support if help is needed
A bonus would be python (scripting & data wrangling & visualization) skills
A plus would be experience with any of the following:
Python (scripting & data wrangling & visualization) skills
Cloud Data Warehouse (Snowflake or Bigquery)
Extraction tools (Stitch or Fivetran)
Reporting solutions (Metabase or Looker or Tableau)
Transformation layer (dbt) and scheduling (Airflow, Jenkins)
GitHub and best practices in CI/CD methodologies and testings
Product/tracking analytics tools (Mixpanel, Posthog, GA/GTM)

Benefits & Why You Should Join Us

Join one of the hottest start-ups in graphic design to shape the future of graphic creation and enjoy a very open, transparent and performance driven company culture with a fast and agile development cycle

You'll work closely with and learn from a passionate and talented founding team.
You‚Äôll work on an exciting new product
You‚Äôll work with an amazing team of talented people
Very flexible working culture where progress counts
Fast interview process & competitive compensation


Also we have snacks, coffee, regular team dinners and rooftop parties ;)

If that sounds interesting to you let's get in touch.

Title: ERP Data Analyst
Description:
sennder is Europe‚Äôs leading digital freight forwarder. In a traditional industry, we are moving fast to digitize and automate all road logistics processes. We are a growing team looking for a Data Analyst to help us on our journey to revolutionize road freight logistics. You would join our Finance System Technology team in the Berlin office.

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst you‚Äôll work on interesting responsibilities like solving ERP technology-specific problems that span across order-to-cash, procure-to-pay, travel and expense management and its core accounting and finance process areas. You will run analysis that are carried both by the system and the end users, spot on gaps and discuss it with the stakeholders to bring improvement and change. You‚Äôll be collaborating closely with ERP Product Owners, Consultants, Developers, Architects, Engineers, Product Analysts, Support and business users across Europe to develop a suitable solution to digitally transform the day-to-day life of the finance and accounting department of sennder.

IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL‚Ä¶


Lead and facilitate business requirements' session to understand business process problems and document business requirements in Customer Data Management, Order-to-Cash, Supplier Data Management PR/PO-to-Pay, Travel & Expense Management and other accounting processes (Intercompany, Tax, Fixed Asset Management, Revenue Recognition)
Develop business process solutions proposals, prepare flowcharts (Swim lane, concept map, root-case, SWOT) and others presentation such as AS-IS/TO-BE processes
Conduct qualitative/quantitative analysis by collecting data from all internal and external sources and identify the most efficient means of satisfying user needs
Involve in testing and works functional, technical and support teams to continuously understand requirements, defects and end users issues
Collaborate with Services and Support management to ensure timely, appropriate implementation of processes to drive corporate initiatives and services results
Write epics (features) and stories (user specifications) in the manner understandable to bridge the gap between the business and finance systems technology team
Highly involved in the integration between upstream systems (in-house, Salesforce, other systems)) and NetSuite as well as the NetSuite ERP expansion by working closely with NetSuite Product Owner, Developer, Project Manager and the business stakeholders
Bridge the gap between technical needs and the requirements of users including providing detailed product requirements for implementation of changes to our systems


PREFERABLY YOU HAVE‚Ä¶


3 to 5 years prior working experience as an Accountant and/or with an accounting and finance team and passionate towards ERP or finance systems digital transformation or 1 to 3 years prior working experience as a Business Analyst, Process Owner or System Analyst
A relevant degree such as Bachelor's and Associate Degree in Computer Science, Business, Education, Business/Administration, Information Systems, Technical, Information Technology, Finance, Accounting, Engineering
Good hands-on experience on Excel and SQL or experience using BI tool like Looker or Tableau.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills - ability to develop hypotheses, understand and interpret data within the context of the business solve problems and distil data into actionable recommendation
A working experience as an ERP user, such as SAP, NetSuite, JD Edwards or other ERP system. If you have happened to used NetSuite, it will definitely be a plus, otherwise, willingness to learn NetSuite is needed
Demonstrated attention to detail, strong analytical, organization and communication skills with a high degree of both technical and business acumen with excellent judgement and problem-solving skills
A recent experience in implementation of ERP to tech/digital companies and/or IT Project Management experience or any licenses like PMI-BA, APICS, GSEC, CBAP, I/II, FSCM, PMP, CAPM, PMI, E1, CPIM is a plus


ABOUT Sennder

sennder is moving trucks with the power of data to unlock endless and sustainable capacity at unparalleled quality. Through our proprietary transportation operating system, built by our in-house tech teams, we not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we‚Äôre growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe‚Äôs inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Get to know us, our culture, green business, funding history, and more on our blog here.

What You Can Expect

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual‚Äôs potential for all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit, respect, and kindness to build trusted relationships across teams. Learn more on our career site.


A fast-growing, start-up-oriented international team of 1000+ people with 65+ nationalities spread across 8 country offices with English as our company language.
Continuous feedback and bi-annual review process for personal development, professional growth, and career opportunities. We also use ‚ÄúObjectives and Key Results‚Äù for company goals.
A structured promotion process, providing everyone with fair and transparent career growth.
Learning and development opportunities on the job and through conversations with your manager.
Various opportunities to connect with colleagues, formally and informally, digitally or in-person (when allowed), through regular team events, company get-togethers, and partnership events with other companies and local organizers.
Office first work policy (three days a week), that complies with local COVID-19 restrictions and policies. We also provide flex/hybrid remote working options.
When in office: unlimited snacks, drinks, and fruits.
All interviews are currently conducted on a remote basis.


Please send your application in English and help us reduce negative unconscious bias by leaving out your picture, age, address, and other unnecessary information in your CV. We only want to know the merits on which you‚Äôd be great for this role.

If you have any questions or problems please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. We do not accept applications via email.

Title: Data Analytics Engineer (all genders)
Description:
Your impact

You collaborate with different teams and stakeholders to enable data-driven decision-making in the organization
You develop advanced data models in SQL/ Python, add new data sources and enable other teams to turn those data products into insights, analyses, and dashboards
You own our core data pipelines end-to-end, from ingestion in our data warehouse to consumption in a dashboard or data product (Apache Airflow, dbt)
You enable our stakeholders to answer straightforward questions themselves via self-service tools (e.g. Metabase)
You perform ad-hoc analyses to answer business questions or generate data sets
Improvement of event tracking in close cooperation with product management, as well as collection and measurement of relevant data


Your skill set

You have several years of experience in data modeling and/or as a data engineer
You are experienced in advanced data modeling with dbt and SQL
You work with Github/ git version control on a daily base
You have experience with Python, git version control, Docker and a good understanding of Apache Airflow is a big plus
You get involved early in business specific discussions with the stakeholders and understand the requirements
You have been working with data exploration and visualization tools such as Metabase, Looker or Tableau
You are the bridge between the teams, organising, defining & translating requirements of event collection and quality
You are structured at work, able to handle and prioritise your tasks well in a dynamic environment
You can communicate complex problems with technical and business stakeholder in simple manner


Not a 100% match but you have skillset that you think we can't do without?

We‚Äôre always looking forward to meeting spectacular candidates, so please don‚Äôt hesitate to apply anyways. We are also hiring for attitude, values, and personality and we love to develop our skills together at kollex!

Why kollex?

Communication, Culture & Commitment:

Communication at eye level, a feedback and error culture with regular feedback meetings and, most importantly, respectful interaction at all times!
A lot of room for creativity and not only the possibility, but also the clear expectation to contribute yourself and your ideas at any time.
International and dynamic work environment and with the backing of leading industry partners with long-term secured financing and permanent employment contracts


Flexibility, Remote Policy & Hybrid Model:

Work from Anywhere - work 6 weeks a year from anywhere in the world.
With a mix of onsite days and remote work, we offer you the opportunity to work flexibly


Team, Benefits & Employee Development:

Language courses, further education budget, leadership training and other internal development opportunities
Regular company events such as wine and beer tastings, game nights or boat trips as well as budget for team events
Benefit packages: Mobility, sports or rather shopping - with us you can spend ‚Ç¨50 per month in the way that suits you and your preferences best.


Well-being, Health & Retirement:

Employee Assistance Programme: Our external employee counselling service supports you 24/7 on topics such as legal advice, (mental) health or family.
Company pension scheme: If you are already thinking further ahead, we support your pension scheme in the form of individual advice and an allowance.
Cereal bar, drinks, fruit and weekly company lunch


Additional Information

At kollex, we would like to have more diversity! We‚Äôre committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or origin. We take care of each other and are grateful for each person‚Äôs individual contribution to our mission!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Popcore is proud to be part of the Take2/Zynga/Rollic group and creates oddly satisfying entertainment for everyone, everywhere, like our number 1 game Parking Jam! We have been listed in the Top 10 hottest Berlin startups & Top 100 European startups by wired.com. Based from our Berlin HQ, our teams have developed and released chart-topping ad-driven free-to-play mobile games that have been downloaded far more than 500 million times across iOS and Android, including 5+ Top 10 hit games.

What you will do:

Data Engineer at Popcore forms part of the Platform Team and contributes to it by building and maintaining data pipelines and related technologies and tooling.

Write clean, maintainable, readable, modular and testable programming code in Python
Work with distributed processing systems, frameworks, resource managers and schedulers
Implement new data structures
Ensure vital data is available at all times
Create new data pipelines
Develop existing data pipelines
Work with stakeholders to create clear data distribution platforms
Ensure data is GDPR compliant
Participate in on-call rotation
Our current tech stack: MS Azure and AKS [Cloud services], Prefect [Scheduling], Snowflake and Google BigQuery [DWH], Spark on Databricks [Data processing], Python (90%) and Scala [Programming languages], DBT and SQL [Data manipulation], Git [Source control], and Jenkins [CI/CD]


What we are looking for:

Minimum 2 years of previous experience as a Data Engineer, within a gaming environment would be a bonus
Previous experience working with databases, data warehouses, cold storage, and other data storage technologies
Proficiency in reading, writing, and optimizing SQL scripts
Basic knowledge of containerization
Strong communication skills in English, with excellent interpersonal skills


Why you will love Popcore:

Grow with us We want to enable you to take charge of your career and embark on opportunities that will challenge, motivate and grow you. Our learning and development budget will is one of our ways to help you achieve this
Be part of the team Join an international team of highly qualified and deeply motivated creative and technical people
Work your way Set your own work hours, schedule, and location. It's your work, your choice
Join the tech hub Learn and work with the latest tools and technology, and connect with the best talent in the industry
Relocation aid Relocate seamlessly, we take care of visas, accommodation and support you with paper work
Health and Wellbeing Your wellbeing comes first! Get secure health insurance and wellbeing package included* depending on location
Hybrid/Remote working We can embrace this working environment and can be available depending on location and role
Vacation days You deserve a well earned break! We offer up to 37 days holiday (inc public holidays)
Planning ahead We offer a company pension as standard
Office When traveling to the office we cover your BVG or bike/e-scooter rental along with free daily lunches and onsite snacks


If this sounds like it ticks all your boxes, stop reading and apply now!

Please don't worry if you don't have an up to date resume just send it along and one of our talent team will be in touch.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with physical or mental disabilities in order to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Vinted is Europe‚Äôs biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 75+ million registered members in 18 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted‚Äôs offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that‚Äôs based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

We are looking for a People Data Analyst to join Vinted People Tech Team. Our team ensures People processes run efficiently and enables internal stakeholders with valuable insights.

As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to expand support to our stakeholders. Reporting into People Tech Projects Lead, your role will be to:

Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based HR decisions
Deliver regular analysis and ad-hoc reports to support business decisions
Create dashboards and visualizations for internal stakeholders
Perform data validation and work with internal stakeholders to ensure data integrity
Contribute to interdependent People / HR wide projects


The position would suit a profile with:

4+ years of experience working with people analytics, reporting and storytelling through data
Strong understanding of analytical concepts such as trending, forecasting, etc.
Hands-on knowledge of Workday HCM and its report offering is a necessity
Strong knowledge of Google Sheets and Excel
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker and/or Tableau
The ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Communication and relationships building skills to partner with internal stakeholders


Work perks:

Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (10% from net yearly salary)
30 working days of holiday
Mental and emotional health support from Mindletic
Frequent team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
A daily allowance for ordering lunch
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided and a personal budget for home workplace furniture)


We want people to work from where they‚Äôre most comfortable, which is why we‚Äôre using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.

If this sounds interesting ‚Äì you may well be just who we need!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (all genders)
Description:
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst (all genders), who wants to join our core BI and reporting team of 4 members. As a part of this team, you develop and manage highly frequented central dashboards across multiple platforms and own innovative data products, like the vendor analytics portal.




Your role




You are part of the central BI and Reporting team, responsible for the internal reporting landscape and owner of several internal and external data products
You will work closely with a large variety of stakeholders to develop dashboards with actionable insights, automate essential business processes and collaborate with data analysts, engineers and scientists, developing individual solutions for data usage and consumption
As our data advocate, you are responsible for increasing data literacy across flaconi by offering courses for new joiners and mentor colleagues
Furthermore, you inspire the team members with best practices and/or modern approaches to data visualization and open new revenue streams by continuously developing data products for external suppliers
You proactively identify the needs of business stakeholders and deliver actionable insights and support in generating insights for business partners and c-level
You also continuously improve/develope the reporting landscape, work on a large variety of business reports and become an advocate for data literacy across the entire company.
Your profile




At least 4 years of experience as a BI Analyst, at best previous experience in E-commerce or digital services
Expert in dashboarding/ BI reporting, good conceptual know-how of data visualization and storytelling
Strong knowledge of Tableau or similar data visualization tools
At least 3 years experience in SQL and/or Python on a moderate level, knowledge of Apache Superset is a plus
Experience in working with multiple stakeholders across different teams in an e-commerce environment is a plus
Good written and verbal English proficiency. German is a plus
What we offer you




Full transparency: For this role, we have a salary band between 50000‚Ç¨ and 63000‚Ç¨ gross per year. The salary that we will offer you will always be within this span and is based on the skills that you show during the recruitment process.
Our employees matter to us: We offer you a permanent contract, a BVG ticket and relocation support for international applicants moving to Germany.
Work-life balance: 29 vacation days, flexible working hours, up to three days of working from home a week and in specific cases the option to work 100 % remotely; the possibility of a paid sabbatical.
flaconi Academy: Actively shape your own career path by taking advantage of our internal and external training opportunities.
We care about your well being: We want to support you also during difficult times. For this, we offer you and your close relatives counseling sessions with mental health professionals.
flaconi Fitness: a wide range of sports options & discounts on memberships.
Family first: Our ‚Äúemergency-daycare‚Äù is there for you in out-of-the-ordinary situations to look after your child on site at our office.
Thinking about tomorrow together: flaconi subsidizes your savings contribution to the company pension scheme with an additional 20%.
A comfortable working space with everything you need: High end technical equipment, fruits and drinks, no dress code and dogs are welcome in our office!
Other perks: Great discounts in our online shop as well with our partner companies, cool team events & company parties!
About flaconi




With more than three million active customers, flaconi is one of Germany‚Äôs leading online beauty and self-care retailers. The online shop‚Äôs extensive portfolio consists of almost 1000 national and international brands and 50.000 products. From drugstore over organic cosmetics to premium and luxury, the online shop covers all product segments and offers a diverse selection of products for a unique and daily self-care routine.




Founded in 2011 as one of the first online perfumeries, flaconi is honored to work with more than 700 people from 60 different nations at the flaconi headquarters in Berlin-Charlottenburg and its fulfillment center in Halle.




With the Flaconi Concept Store in the historic Tuteur House in Berlin, flaconi is also represented in the stationary trade and offers its customers an exquisite range of niche and premium brands as well as an integrated hair salon.




flaconi has received numerous awards and is also represented in Austria, Poland and France.




Shape our company‚Äôs success with us and apply now online! We look forward to receiving your complete application documents, including your earliest starting date. Please direct your application to Pia Niemuth (Talent Acquisition).

Title: Data Engineer - Marketing
Description:
Data Engineer - Marketing Services - Berlin, Germany




Cititec are exclusively partnered with one of Berlin's most popular and heavily funded FinTech's to scale out their data & engineering functions.




The app is currently used by millions of customers around the world and it has become a pivotal product especially in the European market.




Due to their continued success & rise they are looking to further expand their data team across data engineering, analytics engineering, data science, product & growth analytics.




With your team, you will take full responsibility for the Marketing data and projects centered around Attribution, ROAS, CLV etc and aim to provide an excellent data foundation for all marketing services.




Requirements:

2 Years experience in a Data Engineering role (or similar)

SQL

Python

Previous experience within marketing, tracking would be a big plus




Benefits:

Generous Stock Options

Relocation and Visa Assistance




Hybrid Working Model

Title: People Data & Compensation Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
We are looking for a skilled People Data & Compensation Analyst to join our ride at Blacklane's People & Culture team. You will use tools, data, and analytical thinking to provide clear and constructive reward & data insights advice internally, in order to ensure Blacklane stays competitive and attractive to talents.

Your Responsibilities

Provide support and assist with a range of total rewards initiatives including salary band review benchmarking, remuneration, bonus and long-term incentive schemes incl. Employee Stock Option Program (ESOP), pay equity analysis and so on.
Support and assist with the design and the implementation of a yearly feedback cycle.
Support to train and guide People & Culture colleagues and people managers about various compensation guidelines.
Review and develop current benefit schemes at a global scale. Collaborate closely with the People Operations team to implement the enhanced benefits if any.
Work closely with the People Business Partner team, business leads, recruitment team and relevant stakeholders to build up and implement insightful reports and dashboard systems at Blacklane.
Analyze people data and provide insights per request where necessary.
Continue to review current systems/ processes/ documentations and improve it continuously.


About You

Strong analytic background. Ideally you have already solid knowledge of Compensation & benefits programs, trends and practices, preferably global exposure and people data
An advanced proficiency in G-suit, particularly Google sheets. You are capable of manipulating and presenting data accurately and efficiently.
Analytical and critical thinker. With your solution-oriented approach, you are comfortable analyzing and communicating complex concepts, understanding trends, and formulating recommendations for actions based on the analysis.
Demonstrated ability to design conceptually and implement people programs in scale-ups.
Innovative and flexible. You are the champion of staying up to date with global HR trends. You are comfortable working in ambiguity and creating solutions that achieve time-sensitive goals.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy for both numerical and written work.
Great communication and interpersonal skills. You communicate clearly with different audiences by combining narratives and data. Fluent English is required.


MORE THAN A JOB:

Blacklane is a scale-up started in 2011, founded by Jens Wohltorf and Frank Steuer who wanted to create the first global chauffeur service. We started by filling chauffeurs' 'empty leg' journeys and have grown with our partners to over ‚Ç¨100 million in annual revenue (pre-pandemic). Backed by Daimler and other investors in Germany, Japan, Switzerland, and the UAE, we're now a trusted brand within corporate travel.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture. Responding to the pandemic, we've successfully managed the crises and retained our talented crew!

Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days (working from home is the new normal).
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We've banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you're always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane has pledged to deliver 75% of its journeys in electric vehicles by 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.


Upgrade your career with Blacklane

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (w/x/m)
Description:
Puls Project is at the verge of an exhilarating journey. Our mission is to create the entire financial world in one platform for German small to midsize enterprises and entrepreneurs, across all sectors and industries.We are building a platform that will enable the client to have money, where the client needs it just at the right time when they actually need it. The aim is to free up their time to make sure it can be spent on growing their business, not just managing to survive. Puls connects all your bank accounts in one place, business as well as private. The client will be able to have an overview of their financial history, as well as actually get forecasting for their cash flow with that data. You will be able to make all payments in one place, instant and easy. And what if money gets tight? The future with Puls will give the opportunity to get business loans for SME without the hassle of a complicated bank checkup. At Puls Technologies GmbH you can expect a high caliber work environment. You work directly with the founders - an energetic team that is highly motivated to create impact in the world of German SMEs.

Tasks

Review and validate customer data as it‚Äôs collected
Oversee the deployment of data to the data warehouse
Monitor analytics and metrics results
Implement new data analysis methodologies
Review customer files to ensure integrity of data collection and utilization
Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies
Collaborating with team members for the purpose of collecting data and executing the company‚Äôs mission


Requirements

Data modeling
Data mining
Business analysis
Database management and reporting
Strong Microsoft Excel and VBA skills
Critical-thinking and problem-solving
nice to have, but not obligatory:


Tableau and data visualization, German

Benefits

You will work with an enthusiastic team of smart people in the heart of Berlin - City West. Come and join us on this journey!

Get in touch with us now.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst / Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Codete is not just a software company, it‚Äôs a place where tech-enthusiasts can grow by doing what they love and feel valued for what they are. We‚Äôre experienced, agile and versatile: we work with a wide range of technologies in projects from many different industries, and the majority of our team are senior-level specialists.

At Codete, there‚Äôs always something new to learn!

Together with our technology partner, we are looking for a mid level Data Engineer who gets excited about building data

systems and wants to solve data centric problems unique to the field of social media driven e-commerce.

Location: Remote from EU countries, Germany-Berlin

Working hours / Part-time job: 20h/week

Tech stack: Python, Snowflake, DBT, Prefect (or Airflow), SQL, GCP cloud

Salary: PLN 7 000 - 9 000 per month / 1400 - 1900 Euro/month gross B2B

Requirements

In this role you will:

Develop and maintain existing data systems and data pipelines
Develop new data pipelines or acquire data from different sources to power analytics and some internal applications
Optimize existing data processing architecture for scale
Design and implement a testing & monitoring strategy for our data pipelines
Serve as the point of contact and sparring partner for data analysts, product managers and other stakeholders
Implement solutions to constantly improve data reliability and quality


Your Profile (Required)

2-4 yrs of experience as a Data Engineer
Strong Python skills
Working experience with Snowflake (or another MPP database), DBT and Prefect (or Airflow)
Good grasp of SQL, relational databases, and data modelling concepts
Analytical mindset, high attention to detail, strange obsession with automation
Ability to research and solve technical challenges
Ability to translate business problems into effective data solutions
Ability to see the bigger picture and write software that always addresses the business question posed
Excellent English communication skills


Nice to have

‚óã Knowledge of HTML, JS, Google Analytics, GTM, and frontend tracking concepts

‚óã Practical experience with DevOps concepts - GCP cloud

flexible attitude (including working hours)
international business trips
social events & awaydays
support for your ideas


Personal development

external conferences

switching between projects/technology
English classes
internal library

private health care

open source initiatives

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d) Credit Risk
Description:
Daten sind Ihr Werkzeug, Analysen Ihr Schl√ºssel und Sie bereiten beides so auf, dass es jeder versteht? Sie erwarten - wie unsere mehr als 9 Millionen Kunden - dass digitales Banking einfach, pers√∂nlich und intelligent ist? Perfekt! Title: Senior Data Analyst, Global Insights & Behavioural Analytics
Description:
We at Yara are part of a global network, collaborating to profitably and responsibly solve some of the world's key challenges - resource scarcity, food insecurity and environmental change.




About The Unit




About Digital Ag Solutions




Yara aims to be the crop nutrition company for the future and is leading the development of sustainable agriculture and digital tools to contribute to solving global agricultural challenges. We have a worldwide presence with sales teams in ~150 countries and around 17,000 employees.




Drawing on over a century of crop nutrition experience, Yara established the Digital Farming unit ‚Äì now Digital Ag Solutions (DAS) ‚Äì 4 years ago to explore how technology could be used to impact farmer livelihoods and productivity. Today, DAS has built products for smallholder and professional farmers, retailers and other farming ecosystem stakeholders across Asia, Africa, the Americas and Europe.




We are an international team of engineers, scientists, researchers, designers and agronomists working together to achieve Yara‚Äôs goal to responsibly feed this world and protect the planet. Join us in building new digital products and services to create value for stakeholders across the agricultural ecosystem.




Responsibilities




Collaborate with business and product teams to develop new products and translate data into insights.
Align business requirements with stakeholders, define metrics and develop business intelligence solutions (e.g. dashboards and reports) to fulfil requirements. Communite results and insights to stakeholders.
Quantify the end to end customer journey to increase conversion and engagement.
Establish best practices for experimentation across products, commercial sales and marketing.
Coordinate with data engineering, DevOps and platform teams to build required tooling for analytics & insights.




Profile




At least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline, e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics.
At least 3 years of experience as a data analyst or similar quantitative role.
Hands on experience in quantifying user journey.
Ability to apply scientific thinking to solve business problems with data and analytics.
Ability to translate insights/tell a story with the data and analysis.
Proficiency in SQL, R and Python. Hands-on experience with BI tools (e.g. PowerBI).
Excellent communication and presentation skills.




Additional Information




We strive to reflect the diversity in society and encourage all qualified applicants from all background to apply. We are committed to creating a work environment that fits gender equality and allows combining career progress with the needs of a family or other personal circumstances




Why us?




Evolving tech development division of an established agricultural products and services company.
Explore and develop digital, software, hardware products, which provide value to farmers, smallholder communities and the value chain.
Be part of our mission to build sustainable solutions that benefit humanity and the environment.
Full-time, permanent and freelance contract options available with competitive remuneration + benefits.
Support for personal development, training and continuous learning.
Commitment to using new technologies and frameworks, meetups, and knowledge sharing.




Apply no later than




Knowledge grows through differences




Yara is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe that creating a diverse and inclusive work environment is not only the right thing, but also the smart thing to do. To deliver on this, Yara has firmly anchored Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) in our business strategy and has more than 400 employees worldwide involved in D&I ambassadors networks.

  • fachliche Konzeption und Umsetzung von Datenanalyse-, Visualisierungs- und Dashboard-Projekten
  • eigenverantwortliche Bearbeitung von komplexen Daten-Projekten
  • Ableitung und Generierung von Erkenntnissen aus gro√üen Datenmengen
  • Erarbeitung und Vorstellung von klaren Handlungsempfehlungen in verst√§ndlicher und eindeutiger Form
  • Zusammenarbeit in einem cross-funktionalen Scrum Team mit dem Fokus auf der Entwicklung neuer Datenprodukte

  • Abstimmung, Beratung und Unterst√ºtzung mit den Stakeholdern (PO, Entwickler, Kunde)

Ihr Profil

  • abgeschlossenes Studium in einem MINT-Studiengang oder ein vergleichbarer Hochschulabschluss mit entsprechender Berufserfahrung

  • sicherer Umgang mit SQL und Bereitschaft, Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen zu verarbeiten
  • sehr gute Kenntnisse mit g√§ngigen BI-Tools (z.B. Tableau oder PowerBI)
  • Erfahrung mit Programmiersprachen wie Python oder R

Ihre Vorteile

  • Gemeinsam mehr erreichen: toller Teamspirit in einem kompetenten und zukunftssicheren Arbeitsumfeld mit einzigartigen Projekten

Title: Customer Insights Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
Our story:




Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.




Spread across Berlin and Madrid, Team Taxfix is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with 500+ professionals from 60+ different nationalities, we're rich in ideas and voices. In five years, we've raised over 300 million euros in funding and helped people reclaim more than one billion euros.




Your challenge:




In this role as Customer Insights Analyst (d/f/m), you will be a key member of our Operations Department, reporting directly to the VP of Operations and working closely with stakeholders and senior leaders from across the company. The Operations Department is on a mission to help customers overcome barriers so they can confidently complete their Taxfix journey with minimal effort. This highly strategic role will drive forward high-impact projects to enable Taxfix to improve the way we serve our customers.




Your responsibilities:




Be the expert for state-of-the-art customer experiences in the market and be up to date with the newest customer experience trends.
Regularly analyze our internal customer data, identify customer pain points, and derive recommendations to reduce customer effort and drive retention.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to drive cross-functional opportunities and recommend actions supporting our customer experience strategy. Present your findings and work closely with stakeholders to operationalize your recommendations.
Drive a data mindset in the operations department and guide team members in terms of methodology & technology. Use data management, analytics and project management skills to glean insights from analysis to actions.
Identify and drive process improvements in operations in order to deliver the best customer experience in the market, always with automation and cost-consciousness in mind.
Evaluate current practices to find better ways to solve problems with a hands-on approach. Be an advocate for change and continuously drive improvements.




Your profile:




You have 3+ years of experience managing data-driven projects within a scale-up, as a management consultant, or in a strategic/project management role in a corporate environment.
You are an analytical and conceptual thinker that is familiar with analyzing large data sets (primarily via Excel, SQL is a Plus).
You are a talented communicator who can manage a diverse set of stakeholders with competing priorities.
You are passionate about improving the experience for customers.
You are keen to take ownership and execute diligently and effectively.
You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Your English and German are flawless (written and spoken).




Why Taxfix?




A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals.
Holistic wellbeing with free mental health coaching sessions, yoga, and a discounted membership to Urban Sports Club.
A monthly allowance to spend on home support services, including childcare, housekeeping, pet sitting, tutoring, and elderly care.
Employee stock options for all employees‚Äîbecause everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create.
30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours.
A generous learning budget to support your personal and professional development and guidance from our internal L&D experts.
Work from abroad for up to six weeks every year. Just align with your team, and then enjoy your trip.
Plenty of opportunities to socialise as a team. In addition to internal meetups, our international team hosts regular get-togethers‚Äîvirtually and in person when possible.
Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix app‚Äîand internal support for all personal tax-related questions.
Have a four-legged friend in your life? We‚Äôre happy to have dogs join us in the office.




Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture below:




At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.




Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyways. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't previously considered.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyways. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't previously considered.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
About The Role




At voil√† we will build the leading Chef-to-Customer Platform, enabling everyone to experience the best chefs & restaurants at home - literally everywhere! We are keen to unlock the food experience category in food delivery by enabling award-winning, taste-making, and trendsetting chefs to ship nationwide and leverage tech to foster an authentic culinary experience at home.




We envision a world where access to the finest, most innovative, and trendsetting culinary highlights is not limited to a certain place & city. On this way, we are backed by the best VCs in the food industry, such as FoodLabs, and well equipped with culinary know-how by the best partner chefs & restaurants.




We are looking for a Senior Analytics Manager (m/f/x) to join our office in Berlin ASAP.




Take end-to-end ownership of the whole data landscape: data warehouse, reporting, (marketing) analytics, tracking, KPI development, dashboarding, data analysis
Own the full life-cycle of gathering analytics requirements, designing solutions, implementation, and feedback
Be a sparring partner for marketing and business team members understanding business needs and translating them into data solutions
Work closely with C-level to help with data-driven decision-making on business steering and creating data insights for business success
Design and build dashboards to visualize the most important KPIs
Do deep dives into data to generate product & customer insights


What you need to succeed

You are a data generalist, keen to dive into different data challenges, and have a ‚Äúget the stuff done‚Äù attitude
You ask great questions. The best analysis starts with the right questions
Experience in analytics or BI function and tools:
Strong SQL skills - you can generate insights with efficient SQL
Strong analytical thinking - you can conceptualize how to measure the business impact of marketing activities
Understanding of main marketing KPIs & cohorts
Strong knowledge of cloud data warehousing solutions (e.g. BigQuery)
Visualization tools (Looker/Data Studio/Tableau/Power BI etc)

You like learning and are proactive
You are experienced in communicating with all levels of stakeholders
Bachelor‚Äôs degree with a focus on engineering, computer science, or a related field is a plus
Fluent in English





PLUS

Experience with
Transformation layer (dbt)
web/app tracking (Google Tag Manager, GA4, firebase, adjust)
GitHub
Python data wrangling






Why join?




A high-growth, ambitious food startup environment with an exponential growth curve.
Full ownership over exciting and challenging projects.
Competitive compensation package (base and equity).
Great networking opportunities within the FoodLabs family and Berlin startup ecosystem.
An amazing office in Berlin Mitte.
Discounts to experience food from the world's best chefs.


About us




Backed by the best food tech investors FoodLabs & EQT Ventures, voil√† enables everyone to experience the best chefs & restaurants at home. From authentic tastemakers to the best top chefs: At voil√†, you can discover the hottest restaurants and enjoy from Tim Raue's favorite peking duck in Hamburg to the TV chef Steffen Henssler.




Find more about us here!

Title: Lead Data Analyst/Consultant (m/w/d), Berlin
Description:
Du bist im Data & Analytics Bereich zu Hause und hast bereits Datenprojekte bei verschiedenen Unternehmen mit aufgebaut und dabei nachhaltig Werte f√ºr die Unternehmen geschaffen? Nun bist du bereit mehr Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen und ein junges Data Consulting Startup mit aufzubauen? Dabei m√∂chtest du Kunden im datengetriebenen Marketing und der datengetriebenen Produktentwicklung beraten, moderne Data-Stacks aufsetzen und junge Teammitglieder in ihrer Entwicklung begleiten?

Dann bewirb dich jetzt bei uns als Lead Data Consultant (m/w/d).

Wir, die 9 friendly white rabbits, sind ein junges und schnell wachsendes Team von Data-Engineers und -Analysten mit Hintergr√ºnden in Mathematik, Wirtschaft, Informatik und Naturwissenschaften. Wir beraten Startups und Unternehmen bei der Entwicklung und Optimierung Ihrer Gesch√§ftsmodelle durch das Aufsetzen moderner Data & Analytics Systeme und durch die Einf√ºhrung und Optimierung von datengetriebenen Prozessen. Zu unseren Kunden z√§hlen Unternehmen in Berlin und Deutschland, wie z.B. ebay/mobileÀåde, PaulCamper, Peek und Cloppenburg, TLGG, Kettler, MyDeals, Techem und Dr. Beckmann.

Unser Anspruch ist es, unseren Kunden moderne, schlanke, leistungsf√§hige und i.d.R. cloud-basierte "State of the Art"-L√∂sungen bereitzustellen, die einerseits genau ihre aktuellen Erfordernisse bedienen, andererseits auch die Grundlage f√ºr ein weiteres datenbasiertes Wachstum bieten. Dazu bleiben wir am Puls der Entwicklung aktueller Tools und Technologien und investieren auch in eigene Innovationsprojekte.

Als Beratungsunternehmen unterst√ºtzen wir unsere Kunden in allen Data- & Analytics-Bereichen, angefangen von der Datenakquise/Tracking √ºber das Data-Engineering/DWH bis hin zu Business Analytics und Predictive Analysis. Als Berater bist du einerseits Generalist, um unsere Kunden entlang des gesamten Data-Stacks beraten zu k√∂nnen, andererseits hast du auch eine Spezialisierung in einem der Bereiche, in deinem Fall im Bereich Data Analytics (Reporting, Analysen/Insights, datengetriebene Entscheidungen, Datenmodellierung).

Aufgaben

Du baust mit uns 9 friendly white rabbits zu einer f√ºhrenden Data-Consultancy in Berlin und Deutschland aus.
Du entwickelst f√ºr unsere Kunden moderne, nutzerorientierte Data-Stacks.
Du bist f√ºr eigene Projekte verantwortlich, ber√§tst Kunden technisch und strategisch und findest selbstst√§ndig die f√ºr ihre Gesch√§ftsmodelle optimale Data & Analytics-L√∂sung.
Du coachst und steuerst Mitarbeiter in den Projekten.
Du hilfst unseren Kunden Gesch√§ftsprozesse und Produkte zu verbessern indem du wichtige Kennzahlen erkennst, erfasst und analysierst. Du erstellst daf√ºr Dashboards und Deep Dives und ber√§tst Kunden bei datenbasierten Gesch√§ftsentscheidungen.
Als Teil eines jungen wachsenden Teams sammelst du kontinuierlich wertvolle Erfahrung in unterschiedlichen Gesch√§ftsmodellen, oder neuen Tools und Methoden


Qualifikation

Du hast den Anspruch zu den Besten in deinem Gebiet zu geh√∂ren und bewertest und adaptierst st√§ndig neue Technologien und Methoden im Bereich Data & Analytics
Du hast 4-7 Jahre Erfahrung im Aufbau und Betrieb von modernen, anspruchsvollen und nutzerorientierten Data & Analytics L√∂sungen in einem Unternehmensumfeld
Tiefgehende Erfahrungen in zumindest einigen der folgenden Technologien und ein generelles Verst√§ndnis der anderen: Analytics (z.B. Data Studio, Tableau, Metabase, Looker, R, Python/pandas, PowerBI, SQL); Tracking (z.B. Tag Manager, Javascript, HTML, REST-API, Google Analytics, Piwik); ETL/DWH (z.B. BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift, SQL, Looker, dbt, Talend, airflow); ML (pandas, scikit learn, keras, tensorflow, BigQuery ML)
Du hast ein starkes analytisches Denkverm√∂gen und ein strukturelles Herangehen an Code- und Datenstrukturen und Interesse an wirtschaftlichen Zusammenh√§ngen
Du bringst Sachen zu Ende und achtest auf Qualit√§t und Usability
Du hast gro√üen Spa√ü an Internettechnologien und bist offen f√ºr Neues
Reisebereitschaft, haupts√§chlich arbeiten wir jedoch von Berlin aus
Gute Deutsch- && Englischkenntnisse, schriftlich und m√ºndlich
Erfahrungen aus einem Agentur oder Beratungsumfeld sind ein Plus


Benefits

Wir bieten Dir einen abwechslungsreichen Arbeitsalltag mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum als Teil eines jungen, enthusiastischen Teams mit flachen Hierarchien und Startup-Atmosph√§re
Unbefristete Anstellung mit attraktiver Verg√ºtung
Modernes, gut zu erreichendes B√ºro in Berlin (am Antonplatz), Getr√§nke und Obst inklusive, MacBook Pro 15"
Auch zuk√ºnftig hybrides Arbeitsmodell mit Team-Office-Tagen und Homeoffice
Flexible Zeiteinteilung/Gleitzeit
Wir bieten Dir Raum f√ºr fachliche und pers√∂nliche Weiterbildung
M√∂glichkeit der Mitarbeit an In-House Innovationsprojekten
Einstellungstermin: ca. Q3/Q4 2022, flexibel


Genau das was Du suchst? Dann melde dich unkompliziert mit einem kurzen Bewerbungsschreiben und einem Lebenslauf/LinkedIn/Xing-Profil hier √ºber die Plattform.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir glauben daran, dass Datenanalysen in Zukunft hinter allen Aktivit√§ten im Marketing stehen werden. Die Aufgabe des international aufgestellten Data Teams bei Digitas Pixelpark hat eine klare Mission: Mit Hilfe von Web Analytics und Machine Learning Antworten auf Fragen zu liefern, die das Marketing effektiver und effizienter machen.



Unser Data Team hilft dabei, auf Basis von Daten Antworten auf spezifische Fragestellungen zu liefern. Zur Verst√§rkung unseres Teams suchen wir einen Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d) mit guten Kenntnissen im datengetriebenen Marketing. Das Spektrum reicht dabei von eher klassischen analytischen T√§tigkeiten, √ºber die Aufbereitung und Visualisierung von gewonnen Insights in Form von Dashboards und Reports bis hin zur Beratung unserer Kunden in Web Analytics Themen.



Deine Aufgaben:



Durchf√ºhrung von Analysen im Marketing Kontext, Erstellung regelm√§√üiger KPI-Reportings und Beantwortung von ad-hoc Anfragen f√ºr unsere Kunden
Dazu z√§hlen beispielsweise Analysen des Nutzerverhaltens, der Customer Journeys, A/B-Tests oder des Erfolgs von Online Marketing Kampagnen
Unterst√ºtzung bei der Definition und Optimierung von Zielen, KPIs und Tracking Konzepten
Umsetzung und Weiterentwicklung der Tracking Konzepte und Monitoring der Dateneing√§nge
Aufbereitung von Insights in Form von Dashboards und Reportings sowie Ableitung von konkreten Handlungsempfehlungen
Beratung hinsichtlich der M√∂glichkeiten von Web Analytics, Tracking und Online Marketing sowie Weiterentwicklung unserer Web Analyse Tools
Eigenst√§ndige Vor- und Nachbereitung sowie Durchf√ºhrung von Workshops und Anwenderschulungen


Qualifikationen


Gute Kenntnisse im Bereich Online Marketing und Web Analyse
Einschl√§gige Erfahrungen mit g√§ngigen Web Analytics Tools wie z.B. Google Analytics oder Adobe Analytics, MAPP, etracker o. √§.
Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Tag Management Systemen wie z. B. dem Google Tag Manager, dem Adobe Launch oder Tealium
Erste Erfahrungen mit BI-Tools wie z.B. Tableau, Power BI, Qlik oder anderen
Kenntnisse der g√§ngigen, aktuellen Webtechnologien (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
Ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes, fachbezogenes Studium (Uni oder FH) mit Fokus auf Daten, Business Intelligence, Marktforschung oder Analytics sowie mindestens 4 Jahre Berufserfahrung
Sehr gute Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse
Eine Leidenschaft f√ºr Daten und knifflige Aufgabenstellungen sowie den Willen, dich stets mit neuen Technologien und Tools auseinanderzusetzen


Zus√§tzliche Informationen


Wir arbeiten hybrid.

Du kannst sowohl remote als auch in unseren zentral gelegenen Offices arbeiten.
Wir pflegen eine offene Kultur.

Diversit√§t, Toleranz und respektvoller Umgang sind uns wichtig und werden bei uns tagt√§glich gelebt.
Wir bieten echte Perspektiven.

Wir m√∂chten, dass du dich sukzessive weiterbildest und an Expertise dazugewinnst. Unsere internationale und stetig wachsende Learning-Plattform bietet daf√ºr eine erstklassige Basis.
Wir erm√∂glichen internationale Erfahrungen.

Mit unserem ‚ÄúWork Your World‚Äù-Programm kannst du im Ausland arbeiten und viele andere Unicorns treffen.
Wir geben dir die Flexibilit√§t, die du brauchst.

Ob du in Teilzeit arbeiten m√∂chtest oder flexible Arbeitszeiten brauchst, wir finden eine individuelle Regelung.
Wir m√∂chten, dass du dich bei uns rundum wohlf√ºhlst.

Neben Teamevents, kulturellen Initiativen und Agenturfesten kannst du dich auf zahlreiche Well-Being-Angebote freuen.
Wir unterst√ºtzen dich ganz individuell!

Unser Employee Assistance Program bietet dir individuelle Beratung und Unterst√ºtzung in allen Lebenslagen, ob beruflich oder privat.

Klingt gut f√ºr dich? Bestens! Und ‚Äì pssssst! - auch wenn du nicht alle Qualifikationen mitbringst, trau dich! Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung, die uns zeigt, was du kannst und was du lernen willst.



Und noch etwas: Menschen mit Behinderung sind bei uns immer herzlich willkommen und werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt ber√ºcksichtigt.



Wir freuen uns auf dich!
