Title: People Data & Compensation Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
We are looking for a skilled People Data & Compensation Analyst to join our ride at Blacklane‚Äôs People & Culture team. You will use tools, data, and analytical thinking to provide clear and constructive reward & data insights advice internally, in order to ensure Blacklane stays competitive and attractive to talents.




YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:

Provide support and assist with a range of total rewards initiatives including salary band review benchmarking, remuneration, bonus and long-term incentive schemes incl. Employee Stock Option Program (ESOP), pay equity analysis and so on.
Support and assist with the design and the implementation of a yearly feedback cycle.
Support to train and guide People & Culture colleagues and people managers about various compensation guidelines.
Review and develop current benefit schemes at a global scale. Collaborate closely with the People Operations team to implement the enhanced benefits if any.
Work closely with the People Business Partner team, business leads, recruitment team and relevant stakeholders to build up and implement insightful reports and dashboard systems at Blacklane.
Analyze people data and provide insights per request where necessary.
Continue to review current systems/ processes/ documentations and improve it continuously.




ABOUT YOU:

Strong analytic background. Ideally you have already solid knowledge of Compensation & benefits programs, trends and practices, preferably global exposure and people data
An advanced proficiency in G-suit, particularly Google sheets. You are capable of manipulating and presenting data accurately and efficiently.
Analytical and critical thinker. With your solution-oriented approach, you are comfortable analyzing and communicating complex concepts, understanding trends, and formulating recommendations for actions based on the analysis.
Demonstrated ability to design conceptually and implement people programs in scale-ups.
Innovative and flexible. You are the champion of staying up to date with global HR trends. You are comfortable working in ambiguity and creating solutions that achieve time-sensitive goals.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy for both numerical and written work.
Great communication and interpersonal skills. You communicate clearly with different audiences by combining narratives and data. Fluent English is required.




MORE THAN A JOB:

Blacklane is a scale-up started in 2011, founded by Jens Wohltorf and Frank Steuer who wanted to create the first global chauffeur service. We started by filling chauffeurs‚Äô ‚Äòempty leg‚Äô journeys and have grown with our partners to over ‚Ç¨100 million in annual revenue (pre-pandemic). Backed by Daimler and other investors in Germany, Japan, Switzerland, and the UAE, we‚Äôre now a trusted brand within corporate travel.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture. Responding to the pandemic, we‚Äôve successfully managed the crises and retained our talented crew!




Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days (working from home is the new normal).
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We‚Äôve banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you‚Äôre always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane has pledged to deliver 75% of its journeys in electric vehicles by 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Upgrade your career with Blacklane

Show more Show less
HTML:
We are looking for a skilled People Data & Compensation Analyst to join our ride at Blacklane‚Äôs People & Culture team. You will use tools, data, and analytical thinking to provide clear and constructive reward & data insights advice internally, in order to ensure Blacklane stays competitive and attractive to talents.


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide support and assist with a range of total rewards initiatives including salary band review benchmarking, remuneration, bonus and long-term incentive schemes incl. Employee Stock Option Program (ESOP), pay equity analysis and so on.
  • Support and assist with the design and the implementation of a yearly feedback cycle.
  • Support to train and guide People & Culture colleagues and people managers about various compensation guidelines.
  • Review and develop current benefit schemes at a global scale. Collaborate closely with the People Operations team to implement the enhanced benefits if any.
  • Work closely with the People Business Partner team, business leads, recruitment team and relevant stakeholders to build up and implement insightful reports and dashboard systems at Blacklane.
  • Analyze people data and provide insights per request where necessary.
  • Continue to review current systems/ processes/ documentations and improve it continuously.


ABOUT YOU:

  • Strong analytic background. Ideally you have already solid knowledge of Compensation & benefits programs, trends and practices, preferably global exposure and people data
  • An advanced proficiency in G-suit, particularly Google sheets. You are capable of manipulating and presenting data accurately and efficiently.
  • Analytical and critical thinker. With your solution-oriented approach, you are comfortable analyzing and communicating complex concepts, understanding trends, and formulating recommendations for actions based on the analysis.
  • Demonstrated ability to design conceptually and implement people programs in scale-ups.
  • Innovative and flexible. You are the champion of staying up to date with global HR trends. You are comfortable working in ambiguity and creating solutions that achieve time-sensitive goals.
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy for both numerical and written work.
  • Great communication and interpersonal skills. You communicate clearly with different audiences by combining narratives and data. Fluent English is required.


MORE THAN A JOB:

Blacklane is a scale-up started in 2011, founded by Jens Wohltorf and Frank Steuer who wanted to create the first global chauffeur service. We started by filling chauffeurs‚Äô ‚Äòempty leg‚Äô journeys and have grown with our partners to over ‚Ç¨100 million in annual revenue (pre-pandemic). Backed by Daimler and other investors in Germany, Japan, Switzerland, and the UAE, we‚Äôre now a trusted brand within corporate travel.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture. Responding to the pandemic, we‚Äôve successfully managed the crises and retained our talented crew!


  • Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
  • Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days (working from home is the new normal).
  • Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
  • Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
  • Fair Remuneration: We‚Äôve banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you‚Äôre always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
  • Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane has pledged to deliver 75% of its journeys in electric vehicles by 2025.
  • Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Upgrade your career with Blacklane

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) Germany
Description:
SIGNA Sports United (SSU) is the world‚Äôs leading sports e-commerce and technology platform, with market leading positions in bike, tennis, outdoor and team sports. Our group of companies include Wiggle, Fahrrad.de, Bikester, Probikeshop, Tennis-Point, and Outfitter. We are passionate about sport and staying active.

We listed on the New York Stock Exchange in December 2021 and are the largest pure-play sports e-commerce company by revenue. We serve over 7 million active customers, have 1,000+ brand partners, and 500+ connected retail stores.

Job objective

The Data Analyst position in SSU is a unique, analytical and collaborative role. You are working at the forefront connecting the business departments with data and tech. Your challenging character transfers to your analysis and you do continuously challenge the business from an operational as well as managerial perspective. This is a trigger for innovation! Your charming nature convinces people to work together, find new solutions and take a look into your outstanding results.

In this role, you are working closely with data engineers and data scientists as well as business owners. You post requests and translate requirements in both directions from business to data and vice versa. Your analysis will support the end user develop skills to learn from data and automation. In this role, you are very flexible to move closer to the business or closer to the engineering part according to the business needs as well as your personal interest.

You are working in an environment of a highly-motivated team who wants to make a difference. In this team, you will contribute to creating and shaping a very flexible analytics platform which uses state-of-the-art technologies as well as giving space for standalone apps.

The part you‚Äôll play

Create data assets which are properly authorized and leveraged group-wide.
Managing users and user roles in the analytics platform.
Improving and maintaining data quality.
Defining requirements on data provisioning pipelines.
Processing operational and confidential data according to our security guidelines.
Creating reports, in-depth analysis as well as designing standalone analytics products.
Identifying bottlenecks and recommending actions.
Working in expert as well as cross-functional teams and challenge yourself and others.
Building analytical tools to test and maintain quality of the data pipelines in order to achieve great usability, customer acquisition as well as operational efficiency.
Building the foundation of ML / AI applications having the opportunity to participate in ML activities.
Recognizing potentials and taking the chance to suggest data-driven solutions to the business.
Contributing to the actual product development journey.
Enabling the end user to adopt your product in daily business.


What You‚Äôll Bring To The Team

Hands-on, customer and quality-centric mentality.
Ability to translate business requirements as well as technical requirements into non-technical, lay terms.
Profound knowledge in methodologies of statistics and analytics.
Profound knowledge of a variety of databases with advanced skills in SQL and related methodologies in relational and non-relational databases.
Experienced and knowledgeable in handling extremely large datasets.
Flexible and creative analysis in order to point out the true root cause or source.
BSc / MSc in computer sciences, mathematics, natural sciences or similar.
5+ years experience working in data analysis or related fields.
Very beneficial skills are:
Experience in various analytics platform. (ie Tableau, Celonis)
Experience in using relevant AWS services.
Experience in workflow tools as well as the deployment of the pipelines.
Strong skills in project management and communication as well as the ability to understand organizational relations.
Passion for Sports and Tech is very welcome :)


What You Need To Know

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

We at SIGNA Sports United believe that our team-spirit burns brightest when we're together. We also believe in flexible working models. As such, we provide a place for you to come, work and collaborate in any of our offices in the country you are employed in. And of course, you can work from home if needed.

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
Data Modeler/Architect

Fully Remote

Immediate Start

6-month Initial Contract with Extensions Possible

Strong Daily Rates Paid in ‚Ç¨

(Data, Data Modelling, Data Architecture, SQL, ER Studio, Asana)




One of our enterprise customers is seeking a Data Modeler/Architect to work on a long-term program for an initial 6-month contract.




This role is fully remote, so you can be based anywhere in Europe.




This is an extremely rare and exciting opportunity to join a passionate and highly talented tech hub as they grow extensively over the next year.




My client is seeking an experienced Data Modeler/Architect to extend their current data dictionary into a more professional data model and align this with their existing data model from another existing project.




You will be responsible for building new data models provided by external parties as well as aligning, coordinating, and communicating with stakeholders in the internal function of data architecture & modeling, with the technical implementation teams, and with external stakeholders that will provide new requirements for data to be reflected into the system.




To be considered for this role you will need to have:




Expert SQL & ER Studio skills
Knowledge of Asana




If you like attending meetups, reading blogs, and getting stuck into new technology then this is for you.




If you are interested in a role that allows flexibility to work 100% remotely whilst working on one of Europe‚Äôs most prestigious projects, then please apply now so to arrange a further discussion.

Title: Data Engineer (Machine Learning) (f/m/d)
Description:
Purpose of Position

Data sits at the heart of the company. This role is to ensure that Awin is able to leverage the data it has access to across the group and build out reporting to ensure we are able to make better commercial decisions and provide best-in-class campaign management to support client facing departments.

As an AI/ML Engineer, your responsibility is to research, build and design and automate predictive models along with metrics to track there progress. You have proven communication and analysis skills. You are a strong team player, able to work with minimal supervision and keen to implement and improve our standards and working practices.

You understand data and business requirements and are able to translate into technical requirements. You write clean and high-quality code, easy to understand and maintain. You are able to implement various methodologies of data extraction, transformation and storage and successfully apply your experience and knowledge to create new and improve existing predictive models.

Within the role, you are able to break down requirements with clear instructions. As a member of Data Services department you will be working with a global team of data engineers and data analysts amongst other big data engineers within the organization.

Join our team in Germany, Spain, or the UK ‚Äì you can choose.

Key Tasks

Write clean, elegant and maintainable code with Data engineering and AI/ML best practices
Understanding business objectives and developing models that help to achieve them, along with metrics to track their progress
Find new ways solve complex business problems with self improving automated predictive models.
Evaluate existing models and recommend improvements for better result and performance efficiency
Develop best practices for building and orchestrating predictive models.
Be responsible for quality, accuracy and interpretation of the result sets.


Skills & Expertise

Strong background in data science, data engineering, business intelligence, business administration or an education with focus on math and statistics / data engineering is preferred
2+ years' experience as data engineer on AI/ML project with Python, R or similar
Strong experience with Microsoft Azure data engineering pipelines (Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Bricks, ADLS, Azure Event Hub, Azure SQL DB)
Strong knowledge of scrum practices and agile mindset
Very strong knowledge of Python (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Kera, Flask), R
Very strong knowledge in designing end to end ETL solution using Microsoft Azure technology to find available datasets that could be used for training
Strong knowledge with cloud services (Azure and AWS) and experience with BI/Data Analysis technologies
Big data, Data bricks, Spark, Scala and/or JSON experience is preferred
Very strong analytical skills to translate business need into actions with proactive approach to task and challenges, delivering project on time and budget
Very strong understanding of the principles of machine learning
Very strong project and process management competency, keen to deliver your project on time/budget without compromising on quality and results
Team player, willing to improve yourself


Our Offer

Flexi-Week and Work-Life Balance: We prioritise your mental health and wellbeing, offering you a flexible four-day Flexi-Week at full pay and with no reduction to your annual holiday allowance. We also offer a variety of different paid special leaves.
Working Wherever: Do you prefer to work from our cool office, from home, or in a completely different environment? With us, the choice is yours. We‚ÄØoffer the flexibility to work wherever you want‚ÄØwithin our Awin locations.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Health & Well Being: With our support and access to various initiatives and sports offers, you can devote yourself to your mental and physical well-being.
Development: We‚Äôve built our extensive training suite Awin Academy to cover a wide range of skills that nurture you professionally and personally, with trainings conveniently packaged together to support your overall development.
Remote Working: You will receive a monthly allowance to cover a part of your running costs. In addition, we will support you in setting up your remote workspace appropriately.
Appreciation: Thank and reward colleagues by sending them a voucher through our peer-to-peer program and show your appreciation‚ÄØfor‚ÄØcolleagues who have gone‚ÄØthe extra mile‚ÄØto support‚ÄØyou.


Established in 2000, Awin is proud of our dynamic, social and inclusive culture.

Like all businesses, we‚Äôve had to adapt and nurture our culture in a virtual environment. Our virtual ‚ÄòLife @ Awin‚Äô hub brings our colleagues from across the globe together for various social activities.

Diversity & Inclusion are paramount to us, and we proudly pursue and hire diverse team members. We champion uniqueness and authenticity; this is who we are at our core. Our network of affiliate partnerships are diverse and transparent, as are the employees powering our vision to build the world‚Äôs leading open partner ecosystem. We welcome all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need support at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Apply now to begin the next stage of your career at a progressive company that supports both your professional and personal development.

Erste Consulting-Erfahrung durch Praktika oder Nebenjobs in einer Unternehmensberatung
Gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie in mindestens einer der Programmiersprachen R oder Python
Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Regressions- oder Zeitreihenanalysen bzw. Wirksamkeitstests (A-/B-, Hypothesentests)

Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Deine Vorteile

Wir legen Wert darauf, dass sich dein Einstieg bei uns lohnt! Daher profitierst du bei uns nicht nur von einer √ºberdurchschnittlichen Verg√ºtung und allen Sozialleistungen eines Gro√üunternehmens. So findest du dich bei uns schnell zurecht ‚Äì und so kannst du von Beginn an das kollegiale Miteinander und die individuellen Weiterbildungsm√∂glichkeiten f√ºr dich entdecken.

Mobiles Arbeiten bis zu 5 Tage pro Woche

√úber flexible Arbeits-/Teilzeitmodelle kannst du dir deine Arbeitszeit ortsunabh√§ngig, d.h. vor Ort oder im mobilen Arbeiten, in Abstimmung mit deinem Vorgesetzten mit bis zu 5 Tagen pro Woche so einteilen, wie es am besten zu deiner pers√∂nlichen Situation passt.

Ein tolles Team

Gesundheit am Arbeitsplatz

Wir haben die gesundheitlichen Aspekte deines Arbeitsplatzes im Blick und ein eigenes Gesundheitsmanagement. Die Arbeitspl√§tze bei Lidl sind daher so ausgestattet, dass du dort sicher arbeiten kannst.

Moderne Ausstattung

Die IT-Ausstattung deines Arbeitsplatzes ist auf deine T√§tigkeit abgestimmt. Je nach Position bekommst du auch ein Gesch√§ftshandy oder -iPad, regelm√§√üiger Tausch gegen aktuelle Modelle inbegriffen.

Kantine

Einarbeitung nach Plan

Wir m√∂chten, dass du gut bei uns ankommst. Daher geben wir dir ausreichend Zeit, deine fachlichen Aufgaben zu erlernen. Dein Einarbeitungsplan gibt dir die n√∂tige Sicherheit fuÃàr einen guten Start und regelt alle Schritte.

Nach f√ºnf Jahren Betriebszugeh√∂rigkeit hast du die M√∂glichkeit, ein dreimonatiges Sabbatical einzulegen. Egal, was du in dieser Zeit vor hast - wir geben dir den Freiraum.

Ob Branchenkenner oder Quereinsteiger, bei Lidl kannst du dein volles Potenzial entfalten. Du √ºbernimmst schnell Verantwortung und kannst so deine Karriere gestalten. Wir unterst√ºtzen dich dabei, Herausforderungen zu meistern.

Weiterbildungen und Schulungen

Dein fachliches Wissen kannst du in Seminaren und Schulungen vertiefen. Damit qualifizierst du dich nicht nur f√ºr h√∂here Positionen, sondern entwickelst dich auch pers√∂nlich weiter.

Wertsch√§tzung

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer




Are you a German-speaking Data Engineer looking for your next challenge?




We are currently seeking a Data Engineer in Berlin to join a leading insuretech company that provides a diverse platform to insurance brokers, insurers and consumers. This role offers a high level of personal responsibility and involves the management and implementation of business intelligence projects, as well as the development of infrastructure in Azure Cloud.




The Data Engineer will perform exploratory data analysis and be responsible for the operation and monitoring of existing analyses. The role involves working across departments and with management to implement solutions with the support of our IT team.




Key requirements:

4-5 years professional experience as a Data Analyst or a similar role
Strong knowledge in SQL and proficiency in Python or R
Familiarity with data modeling and databases
Expertise in BI tools, particularly Power BI
Knowledge of data analytics and visualization
Experience with Azure Cloud (PostgreSQL, Data Factory, Databricks)
Proficiency in English and German required




On offer is an attractive compensation package including benefits, a stimulating work environment with opportunities for creativity and professional growth, flat hierarchies and fast decision-making processes and a friendly and dedicated team.




If this sparks your interest, get in touch with GR4!




We‚Äôre a forward-thinking, data-driven hive of experts who utilise analytics, research and innovative sourcing strategies to put Europe's finest tech talent at your fingertips. We handle all your organisation‚Äôs recruitment needs, from discovery to onboarding, leaving your team free to do what they do best ‚Äì drive innovation and push boundaries. We know one size doesn‚Äôt fit all.




That‚Äôs why we offer a range of bespoke solutions tailored to fit your company‚Äôs requirements.

einschl√§gige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse

ausgepr√§gte Kommunikationsf√§higkeit, um Erkenntnisse in einer klaren und sachverst√§ndlichen Sprache zu vermitteln
sicherer Umgang mit SQL und F√§higkeit, Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen zu verarbeiten

Title: Cloud Data Analyst - Azure Data Lake / Azure Data Factory (w|m|d)
Description:
STECKBRIEF




Die BridgingIT GmbH besteht seit 2008 und ist heute Teil der bridgingIT-Gruppe. Bei uns bist du an einem unserer 10 kundennahen, zentralen Standorte in Deutschland Teil einer herstellerunabh√§ngigen und produktneutralen Technologie- und Unternehmensberatung. In deinen Projekten setzt du f√ºr Start-ups, Mittelst√§ndler und globale Konzerne Digitalisierungsstrategien in den Themenfeldern Technologien, Methoden und Wertsch√∂pfung ganzheitlich um. Wir sind eine wertebasierte Organisation mit Verantwortungskultur: Werte wie menschliche N√§he, Vielfalt und Vertrauen begleiten dich t√§glich. Die 550 Kolleginnen und Kollegen unserer Gruppe finden bei uns Karriere- und Weiterbildungsm√∂glichkeiten, Flexibilit√§t und Familienfreundlichkeit.




Der Umgang mit Daten ist deine Leidenschaft und du gibst diese Begeisterung an deine Kunden weiter? Dann suchen wir dich als Data Engineer (w/m/d) f√ºr unsere technisch orientierten Data Lake Teams und freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung.




Hast du auch nur Daten im Kopf?! Auf unserer erf√§hrst du von uns mehr √ºber das m√∂gliche Arbeitsumfeld, Perspektiven, Projektrollen und Technologien.




DEINE AUFGABE




Du konzipierst und implementierst Datenfl√ºsse und Datenbanken in der Azure Cloud.
Du modellierst die notwendigen Datenstrukturen in der Azure SQL DB nach bew√§hrten Datenmodellierungsprinzipien.
Bestehende ETL und Reporting L√∂sungen werden von dir √ºber ihren ganzen Lebenszyklus √ºberwacht, gewartet und erweitert.
Du nimmst gesch√§ftliche und technische Heraus- und Anforderungen der Kunden auf und setzt diese in der Entwicklung um, erstellst zugeh√∂rige Testf√§lle und stimmst dich dabei immer eng mit dem Kunden ab.
Du ber√§tst und unterst√ºtzt bei der Entwicklung von Data Pipelines und Data Transformations.
DEIN HINTERGRUND




Du hast Know-how in der Verwendung von Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks und Azure Machine Learning.
Du bringst Verst√§ndnis f√ºr die Verarbeitung und Modellierung gro√üer, komplexer Datens√§tze f√ºr analytische Anwendungsf√§lle mit den Technologien Azure SQL und Spark mit.
Du kommunizierst effektiv und unabh√§ngig, arbeitest selbstst√§ndig und zielgerichtet, um fristgerecht qualitativ hochwertige Ergebnisse zu liefern.
Du bringst Erfahrungen in Python, PySpark, T-SQL sowie in der Versionsverwaltung mit GitHub mit.
Deine Zertifizierungen sowie Erfahrungen mit Reporting Tools, wie Tableau und Power BI oder Data Mining Tools, wie Alteryx und KNIME sind ein Plus.




DAS BIETEN WIR DIR




Durch die geographische N√§he zu unseren Kunden, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle sowie der Option vom Home-Office zu arbeiten, k√∂nnen wir bei der Planung unserer Projekte deine besondere Lebenssituation ber√ºcksichtigen.
Bei uns genie√üt du die Vorteile eines stabilen, stark wachsenden Mittelst√§ndlers mit dem Unternehmergeist eines Start-ups, bei dem Arbeiten Spa√ü macht.
Unsere respektvolle und wertsch√§tzende Firmenkultur ist gepr√§gt von Innovationskraft und Teamgeist sowie intensivem, themen√ºbergreifendem Wissens- und Erfahrungsaustausch.
Pers√∂nliches Mentoring f√ºr den optimalen Einstieg, kontinuierliche interne und externe Weiterbildungsma√ünahmen sind bei uns ebenso selbstverst√§ndlich wie individuelle Coachings, um dir den unternehmensinternen Aufstieg zu erm√∂glichen.
Vom (elektrischen) Dienstwagen, √ºber die Bahncard bis hin zum Firmenfahrrad √ºber die betriebliche Altersvorsorge. Du kannst verschiedenste Benefits w√§hlen. Und wenn du m√∂chtest kannst du dich sehr gerne in unsere gelebten Werteinitiativen ‚Äì von story&identity, smart&professional, green&social bis hin zu fun&sports ‚Äì einbringen.
Mehrmals im Jahr bieten wir dir die M√∂glichkeit, dich mit Gleichgesinnten auf unseren internen Konferenzen, wie den Community Days und den Entwicklertagen, auszutauschen. Egal, ob es sich um moderne Technologien, Projekterfahrungen oder methodische Vorgehensweisen handelt ‚Äì es werden immer spannende IT-Trends diskutiert, in Vortr√§gen pr√§sentiert oder einfach ausprobiert. Jeder ist herzlich willkommen, mitzuwirken und teilzunehmen.

√úber unser Formular kannst Du einfach und bequem Deine Bewerbung hochladen.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
It's important to find a company that has a mission that is important to you. If you're passionate about driving towards a more sustainable way of living and believe that Data & Analytics play an important part in that mission, then this could be an interesting opportunity for you. This company is on a great path, already with millions of customers (which means a lot of interesting data!) and across multiple regions!




In this company, you would be leading complex and strategic projects that would impact the data function and drive opportunities to make data science and analytics more impactful.




This position will require you to architect, build and maintain data models and pipelines, in conjunction with the data engineering team.




They are looking for someone experienced with data modeling, large-scale data warehouses, confident working with python, and a modern cloud environment.




Apply below if you would like to find out more!

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Dentolo is one of the fastest-growing insurance start-ups in Europe and you will work together with us on providing the digital backbone of our insurance platform.

Your work will range from customer-focused development to workflow automation and internal tools to help our team and customers have a seamless experience.

Your Role in our team

You will take over responsibility for setting up a modern data infrastructure and migrating step by step from our current infrastructure to the new one.
This includes the setup of the environment in AWS (airbyte, airflow, dbt) with terraform as well as the configuration of the three tools named.
You will support our Analytics Engineer / Data Analyst by providing them with the data they need by writing transformation in dbt.
You work together with our Engineering team to adapt infrastructure best practices
You collaborate with our different teams (e.g. Product, Marketing, Sales, Operations) to prepare data and reports that drive decisions.
You use your knowledge and ideas to contribute to our overall data strategy, especially with focus on our future data setup.
You initiate and take over your own projects in fields of your interest.
You use your passion for data to foster our dentolo data culture.


What you need to be successful:

2+ years of experience in data engineering or business intelligence
At least one year of experience with terraform and AWS.
Advanced knowledge of SQL. Experience with writing and optimizing complex queries and handling of complex data structures, preferably with dbt.
You have experience with Python and code versioning (Git)
We would love if you already worked with Airflow and Airbyte.
You have a strong interest in business-related topics and can have proven that you can connect the data you work with to real-world operative challenges and business questions posed.
Excellent communication skills and strong analytical thinking.
You have an eye for details and can break down complex problems.
You have great spoken and written English.
Living in Germany, ideally in Berlin.


Target achievements for the next couple of months:

Familiarize with our data landscape, understand how the processes work and challenge them based on your expertise and ‚Äúoutside‚Äù view.
Get to know the team and the relevant stakeholders and gain an understanding for their roles and requirements towards our data.
Set up a concrete plan for setting up the infrastructure that we are eager to work with in the future, as well as a plan for the step-by-step migration.
Go the first steps by setting up the fundament of the new infrastructure in AWS
Share your knowledge with the current team members and educate them in the usage of new tools.


Why dentolo?

One of Europe‚Äôs fastest growing Insurtechs, backed long-term by one of the largest insurance powerhouses worldwide.
High level of collaboration and autonomy, working in a group of international colleagues in a small to medium sized startup with a getting-things-done attitude.
Cutting-edge technologies, agile development practices, and a product-focused environment that tackles demanding technical and scaling challenges.
6th floor office in the heart of Berlin (Mitte/ Prenzlauer Berg) with beautiful views over the city.
Quarterly team budget for various events, you decide :)
Annual learning budget for your personal development.
Flexible work arrangements according to your needs.
Vacation entitlement starting with 28 days in your first year, accumulating 1 day with every 2 years of affiliation to the max. 30 days.
Free dental or pet insurance - to experience our products yourself.
Independent booking of monthly coaching sessions with nilo.health, our mental health tool.
Transportation benefit - you can choose between a free Swapfiets bike or a BVG eco-ticket (with a dentolo allowance).
Work up to 60 days from outside of Germany!
Free choice of a Windows or Mac computer.


Sounds like the perfect job for you?

We look forward to receiving your application and getting to know you!

dentolo is an equal opportunity and diversity employer. We strive to create a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for all our team members, regardless of ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, limitations and talents of any kind, physical appearance, social background, marital status, age, or religion (or lack thereof).

When you apply, we focus solely on your experience and motivation. You decide what additional information you want to disclose (photo, marital status, religion, gender, nationality, etc.). We value and treat all applications equally.

About Dentolo

We don‚Äôt just offer insurance. We create solutions tailored to needs.

Founded in 2015, dentolo builds and operates holistic insurance solutions, radically centered around you. We believe in offering a solution for everyone‚Äôs individual needs, so that they and their loved ones can be more carefree. Our solutions are built through conversations with our customers, teams and market specialists. We call this our expert insurance approach.

Today, every fourth new online customer in Germany chooses us as their partner for dental and pet health insurance. Our first two brands, dentolo and petolo, are rated 4.5+ of 5 on Google - unlike any other provider. We are customer-obsessed experts that love working together as a team. Our culture is built on collaboration, fast execution and bold actions, always caring about the customer first.

Contact:

Valeriia Vasko

Tech Recruiter

vvasko@dentolo.de

Title: Data engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Dentolo is one of the fastest-growing insurance start-ups in Europe and you will work together with us on providing the digital backbone of our insurance platform.

Your work will range from customer-focused development to workflow automation and internal tools to help our team and customers have a seamless experience.

Tasks

You will take over responsibility for setting up a modern data infrastructure and migrating step by step from our current infrastructure to the new one.
This includes the setup of the environment in AWS (airbyte, airflow, dbt) with terraform as well as the configuration of the three tools named.
You will support our Analytics Engineer / Data Analyst by providing them with the data they need by writing transformation in dbt.
You work together with our Engineering team to adapt infrastructure best practices
You collaborate with our different teams (e.g. Product, Marketing, Sales, Operations) to prepare data and reports that drive decisions.
You use your knowledge and ideas to contribute to our overall data strategy, especially with focus on our future data setup.
You initiate and take over your own projects in fields of your interest.
You use your passion for data to foster our dentolo data culture.


Requirements

2+ years of experience in data engineering or business intelligence
At least one year of experience with terraform and AWS.
Advanced knowledge of SQL. Experience with writing and optimizing complex queries and handling of complex data structures, preferably with dbt.
You have experience with Python and code versioning (Git)
We would love if you already worked with Airflow and Airbyte.
You have a strong interest in business-related topics and can have proven that you can connect the data you work with to real-world operative challenges and business questions posed.
Excellent communication skills and strong analytical thinking.
You have an eye for details and can break down complex problems.
You have great spoken and written English.
Living in Germany, ideally in Berlin.


Target achievements for the next couple of months:

Familiarize with our data landscape, understand how the processes work and challenge them based on your expertise and ‚Äúoutside‚Äù view.
Get to know the team and the relevant stakeholders and gain an understanding for their roles and requirements towards our data.
Set up a concrete plan for setting up the infrastructure that we are eager to work with in the future, as well as a plan for the step-by-step migration.
Go the first steps by setting up the fundament of the new infrastructure in AWS
Share your knowledge with the current team members and educate them in the usage of new tools.


Benefits

One of Europe‚Äôs fastest growing Insurtechs, backed long-term by one of the largest insurance powerhouses worldwide.
High level of collaboration and autonomy, working in a group of international colleagues in a small to medium sized startup with a getting-things-done attitude.
Cutting-edge technologies, agile development practices, and a product-focused environment that tackles demanding technical and scaling challenges.
6th floor office in the heart of Berlin (Mitte/ Prenzlauer Berg) with beautiful views over the city.
Quarterly team budget for various events, you decide :)
Annual learning budget for your personal development.
Flexible work arrangements according to your needs.
Vacation entitlement starting with 28 days in your first year, accumulating 1 day with every 2 years of affiliation to the max. 30 days.
Free dental or pet insurance - to experience our products yourself.
Independent booking of monthly coaching sessions with nilo.health, our mental health tool.
Transportation benefit - you can choose between a free Swapfiets bike or a BVG eco-ticket (with a dentolo allowance).
Work up to 60 days from outside of Germany!
Free choice of a Windows or Mac computer.


Sounds like the perfect job for you?

We look forward to receiving your application and getting to know you!

dentolo is an equal opportunity and diversity employer. We strive to create a friendly, safe, and welcoming environment for all our team members, regardless of ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, limitations and talents of any kind, physical appearance, social background, marital status, age, or religion (or lack thereof).

When you apply, we focus solely on your experience and motivation. You decide what additional information you want to disclose (photo, marital status, religion, gender, nationality, etc.). We value and treat all applications equally.

About Dentolo

We don‚Äôt just offer insurance. We create solutions tailored to needs.

Founded in 2015, dentolo builds and operates holistic insurance solutions, radically centered around you. We believe in offering a solution for everyone‚Äôs individual needs, so that they and their loved ones can be more carefree. Our solutions are built through conversations with our customers, teams and market specialists. We call this our expert insurance approach.

Today, every fourth new online customer in Germany chooses us as their partner for dental and pet health insurance. Our first two brands, dentolo and petolo, are rated 4.5+ of 5 on Google - unlike any other provider. We are customer-obsessed experts that love working together as a team. Our culture is built on collaboration, fast execution and bold actions, always caring about the customer first.

Contact:

Valeriia Vasko

Tech Recruiter

vvasko(at)dentolo.de

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst - Berlin
Description:
As Spendesk‚Äôs Senior Marketing Data Analyst, your mission is to build and scale our audience management efforts, supporting the Growth teams across Marketing and Sales. This role is focused on enabling our Marketing and Sales teams to reach the right audiences for their campaigns, across inbound and outbound channels using advanced database skills and experience in optimising marketing and/or sales campaigns.




Reporting to our Growth Operations Lead, you will be joining a smart, ambitious team who works together to develop customer-centric, multi-channel campaigns to drive real results. Our ideal candidate is analytical, action-oriented, an excellent communicator, comfortable with a test and learn atmosphere, and willing to wear multiple hats.




Key Responsibilities




Develop the audience management roadmap for Spendesk, including sourcing, managing, defining, analysing and activating customer data across our allbound channels.
Lead projects related to audience insights and analysis of segment performance, effectively communicating your findings to stakeholders at all levels of the business.
Work with and manipulate large, complex datasets (first and third-party) for audience analysis and activation.
Partner with leadership across Data, Marketing and Sales to achieve and surpass business goals.
Deliver on multiple initiatives in the same timeframe with minimal supervision.
Drive process improvements to increase efficiencies across the organisation, including audience targeting and segmentation, account sourcing, account enrichment and attribute management.
Serve as a strategic advisor to our internal stakeholders on topics such as data sourcing, data usage, and data insights.




Experience, Skills And Qualifications




Bachelor‚Äôs degree.
A minimum of 5 years in an operations role (Marketing, Sales, Revenue), with experience focus on marketing or sales audiences.
3+ years experience with data analysis and storytelling.
3+ years experience turning data into insights and presenting to internal and/or external stakeholders.
SQL proficiency and experience working with unstructured data from multiple sources.
Advanced Excel




Preferred Qualifications




Hands-on experience of working with Snowflake (DwH), Salesforce (CRM) and Hightouch (Reverse-ETL) (or comparable tools).
Experience in leading impactful audience-related or segmentation projects.
Experience in communicating and collaborating with cross-functional teams (e.g, marketing, sales, finance, and data enablement) at various levels (e.g, peers to senior leadership).
Outstanding team player and always trying to solve for Spendesk‚Äôs best interest.
Fluency in English (as it's our business language).
Proven aptitude for learning new technologies and processes.




As we are an international team, please submit your application and CV in English.




About Spendesk




Spendesk is the 7-in-1 spending solution built for finance teams to make faster, smarter spending decisions. Founded in 2016, Spendesk is now one of the fastest-growing fintechs in Europe, with over 4,000 customers and an international team of 500+ employees based in Paris, Berlin, London, Hamburg, and remote. We‚Äôve raised over ‚Ç¨260M from leading investors, and been named a French tech unicorn. And we‚Äôre not stopping there!




About Our People & Culture




We believe that people do their best work when they‚Äôre given the freedom to thrive and grow. That‚Äôs why liberation is at the core of everything we do. We empower Spendeskers to take ownership of their work, to navigate ambiguity, and seize every opportunity. Spendeskers come from all over the world (35+ countries and counting!) but we have plenty in common: we're bold, ever-curious, committed to kindness, and tackle every challenge with a positive mindset.




About Our Benefits




Our culture is built on trust, empowerment, and growth ‚Äî with benefits to match!




100% reimbursed public transport to the office or bike perk of 30 Euro
Latest Apple equipment (MacBook Air)
28 days of annual leave
Monthly budget of ‚Ç¨50 for wellness-related spending
Access to Moka.care (platform for emotional and mental well-being)
A friendly remote policy
3 days onboarding trip to Paris & access to our other offices across Europe
Great office snacks to fuel your day
A positive team to work with daily!




Diversity & Inclusion




At Spendesk, we're committed to fostering an environment where all differences are encouraged, supported and celebrated. We're building our culture for everyone, with everyone. Our goal is to attract and build a diverse, equal and inclusive team, where everyone feels welcome and we truly embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.




What you can expect from the hiring process:




A video call with one of our Talent Acquisition Partners to fully understand your career aspirations and answer any questions you have
A series of video calls with members of the team to align on what they will expect from you, and assess your technical skills and job fit
A final video call with the Hiring Manager, Head-Of or CEO depending on the seniority level to review any remaining questions

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Senior Data Engineer - Remote - Berlin




(Hybrid working model is an option too)




Looking for your chance to contribute to one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe during an exciting time of growth. Don't worry you wont be alone, you'll be working alongside the entire engineering team.




You will participate in the data architecture design and decision making process by streamlining the transformation of raw data sources into powerful, reliable components for their data lake.




What you'll need:




AWS OR GCP - this would have to be one of your area's of expertise.

As the company thrives in a DevOps culture experience with Terraform and terra-grunt is a bonus!

Your primary languages would be Python and SQL

Experience with streaming services - Another bonus but not essential!







Benefits:

Personal development budget

Competitive salary, stock options as well as annual bonuses

Clear career path within the organization

Job Description

Wer sind wir?

Bei Avanade sind wir nicht nur stolz darauf, unsere Kund:innen bei ihren Anliegen rund um Cloud, Modern Workplace, Business Applications (ERP & CRM), Data & AI oder Security zu beraten und zu unterst√ºtzen, sondern wir sind auch stolz auf unsere #PeopleFirst Mentalit√§t.

In den Projekten arbeitest du mit folgenden Technologien - DevOps, SQL, Python und viel mehr.
Du bringst dich aktiv in der Community ein und teilst deine Projekterfahrung sowie dein Wissen und gewinnst im gegenseitigen Austausch einen Einblick in die Erfahrungen deiner Kolleg:innen.


Was bringst Du mit?


Du bringst einschl√§gige Projekterfahrung im Analytics-Umfeld in einer der folgenden Branchen mit: Automotive, Life Science, Finance, Manufacturing.
Du hast ausgepr√§gtes Verst√§ndnis f√ºr betriebswirtschaftliche Prozesse und komplexe IT-L√∂sungen, idealerweise im Umfeld der Microsoft Technologien.
Du verf√ºgst √ºber fundierte Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen im Bereich Requirements Engineering.
Analytisch-konzeptionelles Denkverm√∂gen und Probleml√∂sungskompetenz zeichnen dich aus.

Was bieten wir Dir?


Vertrauen, Verantwortung und Wertsch√§tzung: Wir als Avanade sind ein gro√ües, internationales Unternehmen ‚Äì dennoch wollen wir den Unternehmergeist eines Start-ups beibehalten. Jedes Mitglied bei Avanade wird gleich wertgesch√§tzt und respektiert. Daher ist es uns wichtig, dass du auch sofort das Vertrauen erh√§ltst, Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen innerhalb unseres gro√üen Projektportfolios mit Kolleg:innen, die einander wertsch√§tzen.
Onboarding: Uns ist es sehr wichtig, dass du dich sofort wohl und willkommen f√ºhlst. Ein optimaler Einstieg wird dir mit unserem dreit√§gigen Onboarding-Programm (derzeit online) gew√§hrt, bei welchem du alle relevanten Informationen und Einblicke in unseren Arbeitsalltag bekommst.‚ÄØ
Career Coaching: Vom ersten Tag an hast du einen Career Adviser an deiner Seite, der dich unterst√ºtzt, coacht, vernetzt und auch hilft, deinen Platz und deine Balance bei uns zu finden.
Weiterbildung: Eine kostenlose pers√∂nliche‚ÄØMSDN Subscription‚ÄØinklusive Azure Kontingent und unbegrenzter Zugang zu Microsoft Zertifizierungen sowie 80 Stunden Trainingsbudget bringen dich noch weiter.

Flexibles Arbeiten: Ein‚ÄØflexibles Arbeitszeitmodell mit der M√∂glichkeit auf Home-office, maximale Flexibilit√§t durch die "Alternative Work Week" und Option eines ‚ÄØDienstwagens (ab Manager Level) sowie‚ÄØeine weltweite Unfallversicherung.
Ausstattung: Bei uns bekommst du f√ºrs Home-office State-of-the-Art Equipment (Laptop, Smartphone inkl. privater Nutzung). Egal ob Arbeit im modernen B√ºro oder in deinem Home-office ‚Äì dir soll es bei der technischen Ausstattung an nichts fehlen.
Anerkennung: Mit‚ÄØGo Team! (Kudos)‚ÄØhaben wir ein internes‚ÄØsteuerfreies‚ÄØPr√§mienprogramm‚ÄØzur Anerkennung f√ºr‚ÄØherausragende Leistungen etabliert.
Weitere Extras: Zudem kannst du dich √ºber unser Private Device Leasing g√ºnstig mit diversen technischen Ger√§ten ausstatten sowie an einem Jobrad-Programm teilnehmen.

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

  • Ausstattung: Bei uns bekommst du f√ºrs Home-office State-of-the-Art Equipment (Laptop, Smartphone inkl. privater Nutzung). Egal ob Arbeit im modernen B√ºro oder in deinem Home-office ‚Äì dir soll es bei der technischen Ausstattung an nichts fehlen.
  • Anerkennung: Mit‚ÄØGo Team! (Kudos)‚ÄØhaben wir ein internes‚ÄØsteuerfreies‚ÄØPr√§mienprogramm‚ÄØzur Anerkennung f√ºr‚ÄØherausragende Leistungen etabliert.
  • Weitere Extras: Zudem kannst du dich √ºber unser Private Device Leasing g√ºnstig mit diversen technischen Ger√§ten ausstatten sowie an einem Jobrad-Programm teilnehmen.
  • Benefits: Weitere Benefits haben wir f√ºr dich hier zusammengefasst: Link

Wir glauben daran, dass inklusive und diverse Teams jede Challenge meistern ‚Äì wer sich Herausforderungen mit Leidenschaft und Mut stellt, ist bei uns genau richtig. Bei uns kannst Du einfach Du sein - unabh√§ngig deiner Herkunft, Nationalit√§t, Glaube, Behinderung, Alter, Familienstand, Partnerschaftsstatus, sexueller Orientierung und deines Geschlechts. Vielfalt in jeder Form ist ein fester Bestandteil der Avanade-Kultur.

Klingt interessant?

Dann bewirb Dich jetzt gleich ganz unkompliziert mit deinem CV √ºber unser Online-Portal.

Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich pers√∂nlich kennen zu lernen!

Hast Du noch offene Fragen? Dann schreib uns gerne: https://www.avanade.com/en/contact

Du m√∂chtest mehr √ºber uns erfahren?

Dann wirf einen Blick auf unseren Being Orange Blog | Leben bei Avanade sowie unseren Videokanal und Podcastkanal , damit Du uns noch besser kennenlernen kannst. Folge uns gerne auf Social Media , um keine Neuigkeiten zu verpassen :

Auszeichnungen

About Avanade

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

We have been recognized as Microsoft‚Äôs Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.

We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.

Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre Ookla, the company behind Speedtest, Downdetector, and an ever-expanding suite of connectivity tools. Our team is a group of people brought together through passion and inspired by possibility. We are looking for team members who enjoy solving complex problems, are motivated to challenge themselves, and are delighted with turning clever ideas into unique products.

Millions of tests are performed through our products and thousands of data points are collected globally every day. With all this usage comes countless ways to dissect and analyze our data, and plenty of exciting opportunities to optimize our monetization strategy. When you work for us, you are using Ookla data and insights to further our mission to improve connectivity for all.

Ookla‚Äôs data science team is looking for a data analyst to help us dive deep to analyze, understand, and communicate key insights about internet access and performance around the world. Our company, known for Speedtest and Downdetector, is a team of passionate individuals who have turned clever ideas into unique products and a thriving business. Globally, millions of tests are performed every day across the Speedtest ecosystem. All that usage provides countless ways to dissect and analyze our data. It also empowers us to help make the internet better, faster, and more accessible for everyone. If you crave the chance to do your best work in a flexible work environment where we value individuality and fun as much as we value talent, we want to hear from you.

As a data analyst, your primary focus will be enabling internal and external customers to gain insights from the vast Ookla dataset. Successful applicants will have an inquisitive nature, a creative approach to solving problems, excellent communication skills, and a strong drive for data advocacy. We‚Äôre especially interested in candidates who also have experience with time series analysis, geospatial clustering, and anomaly detection.

We are committed to providing you a flexible work environment where individuality, fun, and talent are all valued equally. If you consider yourself innovative, adept at collaboration, and you care deeply about the work you do, we want to talk!

Responsibilities

Identify significant patterns in large, unlabeled data sets
Support teams across the business through exploratory analysis, custom reporting, and quality assurance
Work closely with technical account managers to resolve customer data questions
Create tools for identifying data trends and telling stories


Requirements

We are looking for the right person, not the exact list of requirements. If you believe your life experience has prepared you for similar challenges, we‚Äôd like to hear from you.

Collaborative mindset with a strong drive to learn from and teach others
The ability to communicate and tell stories with data through data visualization, statistical analysis, and writing
Strong familiarity with R (or Python) for data analysis and SQL for accessing large data sets
Experience applying statistical methods to real-world challenges
Proven history of exceptional customer service and advocacy
Experience with internet, cellular, and broadband technologies nice to have


Benefits

We care deeply about each other and the work we do, and our perks are just one way we demonstrate this. We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including (but not limited to):

401(k) matching,
Flex Friday,
unlimited PTO,
ESPP options,
health/dental/vision insurance coverage, and
enhanced parental leave.


You will have the best hardware, software, and tools available for you to do your work, and we provide excellent flexibility for working remotely as time and responsibilities allow. To promote your success and growth, we offer tuition reimbursement, educational opportunities, and anti-racism and LGBTQIA+ resource libraries. Transit passes, team happy hours and activities, and gym reimbursements are only a few of the additional, outstanding perks available to you at Ookla!

If you‚Äôre passionate about joining the work we‚Äôre doing, we welcome your application and encourage applicants with both traditional and non-traditional experience that makes them an excellent candidate for the role. We strongly believe diversity of all kinds makes us better. We are an equal opportunity employer actively working to build an inclusive workforce at all levels of the company. [Read our latest diversity report from our parent company here.]

We want to ensure candidates have everything they need throughout our application and hiring process. If you have any individual needs related to disability or accessibility, we encourage you to contact and let us know how we can best accommodate you.

The salary range reflected is an estimate of average pay for the primary location. This range may vary if an offer is made for work in a different location. Salary range for this role: $100,000 - $120,000.

Title: Data Analyst - Tiktok Ads
Description:
Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.
The mission of TikTok Monetization Platform is to connect global advertisers, merchants, affiliates and users to get suitable marketing solutions and conversion funnels, to maximize conversion and monetization opportunities. Our vision is to build an easy-to-understand, easy-to-use and powerful platform for onsite commerce.

We are looking for data analysts to join the efforts driving monetization,
- Apply expertise in data analysis and visualization to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with our ads products.
- Deliver data support for both short term and long term business development plans from strategic scope and execution aspects with in-depths analysis.
- Work closely with key cross functional teams such as product managers, data science, and engineers to solve business problems.
- Build/maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics to monitor the performance of business products.

Qualifications

- Bachelor's degree with a background in Math, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, or other quantitative fields;
- Expert experience pulling large and complex data using SQL and writing data pipelines.
- Experience with a data visualization tool (e.g. Tableau);

Prefer to Have
- Experience doing quantitative analysis;
- Development experience in at least one scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.);
- Excellent verbal and written English communication skills;
- Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop) a plus

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at USRC@tiktok.com.

Job Information:

„ÄêFor Pay Transparency„ÄëCompensation Description (annually)

The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $114000 - $209000 annually.‚Äã

Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate‚Äôs qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.‚Äã

At ByteDance/TikTok our benefits are designed to convey company culture and values, to create an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to support ByteDancers to give their best in both work and life. We offer the following benefits to eligible employees: ‚Äã

We cover 100% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, 80% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account(HSA) with a company match. As well as Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life and AD&D insurance plans. In addition to Flexible Spending Account(FSA) Options like Health Care, Limited Purpose and Dependent Care. ‚Äã

Our time off and leave plans are: 10 paid holidays per year plus 17 days of Paid Personal Time Off(PPTO) (prorated upon hire and increased by tenure) and 10 paid sick days per year as well as 12 weeks of paid Parental leave and 8 weeks of paid Supplemental Disability. ‚Äã

We also provide generous benefits like mental and emotional health benefits through our EAP and Lyra. A 401K company match, gym and cellphone service reimbursements. The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.‚Äã

Title: Data Analyst 2 - Marketing Optimization Analytics
Description:
Job Description




As an integral part of our Digital Analytics team, the data analyst 2 is responsible for collecting, analyzing and presenting data to improve decision making around customer experience projects in Nordstrom‚Äôs high-growth Direct online channel. This individual should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. They should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.




A day in the life‚Ä¶

Partner with key stakeholders on data analysis problems
Mine complex digital behavioral data and transform it into actionable information
Apply common statistical methods, data modeling, and predictive analysis to answer strategic questions for the online business
Use advanced data visualization techniques to communicate solutions to business stakeholders
Provide exceptional customer service through professionalism, ownership and initiative
Demonstrate productivity through the efficient use of time and a commitment to strong results




You own this if you have‚Ä¶

Quantitative degree (preferably a Master's degree) in mathematics, statistics, computer science, engineering, or similar quantitative analytics discipline
1+ year of corporate data analysis experience in online analytics (online retail a plus)
1+ year of corporate experience writing SQL queries from scratch
1+ year of professional experience using R or Python in an analytics capacity
Working understanding of statistics
Strong verbal and written communication skills, ability to convey results to cross functional partners




We‚Äôve got you covered‚Ä¶

Our employees are our most important asset and that‚Äôs reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:

Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away
Life Insurance and Disability
Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources




A few more important points...




The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It‚Äôs not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, responsibilities and qualifications for this job.

Nordstrom will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.




Applicants with disabilities who require assistance or accommodation should contact the nearest Nordstrom location, which can be identified at www.nordstrom.com.




¬© 2022 Nordstrom, Inc




Current Nordstrom employees: To apply, log into Workday, click the Careers button and then click Find Jobs.




Pay Range Details

The pay range(s) below are provided in compliance with state specific laws. Pay ranges may be different in other locations.

California: $76,500 - $144,500 Annually, Colorado: $76,500 - $125,500 Annually, Nevada: $76,500 - $125,500 Annually, New York: $76,500 - $144,500 Annually, Rhode Island: $76,500 - $125,500 Annually, Washington: $76,500 - $144,500 Annually

Title: Data Analyst - Remote
Description:
Symetra has an exciting opportunity to join our team as an Data Analyst!

About The Role

The Data Analyst uses data to solve business problems. You‚Äôll use complex information to report on trends and reach conclusions. You will also use business intelligence and analytics tools to find patterns, insights, and develop key performance indicators. While taking on analytics projects, the Data Analyst will demonstrate innovative ways to use existing and new data sources to produce enhanced metrics which drive strategic business decisions.

Responsibilities

Builds a working understanding of Symetra products, its customers, data‚ÄØinfrastructure, and business goals.
Analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources using a variety of tools and data analysis techniques
Understands basic business performance and answers product and business questions to drive business actions.
Identifies and evaluates the quality of different data sources used for key result/metric calculations.
Operationalizes compelling self-service dashboards and tools.
Reflects on the requirements or directions provided on a project idea to anticipate gaps and provides recommendations for improved delivery.
Occasionally plans and facilitates stakeholder requirements sessions and leverage business perspective.

What We Offer You

‚ÄúIf you want to invest in yourself and build a career, this is a great place to work. If you don't want to put in the effort to learn the industry and become a student of the business (it takes real effort!), there are easier places to work.‚Äù Cris H. - AVP Internal Sales, Training and Development

‚ÄúSymetra is inclusive of all employees regardless of their personal differences.‚Äù Darrell J. - Actuary III

‚ÄúSymetra values learning. Symetra has so many resources - whether that is the Student of the Business courses, sponsorship of professional certifications, or just individual employees being so willing to teach and answer questions.‚Äù Felicia D. - Financial Reporting Lead Senior Analyst

Benefits And Perks

We don‚Äôt take a ‚Äúone-size-fits-all‚Äù approach when it comes to our employees. Our programs are designed to make your life better both at work and at home.

Flexible full-time or hybrid telecommuting arrangements
Plan for your future with our 401(k) plan and take advantage of immediate vesting and company matching up to 6%
Paid time away including vacation and sick time, flex days and ten paid holidays
Give back to your community and double your impact through our company matching
Want more details? Check out our Symetra Benefits Overview

Compensation

Salary Range: $71,700 - $119,500 plus eligibility for annual bonus program

Your Education, Experience And Skills

Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field and/or 2+ years of equivalent professional experience required.
Experience with reporting tools like SQL, Power BI, Tableau.
Ability to understand and interpret imperfect data.
Experience with data modeling and working with large-scale data.
Partner with Data Analytics team members and business stakeholders to develop solutions.
ETL development and understanding of data warehousing concepts.

We empower inclusion

At Symetra, we‚Äôre building a place where every employee feels valued, respected, and has opportunities to contribute. Inclusion is about recognizing our assumptions, considering multiple perspectives, and removing barriers.

We accept and celebrate diverse experiences, identities, and perspectives, because lifting each other up fuels thought and builds a stronger, more innovative company. We invite you to learn more about our efforts here.

In a complex industry, we strive for clarity.

Symetra is a dynamic and growing financial services company with 60 years of experience and customers nationwide. In our daily work delivering retirement, employee benefits, and life insurance products, we're guided by the principles of VALUE, TRANSPARENCY AND SUSTAINABILITY. That means we provide products and services people need at a competitive price, we communicate clearly and honestly so people understand what they're getting, and we build products that stand the test of time. We work hard and do what's right for our customers, communities, and employees. Join our team and share in our success as we work toward becoming the next national player in our industry.

For more information about our careers visit www.symetra.com/careers.

Work Authorization

Employer work visa sponsorship and support are not provided for this role. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States at hire and must maintain authorization to work in the United States throughout their employment with our company.

  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field and/or 2+ years of equivalent professional experience required.
  • Experience with reporting tools like SQL, Power BI, Tableau.
  • Ability to understand and interpret imperfect data.
  • Experience with data modeling and working with large-scale data.
  • Partner with Data Analytics team members and business stakeholders to develop solutions.
  • ETL development and understanding of data warehousing concepts.
We empower inclusion

At Symetra, we‚Äôre building a place where every employee feels valued, respected, and has opportunities to contribute. Inclusion is about recognizing our assumptions, considering multiple perspectives, and removing barriers.

We accept and celebrate diverse experiences, identities, and perspectives, because lifting each other up fuels thought and builds a stronger, more innovative company. We invite you to learn more about our efforts here.

In a complex industry, we strive for clarity.

Symetra is a dynamic and growing financial services company with 60 years of experience and customers nationwide. In our daily work delivering retirement, employee benefits, and life insurance products, we're guided by the principles of VALUE, TRANSPARENCY AND SUSTAINABILITY. That means we provide products and services people need at a competitive price, we communicate clearly and honestly so people understand what they're getting, and we build products that stand the test of time. We work hard and do what's right for our customers, communities, and employees. Join our team and share in our success as we work toward becoming the next national player in our industry.

For more information about our careers visit www.symetra.com/careers.

Work Authorization

Employer work visa sponsorship and support are not provided for this role. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States at hire and must maintain authorization to work in the United States throughout their employment with our company.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST (Power BI, DAX, and Power Query)




Be a part of our success story. Launch offers talented and motivated people the opportunity to do the best work of their lives in a dynamic and growing company. Through competitive salaries, outstanding benefits, internal advancement opportunities, and recognized community involvement, you will have the chance to create a career you can be proud of. Your new trajectory starts here at Launch.




We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will have a strong background in Business Intelligence and experience designing data models, creating dashboards and interactive reports, and converting business requirements into technical specifications. The ideal candidate will be proficient in Power BI, DAX, and Power Query, and have experience performing DAX queries and functions, creating customized charts and custom calculations, and developing tabular and multidimensional data models. This is a challenging and rewarding opportunity for a highly motivated and experienced Data Analyst to join a fast-growing company and make a significant impact on the business.




Responsibilities




Understand business requirements in BI context and design data models to transform raw data into meaningful insights.
Create dashboards and interactive visual reports using Power BI.
Convert business requirements into technical specifications.
Create relationships between data and develop tabular and other multidimensional data models.
Perform DAX queries and functions in Power BI.
Create customized charts and custom calculations as per requirements.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in all reporting and analysis.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze data, develop insights, and provide recommendations.
Required Experience/Qualifications:




Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics)
At least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst
Proficiency in Power BI, DAX, and Power Query
Strong knowledge of data modeling concepts and experience creating tabular and multidimensional data models
Experience with data visualization, dashboards, and interactive reports
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Familiarity with SQL and other data manipulation tools is a plus
Compensation and Benefits:




Anticipated Wage Range: $115,000.00 ‚Äì $132,000.00 ‚Äì Education and experience will be taken into account, and we are happy to discuss your wage expectations.
Competitive Benefits (PPO and HSA, Dental, Vision, AD&D, STD, LTD, FSA, Pet, Legal, etc.) *employees and immediate family members*
401k offered with company match.
Paid Time Off
Education reimbursement
8 paid holidays
We are Navigators in the Age of Transformation.




We use sophisticated technology to transform clients into the digital age, but our top priority is our positive impact on the human experience. We ease anxiety and fear around digital transformation and replace it with opportunity.




Qualified applicants, please respond to LCG-inquire@launchcg.com with your full name, resume, and a brief description of how your skills match the requirements above. Please refer to job #7372




Launch Consulting is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Junior Data Analyst

Location: Redmond, WA (Hybrid)

Contract: ASAP- June 30th 2023; Strong potential for extension




IFG is on the search for a Data Analyst to support our client‚Äôs team. Our client is a global trillion-dollar tech company, at the forefront of cutting-edge technology.




Responsibilities:

Responsible for data de-duplication (matching and merging data), data cleansing (matching, linking, updating records, such as organization records, in batch and real time), hierarchy management (identifying, creating, correcting, update, and maintaining complex relationships among parent and child records), and data conversion (changing / transforming the data based on business rules, usually done before the data is integrated into a new system).
Also raises escalations and communicates issues to DOC Project Lead.

Undergraduate or Master studies student with high GPA.
Proficiency in English (verbal and written).
Advanced computer literacy.
Team-oriented attitude and excellent interpersonal skills.
Commitment to accuracy, quality and attention to details.
Experience with SQL
Excel programing
Experience with Power BI







This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this position. The actual duties, responsibilities and qualifications may vary based on assignment.







IFG is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all.
